story:
Short Summary

I am a mother-to-be interested in working towards being a stay at home parent! I've been doing my art for years, but haven't had the opportunity to complete an entire volume of comics---that is, until now!

The comic will follow Nappy Queen (a mother of color) as she navigates this often f***ed up universe. The strips are funny, educational, creative, and sometimes political. This campaign is meant to kick start that dream by helping me get the word out about Nappy Queen. Getting this initial $500 will allow me to complete a full volume, make copies, and start promoting my work online, in competitions, and at events. I will also be able to hire temporary a youth intern to help me move units.

I created NappyQueen.com because I know my art is worth the time and effort it takes to get it out to more people. Our community needs something for us and BY US!

What We Need & What You Get

$500 may not seem like much, but it is! It can get:

  • 20 copies of volume 1 (each volume will have 10-15 issues) AND
  • 3 different language translations AND
  • A launch party with food, guest performers, promotional materials AND
  • International exposure AND
  • 1 At-Risk PAID Youth Intern to help with marketing & outreach

 

 

PERKS INCLUDE:

gft cetificates, signed copies, apparel, tickets to local happenings, original artwork, exclusive workshops, a networking event, and more!

The Impact

Having the youth intern is a research-proven deterrent for those living in at-risk environments. The student will gain valuable work experience in marketing and the arts.

It is great for the community because women of color don't have a strong enough voice in comics. I will collaborate with of artists of color to make this happen.

Of course, this project is valuable to me because it will allow me to spend time with my newborn son while chasing my totally plausible dream.

The networking event will bring together artists, businesses, at-risk youth, and people of color in a way that helps revitalize the community while promoting a great comic!

Other Ways You Can Help

PLEASE SPREAD THE WORD!

Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Most scientists agree that between 10 and 15 billion years ago, the Big Bang--an as-yet unexplained cosmic detonation--created the universe. But what if that shattering blast instead created not one, but four separate universes, dimensional equals that grew and developed through similar, though subtly different, evolution? And what if the spiraling paths of those universes were destined to one day converge...and collide! 


This is the background for the gripping new sci-fi saga, BIGGER BANG GALAXY. As courageous men and women from each universe set out on a determined quest to find the only substance that could possibly deflect catastrophe on an unimaginable scale, the very source of the Big Bang itself: Neomatter. But even if they find it, can they control it? Or will their fight for survival bring about the very destruction they seek to avoid? 

Against this overall arc of hope and desperation, veteran writer David Michelinie (IRON MAN, VENOM) and exciting anime-stylist Weilin Yang (THE SATURNIST) tell character-driven tales of adventure and discovery, laced with humor, tough decisions, and plot twists you will not see coming! What would you do, if you could save your own world but in the process destroy countless others? Choose cooperation or competition, self-serving or sacrifice, wield the olive branch or the sword? 

This first two-parter introduces major characters and conflicts, and is the perfect jumping-on point for an epic journey into the unexplored. Be in on the beginning of something special, something singular, something...bigger!

 
 
 

Bigger Bang Galaxy is a two issue mini-series.  Each issue is 48 pages.  Funding goes toward the production and printing.   How many copies will be determined later.  We're also taking on advertising, so the more advertising the more copies.  At least 40,000 will be printed of each issue but that would increase if we go over our funding goal and through our level of advertising. 

  

 

 

 

 

 

Every pledge level gets a copy of the first issue of BBG automatically. There are a lot of great rewards, check them out.  But two rewards that are extra special need highlighting.  1) As a special bonus for those pledging $100: the first new Future Comics story in ten years! David Michelinie and Bob Layton reunite for a brand new DEATHMASK adventure, a 12-page mini-comic plotted and written by David, co-plotted and inked by Bob, and pencilled by Gordon Purcell. A true collectable for any die-hard Future Comics fan.  Want it signed? Just add $25.

 

2) Two of the world's best Cosplayers, Riki LeCotey (Riddle) and Klytaemnestra will be photographed as two of the Bigger Bang Galaxy women.   It'll be an exclusive 12 page Cosplay comic chock full of their pics as BBG characters.  Available with a $100 pledge.    Want it signed? Just add $25.

 

 

 

 

 COMIC STORE OWNERS

If you're a retailer, think about the ordering some copies.  They're returnable! Oh, you might notice two retailer options...one is a duplicate that can't be deleted.  It doesn't matter which you choose, they're the same.

story:
Hello, my name is Nikolai Mamashev and I would like to create a 3D model of Pepper from “Pepper & Carrot”. This model will be created for Blender and will be available for free download to everyone (under the terms of CC-BY license).

 

I am a freelance 3D artist and animator.  I am author of several free models. This is my last one:

 

 

Note: This model represents the quality level to what I am going to deliver for Pepper 3D model.

 

Pepper is a main character of «Pepper & Carrot» webcomic, which is created by French artist David Revoy.  You can learn more about the webcomic on its official website.

 

 

DISCLAIMER:

This campaign is collecting funds exclusively for my (Nikolai Mamashev)  work on the production of this project. David Revoy, the original author of the web-comic «Pepper&Carrot», gave his permission for this project, but is not involved in the production process and does not receive/shares any revenues collected here. The name of David Revoy on images are specified for attribution purposes, but not as sign of affiliation. You can support his work and webcomic through his Patreon page.

 

 

“CC-BY” is a short for ‘Creative Commons Attribution”. It means that anyone is free to reuse and modify the model. The requirement is to give an attribution to original author. You can read about more about this license here.

 

 

If this campaign will be successful, then you will get a high-quality model for Blender. The model will be available for free download to everyone.

The model will include:

  • completely textured and rigged mesh;
  • additional low-poly proxy (for real-time work with animation);
  • full library of phonemes for lipsync.
 

 

 

Creation of high-quality 3D model is a time consuming process. This is why I have started this crowdfunding campaign.

 

With your help I will be able to dedicate my time and create this model that everyone can use for free.

story:
DEAD WEST is a 110-page color graphic novel by writer Carl Elvis and artist Claudio Muñoz.  The story takes place in 1876 in a small Black Hills gold rush town called Dead West that seems to be attracting the supernatural along with prospectors.  Scientist Victor Frankenstein creates an unstoppable Sheriff to protect and enforce the law.  But as danger grows, the Sheriff will need help from a Mummy who claims to be an ancient Egyptian King and a wily young Vampire that's looking for action! 

Coming February 2013 

We need your help to complete the book, to pay the talented artist Claudio Muñoz for his amazing work, as well as colors, lettering and production.  Your contribution will take us one step closer, and in exchange you will receive one of the great perks listed on the right hand side of your screen.

3 Page Preview with lettering by MaGnUs

Ladies of Dead West

story:
What is Wolf and I?

"Wolf and I" is a young adult comic written and illustrated by Krysta Crawford, detailing the story of a college student named Violet and her best friend who can communicate with ghosts in the compelling tale of how Vi's life turns upside down after her grandparents unexpected truth leading to a close encounter with a mystifying stranger, and the concealed origin of her parents history. Issue two takes us further into the story as we encounter new characters, glimpse into new worlds and our characters Violet and Sophia will have to make decisions that will change their lives forever. 

Wolf and I: magic rising will be another 20 page comic filled with highly detailed full-color graphic art. You can expect the same magic both in art and story as issue one. Check out the example excerpts below

Variant Cover options

For Issue #2 we have multiple options to choose from for your cover in addition to the original cover including 3 limited edition exclusive covers from artists: Flying Frog Illustration, Sam Sawyer, and Cara Nicole/Alfred Trujillo and a limited edition Cosplay Cover by FleurDeVillainy!

All tiers will come with the comics packaged in a bag and board and shipped in a Gemini comic shipping mailer for protection.

UNLOCKED- $1600- 3x3 inch vinyl holofoil sticker Wolf in the Moon

UNLOCKED- $1850- Bookmark- Eyes that find you

UNLOCKED- $2000- Metallic character card- Violet

$2250- 3x3 inch vinyl matte sticker

$2500- Metallic character card- Sophia

$2750- 1.25" button pin

$3000- Enamel pin!!! For all backers at the $20 level and up!

$3500- 5x7 print

$4000- Upgrade all 5x7 prints to metallic stock!

$5000- 3rd 3x3- holofoil sticker

$7500- Limited Edition wooden coaster- wolf in the moon

*Issue 1*- Did you want to pick up a variant cover of magic rising? You can get issue #1 shipped with #2- just add $10 to your pledge total. 

*Wolf enamel pin? Add $10

*Want the VIRGIN (no title) cover for your comic? Add $5 per comic to your order

*Grading*- Do you want your comic graded before it's mailed to you? Add $40  per comic that you want graded to your pledge with the comment "graded" and I will have the comic graded by CBCS including encapsulation in a protective hard cover. This will extend the amount of time until you get your comic/stretch goal package

Risks and challenges

The risk to backing this project would be delay in shipping due to production time of the comic and stretch goals. We plan to prevent this by submitting files to the printer before schedule and keeping open communication with backers.

Other Ways You Can Help

As a small creator I understand that you can't always financially help, or fantasy adventure comics just aren't your thing but there are other ways you can help! 

  • Please consider sharing this campaign on your social media
  • Let your friends and family know about this exciting fantasy adventure comic!

story:
Short Summary

Charleston, South Carolina, not as big a city as Los Angeles or New York, a place with normal everyday crime. So it didn’t take much to grab headlines when four teenage girls come up missing and are later discovered sexually assaulted and mutilated. In the summer months that followed, reports and speculations put the city in a state of panic over a man preying on young girls

My name is Tracey Claverie.  I have been around comics for 18 years. I have been an attendee at San Diego Comic Con for as many years as well. With each year that passed, I became more passionate writing comics. Finally, a story came along that I feel passionate about. My 9 to 5 is working for a police department in southern california(I am NOT an officer) for the last 18 years. With each page you will feel the passion I have for this project.  

The funding I receive will go towards printing and advertising cost. This includes printing of the book, postcards, and posters. Over the past year I financed the first two issues of the four issue series by my self and would like to finish the last two issues.

2013 is the year the entire story will be presented as a graphic novel at Comic Con. I feel strongly about this project because of the inner struggle we all can relate to. I tell this story with this in mind.

These perks will be the only ones given of this kind. So this would be quite a treat for those collectors out.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand some of you may not be able to contribute. If you feel as passionate about this story as I do, if you could please post the indiegogo.com link on any of the various social networks you may be a part of. That would be just as appreciated.

story:
I hope you watched and enjoyed the animated version of Blood, Skulls, and Chrome on our video! Blood, Skulls, and Chrome is a five issue miniseries of 22 comic pages/each, that tells a tale of the Texas based outlaw MC known as the Steel Knights. It is loosely based on the number 1 Finnish graphic novel illustrated by the renowned writer, Hannu Kesola and the artist, Ville Vainio. With this campaign, we here offer you with the first two issues of this hard boiled crime fiction series.

STORY SYNOPSIS

The Texas-based outlaw motorcycle club, The Steel Knights have lost a big deal from the Mexican Cartel to rival the Lake Street Boyz gang. When the two reckless members of the MC kill the cartel's liaison, the MC soon find themselves fighting for survival against the threats from outside and within. 

Sample pages by Mohammad Ramlan, Beth Varni and Brandon DeStefano.

 

We here have some great rewards that includes of course both digital and physical copies of the books. We are also offering its printed copies with a variant cover done by Kyle Hotz(Spider-Man, Hulk, Mosaic etc.) and Sami Kivelä (presented by Beautiful Canvas, Abbott etc.), not missing out the exclusive prints (comic book  size) by Miguel Ruiz & Hannu Kesola and print of the Kyle Hotz variant cover. Every backer will also be receiving a digital thrash metal single titled “Blood, Skulls, and Chrome” performed by ILMEIN. Lyrics are written by the series writer, Hannu Kesola. 

 

Hannu Kesola (the story, and the regular cover inks) is a comic book writer and inker from Finland. He has already worked before and is also currently working for publishers like Action Lab, Heavy Metal, Caliber Comics and others. His works have also been published in French, Swedish, and Finnish, and will soon be published in Italian and Portuguese as well. www.hannukesola.com 

Mohammad Ramlan (pencils/inks) belonged to the comic book artists from Indonesia. He has worked for several Indie companies such as Anomalous Comics, Warrant and many others. Sadly, Mohammad passed away in the late 2017, just when he had started to work on issue three. Issue one is dedicated to him, in his remembrance.

Beth Varni (colors) has worked on the Indie video games, book covers, comics, and mural paintings.

Brandon DeStefano (letters) has been lettering comics professionally since 2007 and has lettered comics for the companies such as Image Comics, and IDW.

Miguel Ruiz (cover pencils) is a Spanish comic book artist, best known for his works on Avatar Press's Crossed: Badlands. 

 

The project was already fully funded on Kickstarter so everything is on schedule. This campaign gives possibility to people who prefer Indiegogo over Kickstarter to get our comic:)

story:
Second Chance Campaign for people that missed the original Kickstarter!

Book now 400 pages of story and art!

[PG and PG-13 on rare occasions]

Foxy and Wolfy volume 1 is the first of 7 planned books for the series. Each book will be 160-240 pages, except the first one at 400 pages. This project is my heart and soul and I want to share this awesome adventure with everyone! We have updated scenes, redone dialogue and colored 100%

 

Foxy and Wolfy is about the adventures of two spirit guardians. A Foxy young spirit guardian with muscular dystrophy named Misaki Kimura and her Wolfy partner, Amaya Bellerose.

Known as mahou shoujo ("magical girl") or just majokko ("witch-girl") in Japanese, Magical Girls are empowered by various means with fantastic powers that both assist and complicate their lives, but manage to persevere despite this.

In the world of Foxy and Wolfy Chaos, spirit guardians are humans who fight genocidal demons and purify souls consumed by hatred. Through the use of spirit keys, the main characters Misaki and Amaya (along with their friends) travel between the human and demon worlds to defend all they hold precious against nefarious demons seeking chaos.

Volume 1 follows their initial origins at Foxshuffle academy as new kid mages, and their first official mission as adults! Expect magical combat, silly shenanigans and deadly fanatical demon attacks! You will see them when they are kids first and later as adults going after their first target.  Come join the fun

!

Why was this created? 

 I’ve always enjoyed storytelling and manga since I was a very young child. This is why I chose the manga style.

What made me want to create this story was, for two main reasons. The first and foremost reason is to make an entertaining, positive story for the world. Something to honor all of the dear friends and family that I have lost over my lifetime. Every character has pieces of people that were dear to my heart. This is a project that has become my entire reason to keep pushing forward.


 Secondly, as an LGBT+ creator with Duchenne muscular dystrophy, I want to show that disabled people want and like the same things as other people. The story purposely doesn't ignore or focus on this and focuses more on fun characters, some just happen to have a disability. One of my goals is to positively portray a disabled LGBT+ character without making it the only layer to them.


The first priority is fun for all! Comics bring EVERYONE joy and should be enjoyed by all.

 Who will love Foxy and Wolfy?
 

  •  Fans of Sailor Moon, Puella Magi Madoka Magica, Cardcaptor Sakura and other fun magical girl series.
     
  • People who like My Hero Academia, Fairy Tail, Inuyasha and other fantasy tales with a large, fun cast of characters.
     
  • Collectors of independent comic books and manga!
     
  • If you like your comics with shonen style fighting, fun shenanigans, and wholesome yuri, THIS IS YOUR BOOK! 

 

DIGITAL WALLPAPER EXAMPLES

 

If you want something added like a print, just let me know to add it at kitsuneonwheelz@foxyandwolfy.tokyo and I will do my best to make it happen!

 

Credits
story_txt:
Second Chance Campaign for people that missed the original Kickstarter! Book now 400 pages of story and art![PG and PG-13 on rare occasions]Foxy and Wolfy volume 1 is the first of 7 planned books for the series. Each book will be 160-240 pages, except the first one at 400 pages. This project is my heart and soul and I want to share this awesome adventure with everyone! We have updated scenes, redone dialogue and colored 100% Foxy and Wolfy is about the adventures of two spirit guardians. A Foxy young spirit guardian with muscular dystrophy named Misaki Kimura and her Wolfy partner, Amaya Bellerose.Known as mahou shoujo ("magical girl") or just majokko ("witch-girl") in Japanese, Magical Girls are empowered by various means with fantastic powers that both assist and complicate their lives, but manage to persevere despite this.In the world of Foxy and Wolfy Chaos, spirit guardians are humans who fight genocidal demons and purify souls consumed by hatred. Through the use of spirit keys, the main characters Misaki and Amaya (along with their friends) travel between the human and demon worlds to defend all they hold precious against nefarious demons seeking chaos.Volume 1 follows their initial origins at Foxshuffle academy as new kid mages, and their first official mission as adults! Expect magical combat, silly shenanigans and deadly fanatical demon attacks! You will see them when they are kids first and later as adults going after their first target.  Come join the fun!Why was this created?  I’ve always enjoyed storytelling and manga since I was a very young child. This is why I chose the manga style.What made me want to create this story was, for two main reasons. The first and foremost reason is to make an entertaining, positive story for the world. Something to honor all of the dear friends and family that I have lost over my lifetime. Every character has pieces of people that were dear to my heart. This is a project that has become my entire reason to keep pushing forward. Secondly, as an LGBT+ creator with Duchenne muscular dystrophy, I want to show that disabled people want and like the same things as other people. The story purposely doesn't ignore or focus on this and focuses more on fun characters, some just happen to have a disability. One of my goals is to positively portray a disabled LGBT+ character without making it the only layer to them.The first priority is fun for all! Comics bring EVERYONE joy and should be enjoyed by all.
 Who will love Foxy and Wolfy? 
 Fans of Sailor Moon, Puella Magi Madoka Magica, Cardcaptor Sakura and other fun magical girl series. 
People who like My Hero Academia, Fairy Tail, Inuyasha and other fantasy tales with a large, fun cast of characters. 
Collectors of independent comic books and manga! 
If you like your comics with shonen style fighting, fun shenanigans, and wholesome yuri, THIS IS YOUR BOOK! 
 DIGITAL WALLPAPER EXAMPLES If you want something added like a print, just let me know to add it at kitsuneonwheelz@foxyandwolfy.tokyo and I will do my best to make it happen! Credits

story:
Short Summary

 

This is the story of a young teenager who is inspired to be a Hero. She quickly learns that putting on a masked and fighting crime isn't enough. Calling yourself a hero doesn't make you one. The path to being something more won't be easy. Will she learn the Difference? Can she find her own way? "The world is a Beautiful and fascinating place but it also can be dark and full of evil."- Control yourself.

 

The Impact

Do to the Lack of Content in the Super Hero Genre. Female hero's are almost never in a lead role or Properly Represented. If they are it oversexualized or playing second place to a male hero. I would like to have the opportunity to show others wise with these 12 issues

Challenges

Working a full time job and a part time Job.  I have been funding the current issues to this point.

that includes printing, going conventions, Booking Signing, Writing, illustrations and Shipping. All has taking it toll on me has content creator. if would be extremely helpful to have a helping hand with this process.

Other Ways You Can Help

Do to Covid-19 I understand that funding may not be an option for you. If you really like the project and want to help it succeed then you can help us get the word out. You can share links to this site on your social media or even just tell a friend or two that you think might be interested. Please Please Give  Feed Back on my first comic.

story:
Hello! My name is John Schlim Jr. I’m a writer who created the popular character Goth Ghost Girl along with artist Sergio Quijada. I’ve always been simultaneously fascinated and terrified by the thought of undead spirits. That made me a weird little kid who read all of the ghost stories, monster comics, and supernatural fantasy I could find. I also entertained my friends by making up creepy tales with local connections. That's a weird kid, right? 

Well believe it or not I’m still telling spooky stories as a grown man, and now I'd like to explain a bit more about the next story that Sergio and I want to tell with YOUR help...

It's the next chapter in a rock 'n' roll ghost story!

Lilly O'Siris was once the guitarist and lead vocalist of the punk rock band, Imminent Hour, perfectly content as an outcast from mainstream society. But then she was murdered by a deranged fanatic who felt her nonconformity was the devil's influence. Since rock 'n' roll can never die, she returned from the grave as a vengeance-seeking, wise-cracking ghost. Now her hobbies include hunting down murderers, slaying vampires, kicking zombie ass, haunting high schools, and taking her head off to freak out hipsters. Of course, she still likes to hang around the best clubs, and most of the other dead spirits adore her because she's the coolest ghost ever. 

We're looking to produce a full-color, 24-page comic book featuring Goth Ghost Girl's second full-length story, "Bloodbath." In this follow-up to her debut comic, the theme turns to the heart wrenching pain of lost love. It also introduces a mysterious ghost cat with a sarcastic streak that rivals Lilly’s, and the threat of…a vampire?!

But wait--you missed the first issue? DON'T WORRY! You don't NEED to have read the first Goth Ghost Girl comic to enjoy this standalone tale. But we've made it easy for you to order BOTH issues just in case!

Here are some non-spoiler sample pages:

Goth Ghost Girl debuted in a short story that appeared in Fiendish Fables, a horror comics anthology published by Brain Scan Studios that paid homage to the classic creepy tales made famous by publishers EC and Warren. That book was my brainchild and I was thrilled that the diverse team of artists who worked on it earned us a "Certified Cool" ranking by Diamond Comic Distributors. Goth Ghost Girl became the most discussed part of the publication, and the resulting fan mail made me realize that she needed her own book.

So Sergio and I reunited to launch a Halloween campaign on Kickstarter one year ago for Goth Ghost Girl #1, “An Die Freude.” We were thrilled that 277 beloved Backers helped us raise 665% of our funding goal! Are you kidding me?! Our Backers are amazing! That allowed us to nearly double the originally planned size of the comic, add an exclusive, glow-in-the-dark cover, and reward our Backers with other cool stuff.

Based on feedback from those Backers, people want even more Goth Ghost Girl, which is awesome because we want to keep telling more of her stories! So here we are again, making haunted dreams come true.

Although most issues of Goth Ghost Girl include a self-contained tale, they all reveal a bit more about our ghostly heroine and her world, and they all leave some dangling plot threads that will eventually be woven together into a tapestry of supernatural fantasy. Each subsequent story begins to answer the many questions surrounding Lilly’s new existence, such as how she died, who she was before her death, how her spectral form can interact with the living world, and why she seems drawn to despair. Some stories will be poignant (such as the hauntingly tragic first issue), some will be funny, and some will be action-packed.

Goth Ghost Girl is different. It’s not a superhero comic, it’s not a fetish comic, it’s not your traditional horror comic. It’s about people. People on the fringe of society’s definition of normal. People who have a hard time following rules. People drowning in despair. People facing their fears. And people standing up to evil.

Sergio and I plan to explore ghost folklore, change misconceptions about goth culture, and eventually reveal the true purpose of our heroine's supernatural return in a climactic finale. But we need YOUR help to keep bringing Goth Ghost Girl to life!

CREATOR/ARTIST SERGIO QUIJADA is a proficient talent who illustrated the very first Goth Ghost Girl short story that was published in Fiendish Fables, and he's remained part of the creative team because he loves the character. Sergio is a professional comic artist and freelance illustrator, currently splitting his time between his daily job as Art Director at a videogame company and freelance artist by night. He's been working on comic books, trading card games, school books, and videogames for almost 10 years. He's also been an Art Director/Character Designer for 2D animated commercials. His artwork has been published in the United States and his home country of Chile, most notably his stint as artist on Samurai Jack (IDW Publishing) and Box Artist for Robotech (Lionsgate Entertainment). Sergio's unique style is mostly based on fantasy/painted and animated/cartoonish influences, but he's constantly striving to improve his skills in a wide variety of styles.  

Check out some of his artwork online: 
http://www.sergioquijada.cl/ 
http://sergio-quijada.deviantart.com/ 
https://www.facebook.com/sergioquijadaart/

Watch a cool time-lapse video of Sergio designing Taro: https://youtu.be/himNdlLWVB8 

LETTERER BERNARDO BRICE joined the creative team on Ghost Girl #1 and eagerly returns to lettering duties for the second part of the series. Based in Santiago, Chile, his published lettering credits include "Where We Live: Las Vegas Shooting Benefit Anthology" curated by J.H. Williams III and published by Image Comics; "The Bawdy Tales of Lazlo Cale" and "Aldous Spark," published by Grenade Fight; "Justo: Una Espada contra el Imperio" published by Amapola Editores; "Nuke: Señores de la 68" published by Dogitia; and "Savage Empire" published by Likes to Fight.

You can check his portfolio and upcoming work on the website http://www.bardoner.com and follow him on Twitter: @bernardobri

CREATOR/WRITER JOHN SCHLIM JR is a lifelong storyteller who has worked as a journalist, editor, and advertising copywriter. He's also been published as a columnist, short story author, and comic book scripter. Most of his fiction falls into the genres of fantasy, science fiction, supernatural, or some combination thereof. His published comics work includes Dandelion (Arcana Studios), Fiendish Fables (Brain Scan Studios), and a contribution to the critically acclaimed Outlaw Territory (Image Comics). His writing studio, Fablehaus, is hidden somewhere deep in the legendary Owlwood of New Hampshire.

Studio link: https://fablehaus.wordpress.com/

Goth Ghost Girl is published by Ovation Comics, a publisher creating a new age in comics for print, digital, and beyond. Look for the "Standing O" on the cover of the coolest indie comics. And learn more about them at http://ovationcomics.com/ 

 

Backers at the Specter Club level get their choice of an original Sergio Quijada illustration from his series of favorite comic book heroines. These aren’t prints, they are one-of-a-kind original artworks signed by Sergio and shipped over from his studio in Chile. There are only 4 still available so the offer is limited to only 4 Backers, and they are FIRST COME, FIRST SERVED, to be picked in the order of received pledges.

 

Creating a budget for a crowdfunded project is a spiraling descent into madness. There are countless "if this then that" scenarios which seem to breed endless costs, denying the underlying desire to make the book as affordable as possible. But the reality of independent creators producing, printing, and shipping comics themselves is an expensive challenge. Then when you factor in the production of cool rewards that we want to provide to our awesome supporters, plus Indiegogo's cut and the insatiable appetite of the IRS, the budget becomes a shape-shifting monster that everybody wishes Goth Ghost Girl would slay. 

But we’ve done this before with no experience and we SUCCEEDED because of our enthusiastic Backers. We successfully funded, produced, and delivered Golth Ghost Girl #1. This past Halloween we successfully funded Goth Ghost Girl #2, so that means your support on Indiegogo is guaranteed success! This is your chance to get caught up on the series and help us fund future issues.

Shipping fees are additional and we've done our best to keep them reasonable for those in the United States. There's not much we could do about the expense of international shipping, which continues to rise.

And if you're unable to back us financially this time, you can still help us more than you realize by simply spreading the news of our little project. The biggest obstacle for indie creators is getting the word out about our comics.

From the bottom of my weird little story-telling heart, THANK YOU for helping Sergio and me express our creativity through a project that we truly love making!

story:
What is "Being Bold" and who is this girl pitching it?

Who am I?

My name is Zorica I'm an illustrator and graphic designer with a BA in Fine Arts. I'm originally from Yuogoslavia, but came to America to study art as a teen and have been here ever since. I like to work in youth volunteer groups to help give something back and that leads me too why this project is important to me.

One of the things I learned as a volunteer teaching art to at risk teens is...a lot of them just didn't like art. At least my group didn't and it was a learning experience. Getting someone to paint a dog is one thing, having to get the security guard escort to get them back into the class is another!

Two things stood out to me though in this experience:

  1. The reason why art was so difficult for them was because they didn't think they could do it. I broke that thought pattern by making them draw a face using a grid. SURPISE! They're jaws dropped and ears opened. A little.
  2. Positive imagry and role modles are important. There is a pervasive defeatist pattern in the minds of ask-risk youth, and to be quite honest, they just don't have anyone to look up to but themselves. It's a vicious pattern.

I had a story idea in my head, and when I explained it to the artist on the project, everything came together. In the end we came up with a concept that seemed good enought to hold the interest of young adults as well as hopefully create a positive image in thier minds. The over all theme being that a hero is what YOU make it...so now we just need help to get it going.

That's where you wonderful folks come in!
 
We need your help making this book a reality, because quite frankly...I have no more funds to pay any contributing artists working to put this book together.

What Do I Need The Funds For?

Essentially:

  • A professional colorist to finish the pencil and inked pages.
  • A professional letterer to letter the comics (this is my attempts in the samples)
  • Money to pay the artist as well as cover publishing, materials, shipping, and other costs.

The comic itself is going to be part of a series of books broken down into six volumes in a classic comic book format.


Hopefully this start will help peak further interest.

The comic itself is about an awkward teenager who through a freak accident gains the ability to transform into a superhero. Through this series of transformations the teen deveolps an understanding of himself, his role in the world, and learns to appreciate the power he had all along.

Please See Gallery For More:

 

 

Examples:

There are various rewards we've prepared.
Although the art is in black and white, all posters and wallpaper artwork will be in FULL color.

Examples include:

T-SHIRTS (unisex and fitted)

 

 

 

POSTERS!

 

WALLPAPER AND COOL ORIGINAL ARTWORK:

AND MUCH MUCH MORE!

story:
Extra pages:

we are almost at 3k and we want to share a few more pages with you for all the support !! 

They are still at draft state so don't worry about the text and inking.

 

Our story follows a boy named Evan a simple farmer boy in a middle-ages like times, who lives in a world where each country is ruled by a god that fights in order to lead the world according to his faction beliefs.

But his role in the outcome of this war becomes equal to one of a god as he is confronted with the truth, he will follow the path he was set upon to in order to assist the side he believes in to win this war, but time and the events of the world around him will serve as the greatest obstacle.

 

 

 

Evan Bravi : 

  

"It's like a pirate had a baby with an angel"  - Drax The Destroyer 2018

 

 

Reg Meyer :

kind-hearted and a friend till the very end, with a potential that just waits to be unleashed.

 

 

Gust The son of Kuningas : 

 

The first ever natural born god, The son of the strongest god of them all and the ruler of the 2nd biggest country in the world, ASTRA!

 

 

The world :

We inspire to make the world a character of its own, dynamic and ever-changing throughout the story!

As for the time our story takes place, the western nations are at war against the Eastern nations, that's affecting every single person in the world and the people need to choose which god to side with and fight for. With a Unique magic system, we will explain more about in the future (hopefully).

 

 

   

 

 

 

 

 

 

  • As we mentioned before we started working on this project more than 3 years ago, We built the story and the world as best as we could for a year and a half until we realized the potential behind the story and decided to make it a reality. We have tried many different ways to bring our story to life but nothing was at the point that we were satisfied with, so we decided not to compromise and go for an experienced and talented artist that could take our comic to the next level and this is when we joined forces with the comic book artisit Guy Lenman. 

  • As new people to the industry, we have been through a lot of challenges and roadblocks and every new obstacle is a first, we know the road will not be easy but we are ready and determined to make our dream come true and create something worth to be invested in alongside all of you!

Extra pages:
we are almost at 3k and we want to share a few more pages with you for all the support !! 
They are still at draft state so don't worry about the text and inking.


 

Our story follows a boy named Evan a simple farmer boy in a middle-ages like times, who lives in a world where each country is ruled by a god that fights in order to lead the world according to his faction beliefs.
But his role in the outcome of this war becomes equal to one of a god as he is confronted with the truth, he will follow the path he was set upon to in order to assist the side he believes in to win this war, but time and the events of the world around him will serve as the greatest obstacle.

 
 

 
Evan Bravi : 
  
"It's like a pirate had a baby with an angel"  - Drax The Destroyer 2018
 
 

Reg Meyer :

kind-hearted and a friend till the very end, with a potential that just waits to be unleashed.
 
 

Gust The son of Kuningas : 

 
The first ever natural born god, The son of the strongest god of them all and the ruler of the 2nd biggest country in the world, ASTRA!
 
 

The world :

We inspire to make the world a character of its own, dynamic and ever-changing throughout the story!
As for the time our story takes place, the western nations are at war against the Eastern nations, that's affecting every single person in the world and the people need to choose which god to side with and fight for. With a Unique magic system, we will explain more about in the future (hopefully).
 
 
   

 





 
 
 

 
 

As we mentioned before we started working on this project more than 3 years ago, We built the story and the world as best as we could for a year and a half until we realized the potential behind the story and decided to make it a reality. We have tried many different ways to bring our story to life but nothing was at the point that we were satisfied with, so we decided not to compromise and go for an experienced and talented artist that could take our comic to the next level and this is when we joined forces with the comic book artisit Guy Lenman.

story:
Short Summary

Hello everyone! 

I am Daveed Benito, a 9 year seasoned photographer. Over the years, I have developed many new and exciting skills in photography and photo manipulation. Now I am looking to let you in on a special project of mine.

Currently, I am creating an artists rendition of sexy comic girls based off of your favorite characters. Similar to whats in the cosplay world, these are my artist rendition of 12 comic girls. I am using actual models to portray these characters and creating the outfits from various fabrics and pre-existing apparel.  I am a huge fan of the sexy side of these beautiful characters, and I want you to have a chance to own some of the LIMITED prints. 

Characters already created:

 -Poison Ivy   Model: @imbrettrossi                                                                                                   -Black Widow Model: @Mysti_Moon                                                                                                -Black Canary  Model: @purrbunny                                                                                                 -Black Cat Model:   @Mysti_Moon                                                                                                   -Emma Frost  Model: @KristiVeera (my beautiful wife)                                                             -Super Girl  Model: Whitney Rochelle                                                                                             -Harley Quinn  Model: @purrbunny                                                                                                -PsyLocke Model @sass_xo                                                                                                              -Wonderwoman (coming soon)

Why do I need your help?

Simple! The costs I am incurring, along the creative process, can easily pile up with makeup/hair stylists, custom costumes and accessories. I am looking for the amazing fans of the comic world to help fund the remaining characters.  In exchange, you get some cool collectible fan art with your contribution. 
  • Currently I am looking at the funding basics ($800) so I am able to complete this project
  • The perks that I will be providing will be items that may not be reproduced in these forms of media I/E collectible trading cards, 11x17 posters, photo book (in comic print form), a 12 month 2016 calendar and much more. 
  • The more contributions I receive, the more characters I can create and better quality collectibles I can offer to you, the fan. Anything past my $800 goal will contribute to better costumes, perks etc...


The Impact

I am looking to make a small impact in the massive comic world! This is only the beginning, and with a successful campaign I will create a set of my own characters that have never been seen before. They will have back stories with the potential for their own comic book, plus they get sexier.

With your help, I will continue to make new and exciting characters following some of the upcoming major comic based movies.

Risks & Challenges

So far, the risks of this project are minimal considering 9 characters are completed. Being in the photography business for 9 years has helped me meet some amazing print companies and models, so I have all of the resources at my finger tips. Many of the perks will already be in stock to eliminate wait times for shipments.

The only challenge I have is reaching you the fan! So far I have plenty of models willing to be apart of this project including a few playboy models ;)

I have my own studio and plenty of time to complete or add new characters within days if I want.

-Follow Daveed Benito on Instagram @DaveedBenitoArt


Other Ways You Can Help

Don't worry if you cannot contribute! If you are fan of what I am creating please share my project, it is greatly appreciated.

******SHIPPING*******

Why is there an extra charge for shipping? Well its because shipping cost extra, just kidding. The reason why I have the extra charge for shipping is because I am adding insurance and requiring a signature to make sure you receive your perks. Feel free to ask questions.

******INTERNATIONAL SHIPPING*****

For items without international shipping costs please contact me to get a quote.

*Be the hero perk rules. Contributor must travel to Tempe Arizona for photo shoot. Contributor will have 30 days after the campaign ends to schedule photo shoot. Contributor will cover any extra costs incurred (i/e wardrobe, accessories). A makeup/hair stylist will be provided for female contributors. Contributor must be 18 years or older.

story:
HELP these marvelous mascots solve this monstrous murder…

Or else breakfast will never be the same again!

We here at Nemesis Comix love a good mystery, but we also love turning a good story on its ear. So, join us as we follow the tumultuous trail leading these surprising and somewhat sultry suspects to a conclusion that is as staggering as it is stupendous!  

Seriously though, we’ve worked hard to create this 48 page graphic novel that steps outside of the norm, that will make you want to read it again and again. We’ve included clues on the character's cereal boxes to make you feel as though you’re part of the story. Play along with us as we delve deep into each of the character's deadly desires! Culminating in a final conclusion that will rattle your ribs and badger your brains!   

 

 

When will Dying is Easy be completed?

We here at Nemesis Comix believe you should get what you pay for. That's why we will strive to have the book as close to completion as possible before we launch. That's right, you'll mostly be waiting for the printers to print the books (plus, however long it takes Seth to decide where his life is going, get out of bed, and put them in mailers).

When Will Dying is Easy Ship?

We don't like missing deadlines. That's why we aren't setting a hard date for this book. The printers say a couple of weeks to print. Then we will be spending a few more weeks packaging in a storeroom to make sure you guys get the books ASAP. None of this, "my computer fell apart" or ...."I had three deaths on my turtle farm" stuff. We get them to you as fast as humanly possible. The next campaign will be faster as we perfect the method, so on and so forth.

We could try and sell you on the idea that this is our lifelong dream, but it isn't. Our dream is not only to make great books, but to do things correctly. To provide the product to our readers in a swift and timely manner, and also to better our product with each and every campaign. That way you get to live the dream with us – making it not just a dream, but a reality for us all.

 

If you're wondering if this will be the only story we have....NO. We aren't one hit wonder creators. You can expect that we will bring you consistent content that wasn't written in your mother's basement (well, at least not all of it). We have many varying stories involving everything from galactic bounty hunters to superheroes to brilliant kid detectives.

https://nemesiscomix.com/

 

Additional Ways to Help

Some people are broke... trust us, we get it. We've all been freelance at one point or another. Sometimes you gotta make sure little Timmy will be able to do his homework in a room not heated by candlelight.

KEEP TIMMY WARM! Just go out and yell off your front porch or get on the interwebs and let all the people you talk to know about the awesomest, sweetest campaign you've ever seen this side of Alpha Centauri. 

In all honesty, we appreciate and cherish any and all support you are able to give. From all of us here at Nemesis Comix:

Friends, foes, and all of those in between, you have our thanks.

story:
THE STORY OF THE DRAGOS

In a world that has been decimated and destroyed, an ancient sect of beings, dragon shifters called The Dragos, have risen to power. Only a remnant of humanity remains and their survival hinges on their choosing to fight or surrender to The Dragos. When Salya Salastine’s younger brother goes missing in the barren lands that’s left of civilization, Salya ventures out to find him and faces the dangers of Earth’s new rulers.

The Crowding of Dragos is about love. It’s a paranormal shifter romance story. But we are introduced to the concept of love through a sister’s fight for survival — she is fighting to get to her brother, who’s somewhere lost in a world that’s viscous and is ruled by powerful shifter beings. Salya is willing to risk life and limb for him, she stands up against those who warn her that her journey is impossible. That’s where the story takes its roots — the true nature of what is love — loves impossibility but yet its inevitability and durability. 

But sibling love is just the beginning. Again, The Crowding of Dragos is a paranormal shifter romance story so Salya’s journey will force her to face herself and all that is good and bad about who she is and what this world ruled by Dragon Shifters has done to her. Her hate for the Dragos will only be measured by her love for her brother and humanity, and just maybe somehow those two will blur and somehow possibly become one when a Shifter saves her life...

story:
Short Summary

Help bring to life this epic tale that journeys through decisions which ultimately affects the fate of the planet Eaton.

Greetings! I am Mathew Jobson, lead illustrator, project manager and creative director for the independent comic Eaton's Exxodus and I want to tell you about our indie comic and why you should invest in us and in our project.  This project is a collaboration of the talent and the hard work of four individuals; Chad Glass, David Padilla, Samuel Escamilla the creator of the story and myself. We work together to bring to life the truly epic tale that decides the fate of the planet Eaton. This world is both like and unlike Earth and is locked in a timeless struggle for the fate of the planet.  

This story has been on the mind of creator Samuel Escamilla for a long time and I have been impressed with his drive and focus ever since we met two years ago. Some of the characters were actual people, who had for one reason or another, made an impact in his life. This project took on an even deeper emotional weight for Sam with the tragic passing of his longtime friend who sadly never got to see the story in person. For this reason and for the encouragement this friend gave to Samuel he has been written into the story and has become a major character in the Epic tale.

The attention drawn to our comic will also serve as an opportunity to do good in our hometown of San Marcos, Texas. In the spirit of doing good with this project we are committing 15% of the funds collected in this crowdfunding campaign to be given to the National Center for Missing and Exploited Children fund. This organization resonates with the team and the personal ties to some of the characters. We will post the amount we were able to give on our website exxoduscomic.com.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are setting our goal at $2000 so we can continue making Sam's story a tangible experience for our readers. This money will compensate our team for the hours of work that goes into the planning, drawing, editing, marketing and promoting this project as well as cover the expenses of our Launch Party on August the 11th. This money will also provide our author and creator Sam with some much-needed support after single handedly funding this entire effort!

We are offering several perks at different levels of participation. "Bio Luminescence" is a four-page action-packed nugget of mayhem and was created to give people a introduction to the world of Eaton's Exxodus as well as to be a loving memorial. In this issue, we will highlight our community partners as well as offer details relating to the charity that you will be simultaneously supporting. We have created several unique products including tee shirts and laser etched coasters and wooden trading cards. We are even offering cameo appearances in upcoming issues as well as making our supporters into actual reoccurring characters. 

Thank you so much for taking the time to learn a little bit about our comic Eaton's Exxodus and thank you for supporting our project!

story:
All backers of any amount get a digital copy, and also a digital copy of our previous comic, Literally #1

What is this comic actually about?

If you don't mind spoiling it for yourself, you can listen to a live reading of the entire completed script here!

 

Have you ever seen a group of people (in real life or even across the internet) who acted like their own little despotic kingdom?  If you disagree with them in the most polite way, they become hysterical and attack.  They worship their central figures or high councils, and enforce the hierarchy even if one shouldn't exist, especially if they claim there is no ranking and that they are all equal, in which you have now accidentally caught them in hypocrisy that they will attack you for pointing out.  If you watch them long enough they begin turning on each other and expelling people one by one, shrinking further and further until they collapse.  An echo chamber, or a hugbox, you might've seen them called.  This is a story for anyone who's seen them in action, from outside or within.  It's a story about the lack of self awareness they have, and the damage that can ensue, but also about the lessons you can learn from their bad examples.

 

Our goofy SWC-style story pitch

 

When an enormously titted young woman shows up in the village surrounding a massive ancient historical tower known for its beautiful beacon of light, she comes to find that the tower is crumbling and on the verge of collapse!  Working with the locals, can she help keep this historical treasure from being destroyed before it's too late?  Find out in the conspicuously titled Inevitably Doomed.

Written by the first ever gray/mauve ace-demisexual panfluid gendernormative writers of color in comics, Ran’Deesha Diaz and Raymond Porse are ushering in a new era of Comic Liberty on par with classic works such as Princess Highground and Tails Gets Trolled.  These creators are hoping to bring Some Wonderful Creations (or SWC for short) to the world of comics.

 

Funding

Primarily to the artist.  It's $3000 total for the raw lines, then another $3000 for coloring, so it's $6000 total to be able to make this comic in its entirety, so the goal is $7000 to cover the Indiegogo fees and any extra emergency costs.  Ray and I won't be receiving this money, we'll simply be using it to fund the art.  If we get more than that we'll be splitting it with the artist(s).

Stretch goals

If we reach $9,000 I can potentially have Literally #2 (the next issue of our first comic) made at the exact same time, which all backers will also receive for free.  This is just something I was thinking about, and usually any extra money I get from crowdfunding I tend to put towards the many many MANY many other comics I have fully written and ready to make.

If we reach $30,000, we can have Inevitably Doomed printed and shipped to every backer who donated at least $5.  However, all backers of any amount will get a digital copy (PDF and raw image files in a nice handy zip file!).
story_txt:
All backers of any amount get a digital copy, and also a digital copy of our previous comic, Literally #1

What is this comic actually about?
If you don't mind spoiling it for yourself, you can listen to a live reading of the entire completed script here!

 
Have you ever seen a group of people (in real life or even across the internet) who acted like their own little despotic kingdom?  If you disagree with them in the most polite way, they become hysterical and attack.  They worship their central figures or high councils, and enforce the hierarchy even if one shouldn't exist, especially if they claim there is no ranking and that they are all equal, in which you have now accidentally caught them in hypocrisy that they will attack you for pointing out.  If you watch them long enough they begin turning on each other and expelling people one by one, shrinking further and further until they collapse.  An echo chamber, or a hugbox, you might've seen them called.  This is a story for anyone who's seen them in action, from outside or within.  It's a story about the lack of self awareness they have, and the damage that can ensue, but also about the lessons you can learn from their bad examples.
 
Our goofy SWC-style story pitch
 
When an enormously titted young woman shows up in the village surrounding a massive ancient historical tower known for its beautiful beacon of light, she comes to find that the tower is crumbling and on the verge of collapse!  Working with the locals, can she help keep this historical treasure from being destroyed before it's too late?  Find out in the conspicuously titled Inevitably Doomed.
Written by the first ever gray/mauve ace-demisexual panfluid gendernormative writers of color in comics, Ran’Deesha Diaz and Raymond Porse are ushering in a new era of Comic Liberty on par with classic works such as Princess Highground and Tails Gets Trolled.  These creators are hoping to bring Some Wonderful Creations (or SWC for short) to the world of comics.
 

Funding
Primarily to the artist.  It's $3000 total for the raw lines, then another $3000 for coloring, so it's $6000 total to be able to make this comic in its entirety, so the goal is $7000 to cover the Indiegogo fees and any extra emergency costs.  Ray and I won't be receiving this money, we'll simply be using it to fund the art.  If we get more than that we'll be splitting it with the artist(s).
Stretch goals
If we reach $9,000 I can potentially have Literally #2 (the next issue of our first comic) made at the exact same time, which all backers will also receive for free.  This is just something I was thinking about, and usually any extra money I get from crowdfunding I tend to put towards the many many MANY many other comics I have fully written and ready to make.
If we reach $30,000, we can have Inevitably Doomed printed and shipped to every backer who donated at least $5.  However, all backers of any amount will get a digital copy (PDF and raw image files in a nice handy zip file!).

story:
Hello!  This is Dan Nokes of 21st Century Sandshark Studios, once again with an Indie A Gogo project!  This time, we are raising funds for the opportunity for yours truly to go back to the largest comic book convention in North America...That's right!

21ST CENTURY SANDSHARK STUDIOS WANTS TO INVADE COMICON INTERNATIONAL IN SANDIEGO IN 2013!!!!!!!!

"But Dan!  Why are you raising the money on Indie-A-Go-Go!  


That requires a little back story...

You see since 2004 I have applied just about every year for Comicon International.  Like I stated, its the largest comic book convention in North America and one of the largest in the world.  I've only managed to get accepted into small press once in 2006.  Otherwise I have gotten lost in the shuffle of several thousand applicants for said space vying for less than 200 spaces.  Nobody's fault really!  Its the nature of the business. But the only other option is to raise 900-2500 dollars of my own just to get space at the show!  And this does not even begin to cover flight and hotel to get out there! So I have spent the last few years trying to come up with a way to get back to San Diego without breaking the bank...

 

I MAY HAVE JUST FOUND ONE WITH YOUR HELP????


I am asking fans, friends, acquaintances, stalkers, aficionados, sycophants, democrats, republicans, communists, socialists, Tories, Whigs, free masons, elks, those who voted for a cereal mascot in any election, comic, sci-fi, fantasy connoisseurs, and anyone who wants to see Dan Mutha#&$in Nokes, 21st Century Sandshark Studios, and the Cosplaying Spokeschicken at Comicon 2013 to give what they can, and spread the word! 

 

BUT DAN!  WHAT DOES MY MONEY GO TOWARDS?

Simple!  I am trying to raise about $2500 to cover the costs of this convention.  That includes

-Table Space at the show

-Plane Flight up and back

-Accommodations at somewhere where I hopefully wont get shot, robbed or stabbed

This will not go towards

-Exotic Dancers

- Dinners at expensive fancy restaurants (Like Chipotle, or Fatburger)

-Cheap prescription meds in TJ

- Replica Xena costume (For a friend…not for me at all…Heh!)

- Renting a zombie horde to do my bidding

- Exclusive photo ops with the surviving cast members of SPACE 1999

AND WHAT DO I GET OUT OF ALL OF THIS?!?

Besides the warm and fuzzy feeling that you have helped out a small sliver of independent small press comics get a shot at Comicon and playing the big stage, and thus bucking the system?!? 

Well since you asked?!....

How about…

-Exclusive Prints

-Original sketchcards Commissions

-Original Commissions and artwork of YOUR CHOICE!!!

-A big placcard at Comicon stating your participation in making all this happen!

So give generously, give till’ it hurts, give until someone who cares for you questions your mental well being!  Spread the word, get the message out there, tell a friend, tell more than one friend, help me buck the system, damn the man, and 

GET THE ALMIGHTY 21 SANDSHARK TO COMICON in 2013!!!!

story:
SUPERCREW: Their Journey Begins

Their Story:

In a world gone mad, where children intimidate other children into submission, where bullies take over playgrounds at recess and residential streets after school, how are parents supposed to protect their children? How are children supposed to protect themselves?

Radio Baxter, an L.A. D.J. with KJDT, has promised to mentor and watch out for three boys from local families. He wants to give them the guidance, be a role model, and protect them in ways that he never was while growing up in foster homes. It wasn’t easy, but he made it. His crew — Man-E, B-Brain, and Whoosh — are doing well. They excel in school, at sports, and B-Brain’s got a talent for music that Radio envies. Yeah, all is going well until he takes them on a camping trip. First there’s an Earthquake, then they’re all exposed to Alien tech, now — well, now they’ve all got superpowers. How do you protect and give guidance to three boys with special abilities?

To make it worse there’s a crazy man, Horace Morgan, calling himself The Ace of Horror, who was also exposed to the Alien tech. He knows that Radio and his crew, The SuperCrew, are the only ones that can stop his diabolical plan and he’ll do everything in his power to destroy them.

Character bios:

RAYMOND “RADIO” BAXTER

30s, hip, cool, fresh, and, most importantly, caring. Radio was raised in foster homes from an early age. He didn’t have anyone to watch out for him, so he promised himself that when he could he would watch out for under¬privileged kids and help them find their way.

MANUELO “MAN-E” RODRIGUEZ

a 14 year-old Hispanic boy. His Dad’s in jail. His brother, Paco is following in their Dad’s footsteps. His Mom signed him up for Radio’s mentor program and the change she’s seen in Man-E warms her heart. He’s a good kid and now he has someone to channel his energy in a good direction. Man-E can bench press twice his weight so if you can’t find him, check the gym.

BRIAN “B-BRAIN” HOLLANDER

is a 13 year-old African-American boy, smaller than most kids his age. He’s smart. He’s musical. “Math and music, man!” is his tag line. His Granny raised him when his folks left. His brother took the army over jail when caught in a bad drug deal. Hanging with Radio and his crew allows B-Brain to be himself, to be smart and to play his sax.

WANG HO “WHOOSH” HSU

a 13 year-old Chinese boy straight out of Hong Kong. Whoosh’s Mom escaped Whoosh’s Dad in the middle of the night. Oh, the beatings she would get. She promised Wang Ho that he would be safe. His Mom doesn’t speak English very well, but she works hard and lets him do stuff with Radio and his crew. There’s nobody faster on his feet than Whoosh — especially when the neighborhood toughs are looking for trouble.

HORACE MORGAN/ THE ACE OF HORROR

40s, is an evil looking White man. Horace worked all his life. He watched other folks get ahead because of social welfare programs and handouts. He wants his share. He wants what he’s owed, and when that Alien Artifact gives him special powers, well, Horace isn’t one to look a gift horse in the mouth: first L.A., then the World.

Your Story:

That's right! We want to hear your anti-bullying story. Come to the SUPERCREW Comics Blog and tell us your story.

Were you bullied? Did someone intimidate you? Was control taken from you? How did you stand up to the bully in front of you? Did you talk? Did you walk away? Did you discuss what happened with your friends, an adult, or your parents? Were they able to give you the guidance you needed?

Come visit the SUPERCREW Comics Blog to find out how other kids, maybe even someone you know, handled a bully in their life. Even bullies are bullied by someone. That kid or that adult bullying you might be looking for advice, they might even be looking for someone to talk to who will listen to them.

Become a part of the solution! Become a member of the SUPERCREW! Tell us your story?

And don't forget, you or your child could be included in upcoming issues of SUPERCREW Comics. Check out our pledges for more information.

The SUPERCREW Comics Blog!

Our Story:

Merlino Dreamlab -

Tomaso Baldassarra & Dario Cavada:

Tommy & Dario's adventure began in 2010, when Tomaso Baldassarra, an Illustrator who had already produced a series of children’s books, and Dario Cavada, an engineer with the soul of a musician, first met. The Merlino DreamLab brand was born from this meeting with the intention of creating something innovative using new technologies in order to make Tommy's “paper” books interactive and more engaging. They dove into this adventure without worrying about what could go wrong. Their first project was done using Adobe Flash. This was a joint project in association with the “Azienda per il Turismo della Val di Fiemme” (The Fiemme Valley Tourism Association). They had their first “eureka” moment with the advent of the iPad which was described as almost "magical" by Steve Jobs. It was love at first sight! The iPad could help bring their dream of interactivity and ease of use to reality and to their audience!

Tommy’s creativity and talent along with Dario’s engineering and musical abilities allowed their ideas to meld seamlessly. After seeing the first series of applications for interactive books, such as "Alice for iPad,” they started developing their first app. After six months of love and labor they finished their app. What a wonderful moment! What a great feeling!

John Joseph Andrucci:

John started in film and Television many years ago. He worked for an educational film distributor who also produced After School Specials (yes, he's a little bit of TV history). He then went on to work for an animation company that produced Saturday morning cartoons. This was his dream when he was a little kid and he got to live it. He remembers sitting in front of the television saying, “I’m going to do that.” John wanted to create the shows; to entertain. He started writing - specifically he started ghost writing. He took other people’s ideas and characters and plots and wrote their stories. He did this for many years. Now, he wants to bring his stories, his creations to you. He wants to entertain you. He hopes you enjoy the SUPERCREW: Their Journey Begins, and looks forward to bringing you more enjoyment as you get to know him and his characters.

KJDT Entertainment:

KJDT was born from the need of two creative entities and the ability of each to help the other. Dario & Tommy needed an English Editor to assist with the Italian translation of their property, ELISEO & THE LEGENDS OF THE FIEMME VALLEY. John needed illustrations for the SUPERCREW. As the months past their working relationship grew stronger, other projects were brought into the arrangement, more illustrations were drawn, more stories shared. They became a super-crew of their own. KJDT, Radio's radio station call letters, an acronym of John, Dario and Tommy's initials became the call letters for their new company. A company that reaches across the Atlantic and hopes to reach children around the world to deliver the anti-bullying message in the SUPERCREW.

The Story:

Their story, your story, and our story; it doesn't stop here. That's why we want you to become a part of The SUPERCREW story, a member of The SUPERCREW, and be a part of the anti-bullying story.

Let's put an end to bullying!

Watch for the continuing story of The SUPERCREW:

Volume #2 of the Graphic Novels; Issues #6 through #10 of SUPERCREW Comics!

The Animated Television Series!

The Animated Feature Film!

The Games!

Imagine a world without bullies!

Become a member of Radio's Crew!

Become a member of The SUPERCREW!

Visit us:

The Blog:

http://supercrewcomics.blogspot.it/

On the web:

www.supercrewcomics.com

www.kjdtentertainment.com

Follow us on Twitter:

twitter.com/supercrewcomics

twitter.com/kjdtent

Follow us on Linked In:

www.linkedin.com/company/3107947

Watch us on YouTube:

www.youtube.co/user/KJDTEntertainment

Like us on facebook:

www.facebook.com/pages/Supercrew

www.facebook.com/pages/KJDT-Entertainment

Stretch Goals

$60,000 – All pledge donors will receive a digital version of Issue #2, Volume 1 of SuperCrew Comics.

$90,000 - All pledge donors will receive a digital version of Issues #2 & #3, Volume 1 of SuperCrew Comics.

$120,000 - All pledge donors will receive a digital version of Issues #2, #3, and #4, Volume 1 of SuperCrew Comics.

$150,000 - All pledge donors will receive a digital version of Issues #2, #3, #4 and #5, Volume 1 of SuperCrew Comics.

$180,000 - All pledge donors will receive a digital version of Volume 1 of SuperCrew Comics, and all pledges above $100 will receive a KJDT Entertainment T-Shirt.

$200,000 - To be determined!

story:
"The adventure" is a comic book, revealing the romantic experiences of Jack McInlove, who is in love with Olivia and wants to invite her to date and share his feelings for her. But Jack has a problem. He doesn`t know how to do it and often his attempts end in a comic way.

Here comes Uncle Phil, who tries to help Jack. He considers himself a specialist in love and is resolved to make Olivia become Mrs. McInlove. Unfortunately Uncle Phil’s advice is often thoughtless and Jack goes through the entire range of romantic misadventures, as his ultimate goal is to capture the heart of Olivia. Jack and Olivia will go through situations that will teach them the truth about love, which they have not understood before. 

Jack represents many of today's men, who don`t  know how exactly to approach the woman they like and to make their declaration of love. Olivia symbolizes women, who also have feelings for a man, but because of objective or subjective reasons prefer to play with their suitor and test his time after time  before sharing their feelings and pronounce the covenant "I like you too". Uncle Phil reflects the advice we get from our friends or relatives, which sometimes are not absolutely relevant and it so happens that we are not helping much.

We will use the characters of Jack and Olivia at diverse situations to show how people (in their love adventures) look like from aside. Therefore we would like to illustrate the right and wrong ways to act and react in the relationship with our soulmate.

 The comic book will be 48 black and white pages (english language). The expenses on artwork, design, press-preparation, printing and other administrative fees regarding the book’s publishing will be about $2800.

$1 - Personal “Thank you” e-mail and wallpaper

$6 - PDF copy of “The adventure”, personal “Thank you” e-mail and wallpaper

$12 - Printed copy of “The adventure”.  The comic book will be received in January 2013.

$25 - Printed copy of “The adventure”, plus art print 8x10 and magnet.

$35 - Two printed copy of “The adventure”, plus 2 art print 8x10 and 2 magnets.

$50 - Your own comic sketch – 1 page, plus printed copy of “The adventure”

We will draw a full colored comic sketch with main characters: you and your mate. It can be a funny story of yours or something romantic, or just something according to your choice. If you choose this, we will send you a form to fill in the names of the characters, the kind of clothes they should wear, the background, etc. You should send us a resume of the story & your pictures. The page will be sent to your e-mail in PDF format (1 page = 8 panels). The deadline for receiving the page is mid-December. But if you don`t want to take advantage of this immediately, you can postpone it for later delivery or for a specific date.

 $85 - Your own comic sketch – 2 pages, plus printed copy of “The adventure”. 

Same as above, but 2 pages.

 $300 – Supporting character, plus printed copy of “The adventure”. As a supporting character in the comic book you will participate with your name and face.

 

Thank you for your support !

Here comes Uncle Phil, who tries to help Jack. He considers himself a specialist in love and is resolved to make Olivia become Mrs. McInlove. Unfortunately Uncle Phil’s advice is often thoughtless and Jack goes through the entire range of romantic misadventures, as his ultimate goal is to capture the heart of Olivia. Jack and Olivia will go through situations that will teach them the truth about love, which they have not understood before. 

Jack represents many of today's men, who don`t  know how exactly to approach the woman they like and to make their declaration of love. Olivia symbolizes women, who also have feelings for a man, but because of objective or subjective reasons prefer to play with their suitor and test his time after time  before sharing their feelings and pronounce the covenant "I like you too". Uncle Phil reflects the advice we get from our friends or relatives, which sometimes are not absolutely relevant and it so happens that we are not helping much.


We will use the characters of Jack and Olivia at diverse situations to show how people (in their love adventures) look like from aside. Therefore we would like to illustrate the right and wrong ways to act and react in the relationship with our soulmate.
 The comic book will be 48 black and white pages (english language). The expenses on artwork, design, press-preparation, printing and other administrative fees regarding the book’s publishing will be about $2800.



$1 - Personal “Thank you” e-mail and wallpaper
$6 - PDF copy of “The adventure”, personal “Thank you” e-mail and wallpaper
$12 - Printed copy of “The adventure”.  The comic book will be received in January 2013.
$25 - Printed copy of “The adventure”, plus art print 8x10 and magnet.
$35 - Two printed copy of “The adventure”, plus 2 art print 8x10 and 2 magnets.
$50 - Your own comic sketch – 1 page, plus printed copy of “The adventure”
We will draw a full colored comic sketch with main characters: you and your mate. It can be a funny story of yours or something romantic, or just something according to your choice. If you choose this, we will send you a form to fill in the names of the characters, the kind of clothes they should wear, the background, etc. You should send us a resume of the story & your pictures. The page will be sent to your e-mail in PDF format (1 page = 8 panels). The deadline for receiving the page is mid-December. But if you don`t want to take advantage of this immediately, you can postpone it for later delivery or for a specific date.
 $85 - Your own comic sketch – 2 pages, plus printed copy of “The adventure”. 
Same as above, but 2 pages.
 $300 – Supporting character, plus printed copy of “The adventure”. As a supporting character in the comic book you will participate with your name and face.
 
Thank you for your support !

story:
The Story:

Here we go again! After an AMAZING FIRST EVER campaign for Rubicon Comics last year AND a successful Kickstarter campaign for Issue #2 we are bringing you ISSUE #2 HERE ON INDIEGOGO as a second chance campaign!

With this series, I am fusing a unique blend of Lovecraftian Horror and the superhero genre, something I call the Lovecraftian Dark Heroverse. A world filled with the insanity, fear, and terror of the Lovecraft Mythos but also a world were heroes with these eldritch powers can exist as well. Think Silver Surfer meets Cthulhu meets Constantine!

 

The talented Alper Geçgel is returning for the page art (pencils and inks) and Sercan Sarikaya on colors. We have a slew of amazing cover artists including Jay Espin, Vic King, Deti, and the talented and very experienced Mark McKenna!

 

Last we left Isidora, she had managed to free herself from the King in Yellow and is on Earth doling out her own brand of justice but also seeking to protect the innocent, something she was unable to do as the King in Yellow's Herald. 

During a battle with some of Shub Niggurath's acolytes, a human detective, Constance Hawkberk, managed to grab a hold of the Yellow Sign and nearly died. Trying to protect her and battle the acolytes, Isidora was in a precarious situation. That is until the Great Old One, Nyarlathothep showed up to Isidora's shock!

I can't wait to put this issue into your hands and continuing this story fusing a unique blend of Lovecraftian Horror and the superhero genre.

What We Need & What You Get:

  • This book was already fully funded on Kickstarter and will fulfill before November 2021. There is no worry or chance it won't be completed.
  • This campaign is merely to give those who prefer Indiegogo as a crowdfund and to offer them a chance to back this project with the platform they prefer.

The Tiers:

 

Page Previews:

Risks & Challenges

This is not my first campaign so I have experience in crowdfunding.

  • My novel Souls of Magic's Dawn and Issue #1 of Isidora were funded successfully and fulfilled prior to the promised date. 
  • Issue #2 of Isidora was fully funded on July 16th on Kickstarter and is in production.
  • This comic is completely written and I have paid for all the artwork already. The artists began work on the project 2 months prior and barring any unforeseen problems the book will be ready to print by the time we launch so there is no risk that the project will not be completed. However, there is a possibility for delays in printing and distribution that I cannot foresee. To mitigate that risk, I'm using a reputable printing partner that I used for Issue #1 and my expectations are to fulfill long before the fulfillment date. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign! Share it on social media and with your friends and family
