story:
Help fund the CANDI 2069 #1 premiere at Flashback Weekend!

Thanks for taking the time to check out our campaign.  We are raising funds for the production of a new adult comic, CANDI 2069 #1, and its premiere at the Flashback Weekend horror movie convention in Rosemont, Illinois August 8-10, 2014.

The book was created by artist Paul Schultz (who literally dreamed the plot), me (who fleshed out the script and did the lettering), Sean Kasper (who inked Paul's work), Mike Indovina (who created the logo), and Samantha the Muscle Goddess - a real-life, professional dominatrix and fitness model who became the inspiration for the character.

The story involves a group of scientists on a space station orbiting Earth in the year 2069.  The five male, one female crew is getting cabin fever from being on the station so long without physical pleasures, and the guys aren't keen on hooking up with Carol Mallard - the BBW who just wants some attention from the crew.

Enter a Cybernetic Android Nymphomaniac Designed for Intercourse, beamed up to the station to settle the crew down so they can explore a weird space anomaly.  Before too much fun can be had, however, an alien vessel emerges from a worm hole to capture the station.  In an attempt to teleport down to Earth, Carol is melded with the android and becomes CANDI - super-strong, super-sexy, super-bad.  Can she and the crew stop the invasion, and can they keep their hands off each other long enough to do it?

What we need and what you get

We need funding to help float the bill for creating the book and premiering it at Flashback Weekend.  The book is complete and ready for press, so these funds go toward paying for the inks and logo, printing the copies, our table and travel fees for Flashback Weekend, copyright fees for the script, and shipping books and goodies to you, the contributors.

Speaking of goodies, we have a lot of fun ones that range from a copy of the book (starting at no higher than the normal sale price) to a spanking from Samantha herself at Flashback Weekend.  Check out our perks.  We have something for every budget, and some of the perks are very limited quantities.

We have some great artwork perks in this campaign.  How about this one-of-a-kind original sketch of CANDI by Paul Schultz?  We'll have color prints of this at the $25.00 level and the original art at the $150.00 level.

Sean Kasper has also contributed this original sketch of CANDI at the $75.00 level. This is an unfinished scan, mind you.  The finished piece will look even better.

Want more great art?  How about the original cover artwork at the $200.00 level?  Looking for something a little lighter?  Custom sketches are at the $40.00 and $75.00 levels.

    You can help a goddess

    This is Goddess Samantha's first comic.  She loves comics (not to mention horror movies) and is excited to see this come to life.  Your contributions can help her dream come true.

    Some of our perks include signed photos of Samantha, including glamour, fetish, and topless photos.  She may send you something like this…

    …and who wouldn't want a signed copy of that?

      Risks & Challenges

      Goddess Samantha is coming all the way from Atlanta for Flashback Weekend, so any help we can get to bring her there is greatly appreciated.  Self-publishing is an expensive venture and without your help, we, the creative team, are taking a big hit on this project.  

        Other Ways You Can Help

        We understand if you can't contribute some cash, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

        • Please ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. We need all the word-of-mouth and online sharing we can get.
        • You can use the Indiegogo share tools to help you promote our project.

        Thanks for reading this far, for contributing, and for being fans of indie comics.

        Nik, Paul, Sean, Mike, and Goddess Samantha

story:
I want to thank you folks in advance for your generosity.

I know $3 isn’t much and I won’t be having a latte in London but it’ll get me that morning bitter kickstart…you know the one! I drink it black with no sugar but if I raise as much as $5 well I might even try a cappuccino. I've had to ask for a minimum of $500 on Indiegogo but I'll be happy with $3.

Of course if I don't reach my goal, no worries, but if I do then Starbucks will get pretty sick of me and have to throw me out at night!

Cheers,

Doc Roonald

I know $3 isn’t much and I won’t be having a latte in London but it’ll get me that morning bitter kickstart…you know the one! I drink it black with no sugar but if I raise as much as $5 well I might even try a cappuccino. I've had to ask for a minimum of $500 on Indiegogo but I'll be happy with $3.
Of course if I don't reach my goal, no worries, but if I do then Starbucks will get pretty sick of me and have to throw me out at night!

Doc Roonald

story:
Alle Zeichnungen sind unten im Scrollbereich abgebildet.

Dear international backers, we're sorry that shipping is limited to German-speaking countries - with the exception of the minor role-perk (Ger.: "Nebenrolle"). However, you can obtain the digital German version or join our FB-group (see link below) to get alerted when an English version is in the making.

Story

Jahrhundertwende im deutschen Kaiserreich: Der Nigromant und Wissenschaftler Graf Vadim von Ogmios versucht alles, die Mechanismen der Geschichte so zu manipulieren, auf dass bald ein großer Krieg losbricht. Unabsichtlich und ohne es zu bemerken, ermöglicht er dabei der hellseherisch begabten Eugenia eine Initiation in die Parallelwelt des Okkulten. Anfangs verstört davon, lernt sie schnell dazu und sieht in eine Zukunft, in der grauenvolle böse Mächte herrschen. Inmitten von Modernität und Magie, zwischen Vision und Wirklichkeit kommt es zu einer zweiten Begegnung der beiden, die über das Schicksal der Welt entscheidet.

Besonderheiten

  • zum Teil reale Persönlichkeiten wie Marie Curie, Albert Einstein, Rosa Luxemburg, Mata Hari, Houdini, Sigmund Freud oder Friedrich Nietzsche - alternative, symbolische Historie
  • grafische Umsetzung als klassischer Schwarz-Weiß-Comic mit magischen Farbelementen sowie in Kunststilen der Zeit

Projekt-Status

  • fertiges Skizzen-Skript
  • mehrere Seiten und "Gemälde" (für voraussichtlich ca. 120 Buchseiten) bereits umgesetzt

ACHTUNG: Ein Verlag ist interessiert. So würde uns schon ca. die Hälfte des Ziels weiterhelfen.

Ziele

Ja, der Finanzierungsbetrag ist hoch angesetzt, aber realistisch. Weil allein die Produktion davon gut die Hälfte verschlingen wird, haben wir etwas Luft eingeplant, um ein wirklich hochwertiges, schönes Werk hinzubekommen:

  • Lebensunterhalt und Materialkosten für die Künstlerin Tanja während der Umsetzung
  • Unkosten für Kampagnen-Marketing
  • Produktion der Perk-Exemplare vorerst bei einem Print-on-Demand-Anbieter
  • Versand der Perks an dich
  • bei Überfinanzierung bzw. falls deutlich Gewinn anfällt, werden wir definitiv Geld an Hilfsorganisationen in Kriegsgebieten spenden

Über uns

Wir sind Freiberufler, Freidenker fern vom Mainstream und mögen engagierte Literatur:

  • Tanja (Zeichnerin, Grafikerin, Künstlerin - nenn es, wie du willst)
  • Sandi (Ideengeber, Skript-Schreiber & Kampagnen-Betreuer)

Updates, Perks & Geld zurück für dich

In unserer Facebook-Gruppe informieren wir laufend über den Fortschritt des Projekts. Gerne kannst du dort teilen, liken, Freunde einladen und mit uns in Kontakt treten. Die Fertigstellung des Projekts und Auslieferung der Perks (siehe rechts) ist frühestens für Anfang 2015 eingeplant.

Bei Nichterreichen des Finanzierungsziels wird dein Geld automatisch vollständig zurücküberwiesen. Als Zahlungsmittel sind Kreditkarte und Paypal akzeptiert. Es gibt also nichts zu verlieren, am besten gleich jetzt aktiv werden!

Danke jetzt schon für deine Unterstützung.

(c) Bild: Tanja - (c) Idee, Charaktere, Text: Sandi


Auszug aus dem 1. von 4 Ogmios-Kapiteln:



Auszug aus dem 1. Eugenia-Kapitel, Impressionismus:


Auszug aus dem 2. Eugenia-Kapitel, Jugendstil:

Auszug aus dem 3. Eugenia-Kapitel, Expressionismus:

Auszug aus dem 4. Eugenia-Kapitel, Kubismus:

story:
WHO AM I? 

I go by Shade and have been an independent comic artist + writer for over fifteen years.

I’m the creator of such titles as Sinsationals, the Rule 34 Megazines and my most recent effort, SuperHeroes After Dark: Extreme.

I’ve successfully shipped seven Kickstarter campaigns, and my recent Kickstarter for this very project was also a success, but I hope to expand the scope of the project even more with IndieGogo's help to give my original backers and new Indiegogo backers even more content than before!

“Dangerous Curves vs MAVRIX” is an erotic comic project that pits two factions of the sexiest superwomen on Earth XXX against each other in a civil war.

This project will offer THREE COMIC BOOKS as primary rewards:

Dangerous Curves #1: an XXX-rated comic consisting of pinups and short stories featuring the most popular metahuman babes, alien supergirls, wondrous amazons, and pointy-eared vigilantes in comics today.

MAVRIX #1: an XXX-rated comic consisting of pinups and short stories featuring the most popular marvelous mutants, inhumans and gamma-irradiated beauties in comics today.

Dangerous Curves vs MAVRIX: A sexy R-rated digital comic book where two factions of FEMALE SUPERHERO CHARACTERS CREATED BY ME face off in a battle whose conclusion will be decided by backers. This is part of the digital art suite content.

The other supplementary "DIGITAL ART SUITE CONTENT" includes the following:

"Dollhouse" adult magazine: an X-rated pinup comic featuring MY ORIGINAL CHARACTERS from the Dangerous Curves and MAVRIX rosters in various states of undress.

Also, there is the "Matreon" subscription: backers will receive access to post-campaign art via updates, the duration of which is dependent on your selected reward tier.

WHY GO THE "InDemand" ROUTE?

The Kickstarter for "Dangerous Curves vs MAVRIX" recently closed and was massively successful. After the conclusion of the campaign, I had numerous backers suggest I use IndieGogo, and more specifically InDemand, to continue raising funds which would allow more stretch goals to be met, giving original--and new--backers, even more content for no additional cost to them.

At the beginning of the Kickstarter, the rewards were relatively thin in regards to depth of content. However, after it ended and all the stretch goals were tallied, this is what was unlocked(and what new IndieGogo backers will get from the outset):

  • two 10-page "Dollhouse" adult digital magazines (one for Dangerous Curves and one for MAVRIX)
  • 7-page "Dangerous Curves vs MAVRIX" comic featuring a battle between the two titular groups consisting of original superheroine characters created by me
  • Dangerous Curves #1 (5 unlocked pinup pages and 6 mini-scenes)
  • MAVRIX #1 (5 unlocked pinup pages and 6 mini-scenes)
  • two full-color digital pinups showing the Dangerous Curves and MAVRIX girls in respective team shots
  • an additional introductory scene feat. the double agent character, SYLK (digital)
  • mock action figure box art of the Dangerous Curves character, Meta-Woman and the MAVRIX character, Ravenger X.
  • and more!

The plan is that this will be a CONTINUATION of the Kickstarter and all of the planned stretch goals I had for that campaign will carry over here and IndieGogo backers will get everything the Kickstarter backers unlocked. In the end, everyone will get the same quantity of content. It's a win-win for everyone.

With all of the unlocked stretch goals, I'm going to be working on this project for months anyways, so I figured that continuing crowd-funding would be a way to unlock new goals as I work and give all my backers more for no additional cost to them.

 

 

WHO IS "SYLK"?

The double agent called Sylk is going to be a classic femme fatale type(think a mix between Michelle Pfeiffer’s Catwoman, Marvel's Black Cat, Selene from the Underworld movies, Motoko Kusanagi from Ghost in the Shell, The Matrix's Trinity and a dash of Elvira).

She loves money, independence and all-black bodysuits and is going to be a slinky sexpot who is as dangerous as she is alluring.

Backers will see her in all her curvaceous glory!


Leader of the Dangerous Curves girls, META-WOMAN!
 
After witnessing an alien spacecraft crash, Dr. Gail Gardner was coated in a strange, sentient liquid metal that seeped from the wreck and bonded with her, transforming her into an Earthbound goddess!

Leader of the MAVRIX, RAVENGER X!

Little Damara was born into a secret government program that utilized both bleeding edge medical technology and extraterrestrial super-science that transformed her into a living weapon!

story:
WHAT IS ONCE OUR LAND? 

Think of Miyazaki mixed with Mad Max sprinkled with Lovecraftian creatures all over it. It's an adventure, horror, sci-fi, period piece, post-apocalyptic, comedy and ACTION story. Yep, it's all made it in there somehow.

I was able to introduce Once Our Land through Kickstarter in 2015 and after a successful campaign, the book was published by Scout Comics (scoutcomics.com) where it sold out instantly and became a collectors item.

 

BOOK IS ALREADY FUNDED!

No risk or challenges, this is just another way to get the book to our readers.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary

Nova is a science fiction comic mini-series consisting of 6 books. It's being created by two people (with special thanks to a few others): Paul Benoit (writer) and Ricky Gunawan(artist). 

This pitch, in fact, is being written by Paul. Hi. Here's something to consider. For as long as I've been able to remember I've had stories in my head that begged to be told. Ideas that needed to be put to paper. I know that for Ricky, aside from his love of art and his need to pay rent, this project means alot to him. But for me, it means everything. So I'm asking, please help us both share our story with the world!

What We Need & What You Get

We're asking for $1650.

- The funds will be used so that the first comic book in the series can be completed. Afterwards we will attempted to get publishing or event self-publish depending on public interest. Afterwards, any sales of the comics will go towards further funding the remainder of the series and in the even of overflow will go towards a future creative project.

- The funds being asked for are all being paid to Ricky so he can continue to work on this project while passing up more lucrative work. He has bills to pay and realistically it can't be expected that he can take off so much time to work on the comic with recompense. Keep in mind that each page requires him to pencil, ink, color and letter. A week long process.

The perks we offer are all creative or appreciatory in nature. We offer things that we create, including the comic itself and concept art. Also we offer a few unique perks on top of the usual thank-you's and acknowledgements.

The Impact

Nova isn't your run of the mill action comic. The sci-fi setting and close character interactivity of the setting allow us to explore many important themes and issues.

-Besides offering an enjoyable read, we hope to open people's minds up to many ideas from moral coersion and loyalty, identity and sexuality and truth and its virtues.

This is our first project together but we have been able to collaborate for over two months in order to complete the pitch pages you see here. This should stand as a testimony of our ability to accomplish what we set out to achieve.

Give us your support and we will make this happen!

Other Ways You Can Help

Any help you can offer is welcome and the very nature of this crowdfunding site should highlight just how much people can accomplish when they work together. Alone we can do so little; together we can do so much.

- Spread the word! Like our facebook page and recommend the book to friends and family who like a good sci-fi story!
- Share! Share! Share! I don't know if we've mentioned that yet.

Without all of you we could never achieve our goals. So from the bottom of our hearts, thank you.

story:
That is 23 pages + Galaxy newcast from world of our heroes comicbook in  juicy, colorful art by   @horblackhole, and awesome space story by Danis O'stanin!

 

   IN THE SAME SHIP  is a sci-fi adventure in a dangerous universe with lost worlds, ancient  magic, dark goverment projects and black markets, based on history of the ancient galaxy, lasting billion years. 

  The action of the story is set around a team of absolutely different friends, united by the search for adventures and new knowledge about the world in which they live. Tireless researchers, always ready to wade through the furthest reaches of the galaxy and explore lost planets. Sometimes they do not refuse to earn money by smuggling. 

 

 

 By coincidence, team knows about proto-civilization which existed 13 billion years ago. That race has reached the highest level of development and universe knowledge. Ancient legends called them “Creators”,  but nobody knows anything else, billion years ago they were gone without a traces.

The government carefully tries to hide the traces of their existence, and any artifacts left from the ancient race are out of the law.

  The military company of the government - Consolidated Coalition (CC) has taken control, over inhabited part of the galaxy, and dictates its rules. Goods from planets not controlled by CC are prohibited, and of course they can be bought on the black market. Also possession of any type of space transport banned, all transportation is carried out by government companies.                           

 

   

Bak was born in a hereditary family of mechanics and always had interest for different technologies. As a child  he sneaked into his grandfather’s workshop and watched how he created electronic devices from junk.  When Bak was 7, he assembled his first cold fusion reactor and sold it to smugglers, he earned enough money, after that, he left school and began to study independently, in parallel fulfilling orders for repair and restoration of space ships for the black market.

 

In the last year of the university, Chad combined obsolete computers from the library into own neural-net and, with their help, stole classified information about biochemistry from government databases, this attracted the attention of Consolidated Coalition. Later, they recruited him to perform informal assignments, which gave him an excellent opportunity to learn the system of government from the inside. In his spare time, he studied the interaction between bioactive elements on tissues and organisms, based on the government secret data, which helped Chad to succeed considerably in this direction.

 

Nobody knows about Klod, even himself. His first memory was about outer space, he found himself among the wreckage of space ships. As it turned out, the special structure of Klod organism allowed him to live in outer space without a spacesuit. After hours of searching, he found an emergency lighthouse and turned it on, hoping to escape. By lucky chance, Bak flew to the signal, and found him.

 

 

                                            About story

 

We wish to give our story for any explorers of the new worlds and hope that comic book will help to feel your inner strength and see the incredible living magic of the world around us. This comic is very precious for us, we tried to convey our world view and we hope this will help to make you feel like a part of this history, part of this world, which in some way reflects our world and this will give you a reason to smile :)

 

                                              About us

 

    We are @Greentween: Artist - Julia Karpova and Writer - Danis O'stanin. This comics is a story about the whole galaxy, its past and future, each issue is a separate history beaded on the bigger main history. By this comics we want to show that every person can do everything. Magic is really everywhere but hidden and you can learn how to feel it.

   Special thanks to our friend  @YivGaundumbaff for awesome music, his composition - Seven you can hear in our trailer.

 

                                                Goals

 

  • $1,500 Stretch Goal:  drawed map of the galaxy: INTHE SAME SHIP with every comics!
  • $2,500 Stretch Goal: We start to make IN THE SAME SHIP issue #2
  • $5,000 Stretch Goal: IN THE SAME SHIP issue #2 will be 34 pages!
  • $??,??? Stretch Goal: (LOCKED)
story_txt:
That is 23 pages + Galaxy newcast from world of our heroes comicbook in  juicy, colorful art by   @horblackhole, and awesome space story by Danis O'stanin!
 
   IN THE SAME SHIP  is a sci-fi adventure in a dangerous universe with lost worlds, ancient  magic, dark goverment projects and black markets, based on history of the ancient galaxy, lasting billion years. 
  The action of the story is set around a team of absolutely different friends, united by the search for adventures and new knowledge about the world in which they live. Tireless researchers, always ready to wade through the furthest reaches of the galaxy and explore lost planets. Sometimes they do not refuse to earn money by smuggling. 
 


 
 By coincidence, team knows about proto-civilization which existed 13 billion years ago. That race has reached the highest level of development and universe knowledge. Ancient legends called them “Creators”,  but nobody knows anything else, billion years ago they were gone without a traces.
The government carefully tries to hide the traces of their existence, and any artifacts left from the ancient race are out of the law.

  The military company of the government - Consolidated Coalition (CC) has taken control, over inhabited part of the galaxy, and dictates its rules. Goods from planets not controlled by CC are prohibited, and of course they can be bought on the black market. Also possession of any type of space transport banned, all transportation is carried out by government companies.                             
 
   Bak was born in a hereditary family of mechanics and always had interest for different technologies. As a child  he sneaked into his grandfather’s workshop and watched how he created electronic devices from junk.  When Bak was 7, he assembled his first cold fusion reactor and sold it to smugglers, he earned enough money, after that, he left school and began to study independently, in parallel fulfilling orders for repair and restoration of space ships for the black market.
 

In the last year of the university, Chad combined obsolete computers from the library into own neural-net and, with their help, stole classified information about biochemistry from government databases, this attracted the attention of Consolidated Coalition. Later, they recruited him to perform informal assignments, which gave him an excellent opportunity to learn the system of government from the inside. In his spare time, he studied the interaction between bioactive elements on tissues and organisms, based on the government secret data, which helped Chad to succeed considerably in this direction.
 

Nobody knows about Klod, even himself. His first memory was about outer space, he found himself among the wreckage of space ships. As it turned out, the special structure of Klod organism allowed him to live in outer space without a spacesuit. After hours of searching, he found an emergency lighthouse and turned it on, hoping to escape. By lucky chance, Bak flew to the signal, and found him.
 







 
                                            About story
 
We wish to give our story for any explorers of the new worlds and hope that comic book will help to feel your inner strength and see the incredible living magic of the world around us. This comic is very precious for us, we tried to convey our world view and we hope this will help to make you feel like a part of this history, part of this world, which in some way reflects our world and this will give you a reason to smile :)

    We are @Greentween: Artist - Julia Karpova and Writer - Danis O'stanin. This comics is a story about the whole galaxy, its past and future, each issue is a separate history beaded on the bigger main history. story:
What is "Metaphysics of absence"? 

It's a 48 pages long fully colored paperback anthology book, which consists of four short comics with a psychological horror atmosphere. 

Discover for yourself that world is full monsters. They live under our beds, in the shadows and most of all: in our minds. Though some of the monsters may not looks like monsters at all. Do you like dark humor and grim stories? Then this book is for you. 

Despite having the same tone and feel, all the stories are different in their narration: While "Buried" takes more of a philosophical tone, "Colors of rainbow" is lighter with little to no text. Each of the stories is drawn in a similar art style, but I used an individual coloring technique unique to each of them. This helps to create a specific mood and atmosphere, so the reader can find something for themselves. 

It's a non-mainstream graphic novel, though despite some of the dark and morbid subjects, the stories are still easy and interesting to read. The nice cute-looking art fits them well and it's quite unusual for this genre. 

"Metaphysics of absence" is an interesting and unique anthology because of its matter and art; and I really want to see it printed to share it with others. I hope my book will find it's reader. 


Synopsys 

"Buried" is a short melancholic story. The protagonist finds himself in a world of death, where everything is temporal and mortal. But for him, the only problem is coping with death itself. One day everyone died. Except for him. And now he needs to find a purpose and a cause worth living for. You can already read this comics online for free! (DevianArt). 

"Rat" Everyone has a rat out there waiting to eat them. And young Adele meets hers. The giant hungry Rat lives right under her bed. Adele definitely doesn't want to be eaten... Maybe feeding it wasn't such a great idea after all... 

"Colors of Rainbow" is a gastronomic story with a dark sense of humor and colorful characters. The main hero knows what he likes, but slowly his desires are turning into obsessions that lead him up the skies. But won't his delight turn into delirium? You can already read this comics online for free! (HERE) 

"Butterfly Dream" Welcome to the nightmare of a girl. "The world is full of monsters. There are only shadows", - thinks the protagonist. She wears a blindfold and carries a lantern to protect from the monsters. But how can one can see a light, if their eyes are closed?.. 


Risks and Challenges 

Ordering and printing a book can be a challenge, but as soon as the campaign ends (successfully), "Metaphysics of absence" will be sent to printer. So you will receive your copy approximately in the middle of May. 

Because this is a fixed funding campaign, if the target is not reached by the deadline, you will get all your contributions back through the Indiegogo platform. 


What We Need & What You Get 

My goal is to get my first book self-published and printed. 

And for the cost of 15 euro (including shipping to Belgian addresses) you can purchase a copy! 

For 5 euro you can already receive a Digital Version of the full Book in PDF. 

If you want to contribute more, I have a tasty Menu of Perks for you!  Specifically for this campaign four bookmarks with the main character will be released, as well as a set of custom badge. 

But no matter how much you contribute, your name will appear in the acknowledgements on my website! (monecule.net) 


Even if you can’t contribute, you can still help! 

  • Spread the word! Share this campaign on your Facebook, Twitter and Tumblr. Show it to your friends. 
  • Visit my DeviantArt page (monecule.deviantart.com), where you can look at the Concept Art and read TWO of the comics from this book. Don't forget to leave a message! Your feedback is very important to me. 
 

Thank you in advance for all your support! 

And keep checking here, so you're up to date with the latest news about this campaign!

story:
*Please note, due to circumstances beyond our control related to the Coronavirus restrictions of 2020, this campaign was concluded ahead of time. The funding goal was met but all backers were refunded. This book is however still available to buy as only the campaign was affected. It has been left up in the interests of openness.

 

 

BASED ON TRUE CRIMES AND REAL EVENTS

 

'If you gaze long enough into an abyss, the abyss will gaze back into you.'

 

ME AND THE DEVIL BLUES is volume one of the three part story BAD NEWS ALL DAY, a dark and desolate tale of macabre crime. Follow Detective Jim Mulhearn as he navigates the sewers of soul and psyche while the threads of his humanity snap one by one. In the gloom of a decaying city, in the shadow of trackless woods, in the limitless depths of the mind; will he find justice or be lost forever, swallowed in darkness?

This story is informed by true crimes and real experiences of the paranormal; uncomfortable truths hidden in the dark corners of the world. It was written using several methods of spirit-communication in a haunted house since abandoned and burnt-out (not by the author we might add, but that's another story),  as a way of coming to terms with unfolding real-life horrors. The exegesis of a true dark night of the soul, this book is an authentic artefact of spiritual darkness. 

Further drawing inspiration from works such as True Detective, Twin Peaks, Seven and the canon of artists like Junji Ito, Robert Chambers, Poe, Milton, Hodgson, Lovecraft Et Al; this is a story for those left unsatisfied by the pale shadows and cheap scares of other graphic horror. 

Previously available only through local retailers, the copies made available sold out quickly and this campaign allows readers worldwide to collect this unique new book. Fully complete, the paperback features a campaign specific bookplate and at 186 pages with THREE bonus short stories of horror and weird fiction PLUS designs for a wholly new and unique form of tarot deck (separate deck also available as an add-on with this campaign); ME AND THE DEVIL BLUES offers incredible value to the reader.

Please note this book contains graphic violence and language, it is not intended for all readers and discretion is advised.

 

THE BLACK TAROT forms a completely new and unseen tarot style deck of cards. It was created for use in the story and inspired by the illustrations of artists like Lee Brown Coye and Edmund Gorey, forming both an evocative collection of artwork and a tool of divination. The deck will be presented in a black drawstring pouch and is available separately or as part of both the paperback and hardback collector's packages.

 

NEW ENGLAND TALES was the very first collection of stories that would serve as inspiration for the creation of Paimon Press as a publisher of graphic horror. The first two stories Choir Boy and We Are Making a New World were inspired by the weird fiction of H.P. Lovecraft while the third is an illustration of his poem The Bells from The Fungi From Yuggoth. They are rough but inspired short stories that betray the madness and darkness that would inform the creation of Bad News All Day. They are sure to be of particular interest to any discerning epicurean of the macabre. 

 

SAD STORIES #1 is an 'ashcan' style comic in the same dimensions as the paperback. It includes a short prequel story plus additional material. This is the only way this material will ever be available bound separately and is a must for any serious collector. Each volume of Bad News All Day will have its appendix edition of Sad Stories released alongside it but will only be available in limited numbers. After the campaign ends there may only be a few additional copies left if at all so reserve your copy now. The story material is not necessary to read the main volumes and will eventually be compiled into any future complete omnibus edition, but each ashcan will include several pages that won't be reprinted.

 

PAIMON PRESS COLLECTOR'S CARDS With each campaign launched by Paimon Press we will make a collector's card available. These cards will only be available to backers of the collector's package and ONLY during the campaign. In the future, exclusive rewards will be available to card collector's with the highest rewards available to those with a complete collection. Rewards will include things like original artwork, hand corrected proofs, limited edition merchandise and even new titles available solely to collectors. We recommend you order your card today and keep it with your copy so that you avoid missing out on these rare collector's items; we value loyalty and yours will be rewarded.

 

Your Impact

 

BAD NEWS ALL DAY, VOL. ONE: ME AND THE DEVIL BLUES is the first book produced by PAIMON PRESS, a boutique imprint of both fiction and non-fiction devoted to showcasing the most horrific and unusual tales of terror, crime and the supernatural. Your valued contribution will go a long way to establishing Paimon Press as a home of horror to rival anything in or out of print.

Every book will be a unique and unusual artefact like nothing else you'll find. By backing this project, you will not just promptly receive your books and other rewards, you will be a founding supporter of our humble imprint. These particular rewards will never be available at this price again and are sure to become sought after collector's items.

story:
The Last Pick-Up Artist

I always wanted to make Comics. I drew and made storys since I was little. When my Cousin showed me "The X-Men - Age of Apocalypse" and Frank Millers "Sin City" in 1996 I was hooked. Comics is all I ever wanted to do. I was that nerd, with dermatites, asthma, and slightly skinny fat. When I was 14 I saw the first American Pie in 1999 and listened to blink 182. When I saw Shannon Elisabeth strip on the Screen i wanted to be Jimbo. But that was not my reality... my father died when I was 5, and my overprotective mother wanted me to be save. So I grew up, being "that" ackward Kid. No Girlfriend... Videogames and Drawing. I turned 18 and I was losing in all areas of my life. I was unhappy with my Body, my Skin, My Career (i had none), ....and all I ever wanted was a Girlfriend, to make Comics and be Awesome.

I went trough some dark lousy years. Than I had enough. At 23/24 I had enough, I started working out, I tried to get into Artschool and I dared to dream. In a long time Girls started to notice me again. I liked one very much, something started to develop, but then I screwed it up and ended up heartbroken. And on top, nobody really cared. Just one Friend pulled me out of the Dark, and showed me a new Way. Who would have thought that the quest to "get layed" would be the quest to become "a real human beeing".

I got into filmschool, since there was no comic school. But I always drew and made animated drawn stuff.... and so the Idea grew to tell my story, but in a fictionalized way.

This is when I created The Last Pick-Up Aritst.

This is a Comic about Change, Love, Authenticity, The World,... and becoming who you are meant to be.

If you want to Read Issue #1 or want WATCH the Animated Version (by Jeff Allen), check it out!

 

Comics is for the People, for YOU!

The Last Pick-Up Arist 1 & 2 are one complete Story Arc!

My Comics will always be for Free (on the Web). This is a marathon, and I have so much storys to tell and Comics to write, draw and color. All the Comics I will do in my life will be for print, because it is a magical feeling to hold such a Comic in my Hands and read it in a quite moment. I really love to share that feeling of a Printed Copy with you and I know you love the smell of fresh printed Comics in your Hand too. The Kickstarter is for the Printing and Shipping of The Last Pick Up Artist #1 & #2.

So If you like what you see, Back it!

I like to work traditionally with Pen and Paper

 

You can help make more of these!

ll be frank with you. I am at the start of my career. But I want to make the best Art and Storys for you, and I wont go away and I will keep learning and get better at this Art.

Comic is wonderfull and it matters. And I know all this years I spent, watching TV, Movies, Tv's Shows, X-Files, Firefly, Spaghetti Western, John Carpenter Movies, Vampires, Werewolves (From Dusk Till Dawn, Ginger Snaps), Highschool Movies, School of Rock...the Games, from Mario, Wario, Zelda to WWE and PRimal Rage. I sucked it all up. And I am ready to spit it all out again on the Paper in form of Comics, with things I want to share with you guys and girls about life, meaning and fun. So help me make these, if you want to be a part of this!

 

The First Page of Issue #2

 

Then I scan the Pages and Start to Put in the "Flat" Colors, so I can start highliting it later.

 

This is the Spash Page from the First Issue.

 

The Inked Page... I really wanted to try rain, and found great Advice on Richard Friends YouTube Channel.

I started coloring this Page. The Cop somehow reminds me of Ethan Van Sciver. Check out his Youtube Channel, he has some great Advice!

To Color it i use the Old 63 Marvel Comics Color Palete.

 

This is what a fully colored Pages Looks like. Like they used to do it in the old days.

Yes...Ladys and Music will get your spirits high.

 

Follow your Bliss, know thyself.Ddont just work For money or EGO. But get the money in to make your dreams possible. Cashflow is important to build a dream!

This is a fun comic, but i also want to share with you, what worked on my journey and what failed miserable!

 

This is a Scene from the First Issue, and it kinda happend like this. Only it was in a Mc Donalds and on the other Table there where 6 Girls instead of Two. And a great Buddy of mine sat across my table, instead of the Fictional Character "Jeffy".

Terminator, Scarface and La Jetee also went into this baby.

 

Work in progress... and some sound advice. There are no shortcuts. Only Mastery. Work everyday on what you Value and Love. Ask yourself what is truly meaningfull to you and try to be of good service to others, while staying authentic to yourself.

 

Comics are like good Music.... it has a rythm! (Coloring work in progress)

 

 

If you are not happy with something you think you must do, you can quit. In fact all Pro's master the Art of Quitting things, to Focus on what you really want to do that brings you joy.

 

 

Risks & Challenges

If it bleeds we can kill it. And I am like a Terminator....not that I am that strong. No really I am that passionate and really really dumb and dumber. That why I keep persisting trough all the shit that comes up. Because I love what I do, and I want you to get the best I can give you.

I love the Great Storys, Movies, the Great Games and awesomethings in life. And what I hate the most is, when great Things turn to freakin' shit and people still buy it. It'S a god damn shame, and I always want to be honest where I am at, but also always strive for more and better, withouth beeing a tyrand, but a funny King with his roundtable taking a ride to slay some Dragons! (Or Play with them Dragons some Tabletop Games! )

 

The Story can be over here.

But maybe...if there is more to tell,

Issue #3 of The Last Pick Up Artist has already a First Page!

Gary Vee survived Judgment Day...and he will Save the Past.

 

Yes, I love Comics!

 

Check out my other Comics!

If you don't want to back the Project, check out my other Stuff, you might like it. I have done Sci-Fi Barbarian Cold War Stuff, Supernatural Horror Western, and much more strange Comics!

 

Other Works: Buff Dudes Animated, Noir Werewolf, Barbarian Adventure, TLPUA first Version, Facebook Art Gallery,

 

MyHomepage: https://www.dariodidonato.com

MyComics: https://tapas.io/DarioCOMICS/series

INSTAGRAM:   https://www.instagram.com/dariodiiii/

My Patreon:   https://www.patreon.com/dariocomics

 

Dario's Twitter: https://twitter.com/DarioDiDonato2

Dario's Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/dario.didonato.7

 

 

Upcoming Projects:

Young Tuerto #1: Drawn by the Fantastic Ralph Niese and Written by Myself

(Mad Max meets American Pie)

 

 

Land of the Redheadwoman and Mustachemen, a Comic about Intentional Communities, Love, Sex and War (Based on the Book "Sex at Dawn" and the "Anatomy of Loneliness").

 

The Heroschool Comic: Find and Develop your Talents so you can Earn and Deserve a Living with what you love doing and what you where meant to do on this plane of existence

 

 

 

 

 

TOP SECRET! "AGENT FLOWER / LOVE WINS"

Agent Flower has 48 Hours to get In and Out. This Comic about an American Italian Farmerboy who gets into the "Military Psychic Jedi Warrior Project". In Highschool all he wanted to do is "Rock with his Guitar". He saw Strange Things in "Nam" and now in the Mid 80's in the hight of the Cold War "the Fabric of Reality is at stake"!

(Influenced by THE ROCK, METAL GEAR SOLID, MEN WHO STARE AT GOATS, JOHNNY MNOMONIC, TENACIOUS D, SPAIN RODRIGUEZ's - TRASHMAN, ATLANTIS, 70/80's SPYMOVIES, SEX, MEDITATION, Good, Evil and the Mulitverse. (Sketches by Ralph Niese)
story_txt:
The Last Pick-Up Artist
I always wanted to make Comics. I drew and made storys since I was little. When my Cousin showed me "The X-Men - Age of Apocalypse" and Frank Millers "Sin City" in 1996 I was hooked. Comics is all I ever wanted to do. I was that nerd, with dermatites, asthma, and slightly skinny fat. When I was 14 I saw the first American Pie in 1999 and listened to blink 182. When I saw Shannon Elisabeth strip on the Screen i wanted to be Jimbo. But that was not my reality... my father died when I was 5, and my overprotective mother wanted me to be save. So I grew up, being "that" ackward Kid. No Girlfriend... Videogames and Drawing. I turned 18 and I was losing in all areas of my life. I was unhappy with my Body, my Skin, My Career (i had none), ....and all I ever wanted was a Girlfriend, to make Comics and be Awesome.
I went trough some dark lousy years. Than I had enough. At 23/24 I had enough, I started working out, I tried to get into Artschool and I dared to dream. In a long time Girls started to notice me again. I liked one very much, something started to develop, but then I screwed it up and ended up heartbroken. And on top, nobody really cared. Just one Friend pulled me out of the Dark, and showed me a new Way. Who would have thought that the quest to "get layed" would be the quest to become "a real human beeing".
I got into filmschool, since there was no comic school. But I always drew and made animated drawn stuff.... and so the Idea grew to tell my story, but in a fictionalized way.
This is when I created The Last Pick-Up Aritst.
This is a Comic about Change, Love, Authenticity, The World,... and becoming who you are meant to be.
If you want to Read Issue #1 or want WATCH the Animated Version (by Jeff Allen), check it out!


 



Comics is for the People, for YOU!
The Last Pick-Up Arist 1 & 2 are one complete Story Arc!
My Comics will always be for Free (on the Web). This is a marathon, and I have so much storys to tell and Comics to write, draw and color. All the Comics I will do in my life will be for print, because it is a magical feeling to hold such a Comic in my Hands and read it in a quite moment. I really love to share that feeling of a Printed Copy with you and I know you love the smell of fresh printed Comics in your Hand too. The Kickstarter is for the Printing and Shipping of The Last Pick Up Artist #1 & #2.
So If you like what you see, Back it!


I like to work traditionally with Pen and Paper
 

You can help make more of these!
ll be frank with you. I am at the start of my career. But I want to make the best Art and Storys for you, and I wont go away and I will keep learning and get better at this Art.
Comic is wonderfull and it matters. And I know all this years I spent, watching TV, Movies, Tv's Shows, X-Files, Firefly, Spaghetti Western, John Carpenter Movies, Vampires, Werewolves (From Dusk Till Dawn, Ginger Snaps), Highschool Movies, School of Rock...the Games, from Mario, Wario, Zelda to WWE and PRimal Rage. I sucked it all up. And I am ready to spit it all out again on the Paper in form of Comics, with things I want to share with you guys and girls about life, meaning and fun. So help me make these, if you want to be a part of this!
 

The First Page of Issue #2
 

Then I scan the Pages and Start to Put in the "Flat" Colors, so I can start highliting it later.
 

This is the Spash Page from the First Issue.
 

The Inked Page... I really wanted to try rain, and found great Advice on Richard Friends YouTube Channel.

I started coloring this Page. The Cop somehow reminds me of Ethan Van Sciver. Check out his Youtube Channel, he has some great Advice!

To Color it i use the Old 63 Marvel Comics Color Palete.
 

This is what a fully colored Pages Looks like. Like they used to do it in the old days.

Yes...Ladys and Music will get your spirits high.
 

Follow your Bliss, know thyself.Ddont just work For money or EGO. But get the money in to make your dreams possible. Cashflow is important to build a dream!

This is a fun comic, but i also want to share with you, what worked on my journey and what failed miserable!
 

This is a Scene from the First Issue, and it kinda happend like this. Only it was in a Mc Donalds and on the other Table there where 6 Girls instead of Two. And a great Buddy of mine sat across my table, instead of the Fictional Character "Jeffy".

Terminator, Scarface and La Jetee also went into this baby.
 

Work in progress... and some sound advice. There are no shortcuts. Only Mastery. Work everyday on what you Value and Love. Ask yourself what is truly meaningfull to you and try to be of good service to others, while staying authentic to yourself.
 

Comics are like good Music.... it has a rythm! (Coloring work in progress)
 
 

If you are not happy with something you think you must do, you can quit. In fact all Pro's master the Art of Quitting things, to Focus on what you really want to do that brings you joy.
 
 

Risks & Challenges
If it bleeds we can kill it. And I am like a Terminator....not that I am that strong. No really I am that passionate and really really dumb and dumber. That why I keep persisting trough all the shit that comes up. Because I love what I do, and I want you to get the best I can give you.
I love the Great Storys, Movies, the Great Games and awesomethings in life. And what I hate the most is, when great Things turn to freakin' shit and people still buy it. It'S a god damn shame, and I always want to be honest where I am at, but also always strive for more and better, withouth beeing a tyrand, but a funny King with his roundtable taking a ride to slay some Dragons! (Or Play with them Dragons some Tabletop Games! )
 
The Story can be over here.
But maybe...if there is more to tell,
Issue #3 of The Last Pick Up Artist has already a First Page!

Gary Vee survived Judgment Day...and he will Save the Past.
 

Yes, I love Comics!
 

Check out my other Comics!
If you don't want to back the Project, check out my other Stuff, you might like it. I have done Sci-Fi Barbarian Cold War Stuff, Supernatural Horror Western, and much more strange Comics!
 
Other Works: Buff Dudes Animated, Noir Werewolf, Barbarian Adventure, TLPUA first Version, Facebook Art Gallery,
 
MyHomepage: https://www.dariodidonato.com
MyComics: https://tapas.io/DarioCOMICS/series
INSTAGRAM:   https://www.instagram.com/dariodiiii/
My Patreon:   https://www.patreon.com/dariocomics Dario's Twitter: https://twitter.com/DarioDiDonato2
Dario's Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/dario.didonato.7
 
 
Upcoming Projects:
Young Tuerto #1: Drawn by the Fantastic Ralph Niese and Written by Myself
(Mad Max meets American Pie)

 
 
Land of the Redheadwoman and Mustachemen, a Comic about Intentional Communities, Love, Sex and War (Based on the Book "Sex at Dawn" and the "Anatomy of Loneliness").

 
The Heroschool Comic: Find and Develop your Talents so you can Earn and Deserve a Living with what you love doing and what you where meant to do on this plane of existence

 
 
 
 
 
TOP SECRET! "AGENT FLOWER / LOVE WINS"
Agent Flower has 48 Hours to get In and Out. This Comic about an American Italian Farmerboy who gets into the "Military Psychic Jedi Warrior Project". In Highschool all he wanted to do is "Rock with his Guitar". He saw Strange Things in "Nam" and now in the Mid 80's in the hight of the Cold War "the Fabric of Reality is at stake"!
(Influenced by THE ROCK, METAL GEAR SOLID, MEN WHO STARE AT GOATS, JOHNNY MNOMONIC, TENACIOUS D, SPAIN RODRIGUEZ's - TRASHMAN, ATLANTIS, 70/80's SPYMOVIES, SEX, MEDITATION, Good, Evil and the Mulitverse. (Sketches by Ralph Niese)

story:
The Mach 5

Since childhood, Homero Costa dreamed about a fast car, specifically Speed Racer's Mach 5. The Supercharged Mach 5 is an automotive machine incomparable to any other on the racing circuit. Its unique aerodynamic design, coupled with its special devices, makes this car the leader of a pack of little more than second-rate contenders.

 

 

 

With all the duties of adulthood, Homero has made the effort of making old cars his hobby but no car could replace the memories and good time he had with Speed Racer.

 

 

How can you help us?

For now, we're looking forward to entering other stages of making Mach 5 come to life, such as joining together the main metal Chassis and a detailed Fiber bodywork resembling the curvy shape of the Mach 5. 

Fiber bodywork resembling the curvy shape of the Mach 5.

 

Other parts we are looking for help are the electric part, the red tapestry that identifies from miles away the Mach 5 and of course the on board instruments Speed Racer shows with wit in the animated series.

One of the most iconic steering wheels of all time belongs to Speed Racer's show.

 

Other ways you can help us

Feel free to share with friends and other Speed Racer's Mach 5 fans. We want to bring the Mach 5 to life and showcase to more people too, and why not even be Speed Racer's co-pilot ?

 

Go go Speed Racer! Gogo fund us ;D

story:
Short Summary

Who are MasterMinds?
We are just two comic fanatics who love to write stories for people to enjoy.

Our first project is bringing new and different superheroes into the world, it’s the kind of comic that will make people laugh, maybe a joke taken seriously!

Vera:
A social media specialist, and content writer
Passionate about writing stories and poems, movies, socializing with people

Thomas:
A comic artist; drawing and writing
Love being a geek
Passionate about drawing, reading, video games, and movies

This project matters to us because it represents our creativity and we want  people to smile and laugh more often!

What We Need & What You Get

We’re asking for your help to fund our project and bring the stories to life.

We need to develop our website, so we can publish the comics and use it as our Launchpad for more stories to come.

We also need to advertise and gain as much support as we can.  And then print out our first comic book that will be available for people to buy before we move on to other, more exciting projects.


The Impact

Every little contribution matters to us. We believe that people are always looking for entertainment that's different and out of the ordinary..

In this world of endless routines, we need to take some time to kick back and enjoy a fun comic story.

The superheroes we’re creating are unique and never done before. It’s the kind of comic that will entertain and make people laugh unlike other superheroes who are taken seriously

We hope to prove that creativity has no limits

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute with money, your help still matters to us!
spread the word and share our project with your friends.
 
In simple words, if we didn't raise our target in 90 days, our superheroes might die.

story:
"Inker and Colorist Warlock"

 

"Inker Joseph White" "Colorist Kyle Ritter"

"Inker Joseph White" "Colorist Kyle Ritter"

"Drawn By Canaan White

 

 

Meet Our Maiden, Valentina

When she discovers her mom has been battling cancer for two years and is now close to losing the fight, good Catholic girl Valentina breaks bad.

Knowing her mother’s — the woman who raised her alone, without ever a complaint — only chance is an expensive treatment, something awakes inside her. She decides to rob a bank, no matter the consequences.

Once everything goes predictably wrong, and a group of corrupt cops decides to rough her up (and maybe worse) for fun, Valentina is saved by former-supervillain-turned-hobo Caligula. Seeing something in the desperate girl, Caligula decides to train her… and gets her to sell her soul to the devil, turning her in a Fire Skull Maiden.

As she’s forced to commit unspeakable acts to keep her end of the bargain and save her mom, Valentina realizes being bad doesn’t feel that bad.

In fact, it feels just right.

 

The Project

My name is "Mister X" and I am the main writer of Fire Skull Maiden. I have loved comics all my life, and have been writing and drawing them as a hobby for just as long.

I want sexy.

I want badass.

I want brutal.

 

Fire Skull Maiden will be a physical-only comic book, 50+ pages long, full color.

 

The Challenge

I have already invested over $5,000 of my own funds on this project. Now I need your help to bring it past the finish line (and into your hands)!

The funds raised will be used to fill out the team as well as covering printing and shipping costs. Right now, the team includes me and Irati Pardo (Zeta) as inker and colorist. With your help, we can get talented artists on board to finish the book.

 

The campaign goal is what it takes to make Fire Skull Maiden a reality at 50 pages. Any funds above the minimum will be used to increase the length of Fire Skull Maiden:


 

Back the project now to help Valentina get on her dark path…

 

 

 

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

 

After you back the project, please make sure you share this campaign on social media!

Your friends deserve to know about our little sizzling Valentina too ;)

Fire Skull Maiden Facebook Page

 

(APPLICABLE SALES TAX IS INCLUDED IN ALL TIER PRICES)

story:
Gl'urk & Bo#1 is the first Issue in a limited comic book series created by Taylor King and Ben Napier,  Featuring: 

Art by Tom Hoskisson / Colors by JimmyG / Letters by Matt Krotzer

 

 

Gl'urk & Bo is a sci-fi/horror/comedy, and Issue #1 has been described as "Pineapple Express meets Alien".
 

 

 

Pg. 1 of Gl'urk & Bo #1 (Art by Tom Hoskisson/JimmyG)

 WHO ARE GL'URK & BO?? 

Gl’urk and Bo’s story unfolds in a universe not unlike our own, about 2000 years in the future, where our titular heroes are charged with piloting a cargo vessel that carries harvested mineral ore from the outer reaches of the solar system. 

 

In the middle of a seemingly ordinary run, Gl’urk & Bo are awoken from Cryo-sleep prematurely, and begin to experience things that are a bit strange, even for outer space.

 

We're an upstart comic studio in Texas, launching our first comic which began as a creative escape from the pandemic lockdown, and has grown into an infinitely satisfying creative adventure!  

 

Risks and challenges

This book has been independently funded by 'BG Comics', the creators of the comic, from day 1. We do not have any financial backing or safety net, as we are an upstart independent publisher, and this is our first book! That being said... We have experience with selling merchandise and collaborative projects. (We're both musicians) The book is completely finished and ready for printing. Comprehensive plans have been established for fulfillment and all the rewards. If we reach our goal, we can afford a modest digital print of the book to help us get it into local stores. We are absolutely dedicated to fulfilling this campaign!

story:
About Me

 

       People often wear masks to hide their true intentions and feelings, to take the identity of someone else, yet they are people you embrace the facade and find a way for it to become a part of who they are and accept it as their true self, as a way to express what they couldn't convey before. Such am I, a person that takes something fake and manages to subtract a reality from it, a private person, not very easily approachable and some might even go so far as to say I was anti-social at times. Thus my alias became Pseudo-B, an artistic girl with nothing more than passion and a sketchbook ready to paint a fabricated reality. For as long as I can remember, I’ve been curious about expressing myself. I wanted to know, what exactly is that makes me genuinely happy, longing sadness or creative fulfillment. Why do sometimes I struggle while others I find a way to thrive despite the most challenging circumstances. I found that the best way to truly be inspired is to look at deepest and darkest corners of my inner demons and always trying to reach out to the people who love a more mysterious twist of artistic expression. Although I do not appeal to everyone as they might find my style a little bit weird, as long they are people who are looking to get lost in the unknown are bound to appreciate my creative thoughts. I hold an extreme love for creating compelling characters with different levers of depth and thought provoking stories that some might even find relatable. Hence I started making my own graphic novel with characters based on people familiar to me and situations that hold true, trying to give a more realistic approach to an otherwise fictional world and try different ways to experiment with storytelling, explore the characters while making them feel like real people with real problems. I want to reach out strongly to people with mental disabilities, such as depression and anxiety, in order to help them express themselves through art and design, people who feel society has turned its back on them, who have yet found their own place and want to immerse themselves into place they wish to explore. and show them that there are so many different ways to express themselves. I believe that illustration could help people heal and give them a voice. I have spent a lot of time researching my target audience, and although they all come from different political, age, ethnic, gender, and cultural backgrounds, they all have one thing in common, they have expressed interest in the darker side of art. I do not want to define my market by age group, location or job description. I want to reach all consumers who are interested in dark art, and want to explore this type of art more. Hopefully I myself can learn how a comic works and how I can become better as an artist, that is also an important reason for me to surpass a difficult situation and be able to offer an enjoyable piece of artwork.

The Project

 

      [Code.ECHO] A city long forgotten by morality has dazed people with the false sense of security, rebels that try to find the place that they belong yet the original intention was lost between the system. An experiment that went wrong, a turn that doomed you in to darkness or perhaps a newly found drug that ended in the wrong hands, danger waits for no one so why should it be an exception to you. But what if that did not matter, what if death was nothing but illusion, a progress in a game that you just had to save regularly, then can we really call ourselves human. What differentiates us from programs and machines waiting for the slightest error in our code and lose the self that we tried to keep alive. Code.ECHO does not hold the answers, it is simply there to remind you the state of the distorted world, simply the spectator to this fault system that has taken the cover of a fascinated game.  

      

 

        [Name.PROXY] A girl in the shadows, trying to fight for what she believes, is given the opportunity to bring her friend back from the digital jail that his memories reside. Shifting from what is moral to what it means to be alive in the dystopian city that took her friend, she struggles to find what her mind thinks as truth and what her heart considers is right, but that only condemns her into an endless cycle of mistakes always running for her passions and away from her nightmares.  

        

Magnus

       [Project.MAGNUS] Waking again and again in the dark and twisted reality that his distorted desires fabricated. His thought and words no longer his to control the once innocent and naive boy became the monster of his beloved friend's nightmare. Stripped away from the humanity that he once had he is stuck to relive his wrong doings with no way to put the right words to place and warn her for the dreadful distraction that await them.  

 

         

       

           [Code.ECHO] Is a cyberpunk inspired graphic novel that focuses on what it means to be a human and the price that comes when the purpose of a person's actions is removed. The core of the story is the emotions of the characters that are presented within and the struggles of what society see as right. [Code.ECHO] is a dark and twisted representation of today's relation with technology, how you handle your social interactions and the morality that comes when you abandon your humanity. Never the less the project in not a social commentary not its main focus is to tell you what to think, it simply exists as a spectator in the same way a person spectates life and creates their own ambitions and place within this rebellious world.

 

An examplen of the bookmarks

 

Risks and challenges

 

- Keep in mind that the graphic novel is still in progress and it might take a while until it is finished but I want to make sure that the final product stands to the expectations.

- It is always possible that there might be complications with printing or shipping the rewards, in that casee you will be notified immediately. These issues will be dealt with as soon as possible, and I will personally ensure that all pledgers receive their rewards and in the worst case I will make sure to give you a refund.

Stripped away from the humanity that he once had he is stuck to relive his wrong doings with no way to put the right words to place and warn her for the dreadful distraction that await them.                              [Code.ECHO] Is a cyberpunk inspired graphic novel that focuses on what it means to be a human and the price that comes when the purpose of a person's actions is removed. The core of the story is the emotions of the characters that are presented within and the struggles of what society see as right. [Code.ECHO] is a dark and twisted representation of today's relation with technology, how you handle your social interactions and the morality that comes when you abandon your humanity. Never the less the project in not a social commentary not its main focus is to tell you what to think, it simply exists as a spectator in the same way a person spectates life and creates their own ambitions and place within this rebellious world. An examplen of the bookmarks Risks and challenges - Keep in mind that the graphic novel is still in progress and it might take a while until it is finished but I want to make sure that the final product stands to the expectations.- It is always possible that there might be complications with printing or shipping the rewards, in that casee you will be notified immediately. These issues will be dealt with as soon as possible, and I will personally ensure that all pledgers receive their rewards and in the worst case I will make sure to give you a refund.

story:
Hey, do you want to save the comic book industry? I want to save the comic book industry. And together, I know we can do it.  With your help, my heroes can save the comic book industry. 

Hi, I’m Robert Wilkinson. Some of you may recognize me from my YouTube channel as Red Shirt One, or on Facebook and Twitter as  J[uxtaephyeal] Kek Maloy, co author of The Chronicles of Torlenth (the Kek name originated decades before the kek meme). Anyone who read the HMTU Oracle between 1993 and 1995 would recall the stories I authored while there: Steve Logan, Private Eye and the original five short story cycle that kicked off all this glorious madness: Project: WarCar, Dawn of the Night, Mach Force, Full Recon, and Death Machine.  Others may remember me as their co-author for the six novel set Knight Rangers by  R. R. Wilkinson and D.A. Earhart.

As you can tell by the resume, I’m a writer.  I don’t have the skill to draw legibly, and apparently I am unable to find artists, so I am using the Robot Chicken model (Seth Green on High, praise be his name) to craft the comic book that I have been writing since 1993.  It was Ms Geeky Sparkles, of Clownfish TV (blessed be Her Brushable Hair), who lit the fire under my ass (“It doesn’t matter how you get it done, just get it done.”).

So I started with my iPad, the ComicBook! app and a lot of DCUO (DC Comics Universe Online – an MMORPG that I quite enjoy playing).  I had harvested solo screenshots of my DCUO characters to use as stock, but the quality wasn’t what I wanted.  I also wanted more control over the model, the camera angle, the ability to insert the swipe arc on a punch thrown, as well as the overall flavor of each panel. 

It was then that I moved to experiment with the Robot Chicken model. I had a Rock n Roll 1:6 scale and Major Bludd 1:6 scale G.I. Joes, their Jeep, and an American Staffordshire terrier I had found at a rummage.  Using them, I made a three page short (equivalent to a normal cut to scene in any comic book), which I will be posting on my bitchute, link in the description.

When I showed it to my other half, I think I impressed him in that he has indulged me my quest to make my own comic book.  Three trips to Ollie’s and a cardboard soundstage on my living room floor later, I developed my form.  I published Night Force #1 The Dark Before in March and knew what I had to do.

This is where you come in.  This is where you get to direct-inject your money into the industry where it needs it most, when it needs it most: right now, right here, within the pages of the River City Saga from Roh’Nar Media. I need to purchase action figures that bear no pre-existing licensing.  I found a website which builds exactly what I need, but the volume of figures I need (at last informal count, across my entire universe, thirty-nine main characters) plus wardrobe, vehicles, accessories, and hardcopy printing costs would cost a whopping $8,000.  It is money I would need to have in full before I can begin the project. 

The River City Saga encompasses the two flagship team titles (Night Force and Knight Rangers) and the associated solo character titles.  The saga follows the lives of a pair of brothers-at-odds (David and Sean Crozier) as they navigate their lives, separated by only sixty miles, against a backdrop of attempted alien invasions, corrupt government agents, superpowered threats, and a domestic terrorist group. David heads the Night Force, a cadre of parasapiens that gravitated to David’s cause; Sean leads the Knight Rangers, a hand-picked group of humans trying to take their city streets back from the criminal element.

This is what you get out of the deal:

It is a graduated scale of reward.  There are 5 tiers, each with a hard copy subscription proportionate to that tier:

$10 tier receives a one year hard copy subscription  and a randomly chosen three-poster pack (24”x36”, 12”x16”, and 10 ¼”x6 5/8”);

$50 tier gets a two year hardcopy subscription to the flagship title (Night Force) and poster pack;

$100 tier gets a two year hardcopy subscription to the flagship title (Night Force), poster pack and an interior QR code for the digital copy of their subscription;

$500 tier receives five year hardcopy subscription to the flagship title (Night Force), poster pack, qr code, and one original, randomly selected raw page (10 ¼”x 6 5/8”) in hardcopy, signed (proviso: If said original random signed page is found to be in digital format, the recipient of the random signed page will be forfeit their subscription);

$1,000-or-more tier receives a life time subscription to Night Force, poster pack, qr code, and one original random signed raw 24”x36” poster (the same stipulations apply for the poster as for the page).

While you watch this video, I will be continuing the current story line in its current state.  Once the goal has been reached, the order placed and received, production will continue with the new models and back issues will be produced to fulfill tier requirements.

In closing, if you want to help save the comic book industry, please … be a hero to my heroes.

story:
Short Summary

Tunguska is a graphic novel about a secret expedition to Siberia in 1908. The story is based on a true event (a meteorite exploded above the region, flattening a vast forest) but we have mixed in fantastical elements and historical figures, including Rasputin, Lenin, Trotsky and Nikola Tesla. The graphic novel has been a pet project for the best part of three years for me as a writer and for drawing artist Stijn Felix.

After we won a two-yearly comic competition, in 2010-2011 the Belgian weekly magazine Focus Knack ran the first 43 pages of Tunguska, ending on a cliffhanger. In order to complete the story, 13 more pages are needed. This funding campaign has the goal to complete these pages and to print a 1,000 copy run of the graphic novel.

Your contribution will not only make our lifelong dream of publishing a graphic novel come true, You'll get a great yarn in return as well!

 

What We Need & What You Get

In order to get Tunguska published we need 12,500 dollars. The money will go to drawing the remaining 13 pages, printing a run of 1,000 graphic novels and shipping them to you.

If you pledge a certain amount of money, you will also get one of these very nice perks:

  • Your name added as a sponsor
  • A unique Tunguska bookholder
  • A signed edition, including an original sketch
  • An original page, authographed by the authors
  • A special, signed edition of the graphic novel, including pencil drawings of all 56 pages

To wet your apetite, you'll find the 14 first pages of Tunguska right here.

story:
This campaign is to purchase physical copies of the comic book IN TEDDY WE TRUST #1

Having been funded on Kickstarter in 2020, the "Inaugural Issue" of the action-packed horror comic IN TEDDY WE TRUST is now blasting onto Indiegogo with two new variant covers! 

The Trio Cover, drawn by penciler Raymond Gay (TMNT), inker Jeremy Clark (TMNT) and colorist Chuck Obach, depicts a gritty portrayal of our furrious former-president-turned-robotic-stuffed-bear, Theodore Roosevelt Bear, and his pals Daisy and Duke.

The Action Cover, drawn by penciler/inker Rod "Super" Luper and colorist Alonso Espinoza, showcases three panels, representing hope, perseverance, and evil.

The Original Cover, drawn by penciler/inker Luis Rivera and colorist Federico Sioc, showcases the ensemble cast of IN TEDDY WE TRUST rallying together behind Theodore Roosevelt Bear as demon reinforcements appear in the distance.

For those that don't know me, I'm T.E. Marshall, the quirky mind behind IN TEDDY WE TRUST, an action comic series about one former US President's fight to save mankind from demons.

I currently have 100 copies of IN TEDDY WE TRUST #1 with the Original cover in inventory. This campaign's goal is to raise $2500 so we can print 250 copies of the book with the two new Variant Covers (Trio, Action). So please, tell your friends about this historic new comic book series, and grab one or all three versions of our Inaugural Issue to add this patriotic tale to your ever-growing comic book collection. All funds we raise past $2500 will go directly into the production of Issue #2. Oh, and speaking of which, if you want to be drawn into IN TEDDY WE TRUST #2 as an Air Force Airman, there is a perk for that!

 

COVER OPTIONS

 

#1. Trio by Raymond Gay, Jeremy Clark, and Chuck Obach

 

#2. Action by Rod "Super" Luper & Alonso Espinoza

 

#3. Original by Luis Rivera & Federico Sioc

 

INSIDE THE BOOK (PREVIEW):

 

THE 8x10" TEDDY PRINT

story:
The Widow Maker

This is a 24 page story of an elite Australian SAS soldier “Daniel Winter, who is crippled with multiple gunshot wounds. Unable to protect the ones he loves while his family is brutally murdered in front of his eyes by a White Ops, corrupt, Army organization. Hell bent on destroying Captain Winter for use as their own ultimate weapon, “The Widow Maker” it’s one man’s decent into madness, resurrection and bloody psychotic revenge!

Written and Created by “Clint Hammill”

Digitally Inked by “Daniel McIntosh”

http://www.dansdigitalfrontier.com

Pencilled by “Simon A Wright”

http://www.simonwrightcomics.com/

http://artofsw.deviantart.com/

SAMPLE ARTWORK

page.1

page.2

page.3

page.4

page.5

page.6

TARGETS :

The target for creating 500 limited issues and getting them pencilled and digitally inked and off to the printer is $5000.

If the target on all of the following perks are met, then we will also have enough money to produce issue #2 in which everybody who bought a perk for issue #1 will again also be credited for their crowd funding help in issue #2.

WHY DONATE ?

It is incredibly difficult to produce a quality comic book in Australia with no financial backing.

But sometimes good stories need your help to reveal themselves.

The Widow Maker is but one character in a greater universe waiting to be pencilled, inked, printed, distributed, enjoyed and collected by you.

 

Help create this first issue.
