story:
Sumario/Summary

“Sutura” es un cómic de terror dibujado por jaeTanaka, co-escrito con Eduardo Martínez, en el que los géneros del slasher y el survival horror se combinan en una historia que bien podría definirse como un oscuro cuento de hadas.

Nuestro objetivo es dar vida a una novela gráfica que sirva de puerta de entrada a un universo narrativo transmedia que, partiendo de las bases de los cuentos de hadas tradicionales, combina elementos de la fantasía urbana y el terror.

La novela gráfica se lanzará de la siguiente manera:

-  Un Volumen

-  Color

-  Formato Tapa Blanda

-  64 páginas

- Edición en Español e Ingles (Francés y Sueco en su versión digital)


"Sutura" is a horror comic book drawn by Jae Tanaka, co-written with Eduardo Martinez, in which slasher and survival horror are combined in a story that could well be described as a dark fairy tale.

Our goal is bring to life a graphic novel that is intended as a gateway to a transmedia narrative universe which, based on the foundations of traditional fairy tales, combines elements of urban fantasy and terror.

The graphic novel will be released as follows:

-  One Volume

-  Color

-  Paperback

-  64 pages

- Published in English and Spanish (French and Swedish digital version)



Sinopsis/Synopsis

En el centro de una gran ciudad se alza el enorme edificio del Gran Hotel Plaza. Un lugar que en sus más de sesenta años de historia ha protagonizado todo tipo de leyendas urbanas, y que tras casi diez años de abandono, sigue suscitando el interés de los aficionados a los fenómenos paranormales. Un grupo de cinco adolescentes, ayudados por el guardia de seguridad que vigila el edificio, se disponen a pasar la noche dentro del hotel.

Una vez dentro descubrirán, mientras transcurre la larga noche de invierno, la verdad que se esconde detrás de las leyendas urbanas, los oscuros secretos que ocultan las paredes del Gran Hotel Plaza, y lo delgados que son los muros que separan nuestra realidad de otra, terrible, que es una sombra deformada de nuestro propio mundo.


In the downtown of a big city the huge building of the Grand Hotel Plaza stands. A place that in its 60 year history has starred in all kinds of urban legends, and that after almost ten years of neglect, continues to arouse the interest of freaks of paranormal phenomena. A group of five teenagers, helped by the security guard who watches the building, are preparing to spend the night in the hotel.

Once inside you will discover, as goes the long winter night, the truth that lies behind the urban legends, the dark secrets that hide the walls of the Grand Hotel Plaza, and how thin are the walls that separate our reality to another, terrible, it is a distorted shadow of our own world.



Cómo puedes contribuir/

How you can contribute


Puedes adquirir la novela gráfica, y recibirla en tu propio domicilio el 30 de octubre de 2015, a un precio especial:

-  5 € la copia digital

-  20 € la copia física (incluyendo la copia digital)

Por otra parte te ofrecemos contenidos especiales como los wallpaper, los documentos extra en formato digital (entradas de los blogs de los protagonistas, fotos del hotel, sicofonías, recortes de prensa…) o en soporte físico (una tarjeta de memoria flash USB con un diseño exclusivo), serigrafías originales del ilustrador…


You can buy the graphic novel, and receive in your own home (october 30, 2015) at a special price:

- € 5 digital copy

- € 20 physical copy (including a digital copy too)

Moreover we offer special content such as wallpaper, extra documents in digital format (blog entries of the protagonists, hotel photos, psychophonies, newspaper articles...) or on physical media (a exclusive design USB flash memory), original serigraphs from the illustrator...



Para qué necesitamos el dinero/

Why we need the money

Necesitamos los 7500 € para cubrir los gastos necesarios para producir el cómic. De forma detallada:

-  4000 € para los seis meses de trabajo de escritura, dibujo y acabado del cómic.

-  2000 € para la impresión física del cómic.

-  1000 € para impuestos, Paypal e Indiegogo.

-  500 € para gastos de envío.


We need € 7,500 to cover the expenses necessary to produce the comic. In detail:

-  € 4,000  for the six months of work (writing, drawing and finish the comic-book).

-  € 2,000 for physical printing.

-  € 1,000 for taxes, Paypal and Indiegogo.

-  € 500 for shipping rates.


Objetivos/Stretch Goals

7500 € Publicación del cómic en papel. 64 páginas, tapa blanda

-  9500 € Edición tapa dura

-  12000 €  72 páginas, tapa dura (cómic + cuento ilustrado de 8 páginas: "La Costurera")


- € 7500 Publication of the comic book. 64 pages, paperback

- € 9500 Hardcover Edition

- € 12000  72 pages, hardcover (comic book + 8 pages illustrated tale: "The Seamstress")



Los Autores/The Authors

 jaeTanaka, alter ego artístico del madrileño Javier Almazán, ha desarrollado durante los últimos dieciséis años una variada carrera profesional que se inició como dibujante de layout para series de animación (Mona la Vampira, Cedric, Papyrus…) y largometrajes (Los 3 Reyes Magos, El Cid). En la segunda mitad de su trayectoria, y ya dentro del mundo de la publicidad, ha diseñado personajes y entornos para campañas de televisión (Bankinter, Danone, Leroy Merlin, Camper, El Corte Inglés…), canales mayoristas (La Sexta, Canal +, TNT) y ha sido creativo de piezas de identidad para canales de audiencia infantil (Cartoon Network, ClanTV, Nickelodeon, Boing…). Además, es el creador del webcomic ROLLER17 y se ha hecho un hueco como dibujante de pin ups en la comunidad artística deviantArt. En un futuro aspira a desarrollar algún tipo de superpoder o, en su defecto, entrar en la plantilla de Marvel o DC.

jaeTanaka, artistic alter ego of Madrid born cartoonist Javier Almazan, has developed over the last sixteen years a varied career that began as a layout artist for animated series (Mona la Vampira, Cedric, Papyrus…) and films (Los 3 Reyes Magos, El Cid). In the second half of his career, and already in the world of advertising, has designed characters and environments for TV campaigns (Bankinter, Danone, Leroy Merlin, Camper, El Corte Ingles...), channels wholesalers (La Sexta, Canal + , TNT), and it has been creative pieces of identity for channels younger audience (Cartoon Network, ClanTV, Nickelodeon, Boing...) it is also the creator of the webcomic ROLLER17 and has carved a niche as a designer of pin ups in the arts community deviantART. In the future it aims to develop some kind of superpower or, alternatively, enter the template Marvel or DC.

Eduardo Martínez, licenciado en Historia por la Universidad Complutense de Madrid, lleva más de diez años ligado al mundo del libro y la divulgación histórica. Miembro fundador de la ya desaparecida FASER (Federación de Asociaciones de Simulación, Estrategia y Rol) y firme defensor de la idea del Homo-Ludens de Huizinga, ha seguido jugando y desarrollando nuevos sistemas de juego (rol, narrativos, online…) en diversas plataformas desde hace más de veinticinco años. En esa línea ha colaborado con organizaciones como Movimiento Contra la Intolerancia en el desarrollo de juegos de rol con finalidades educativas y de integración social. En su faceta de escritor, tras muchos años de andadura virtual en el mundo del fandom bajo distintos seudónimos, se lanza a la publicación de sus tres primeras novelas, El diario de Lázaro, OCCULT vs. El Reich Secreto, y Penumbra.

Eduardo Martinez, a graduate in History from the Complutense University of Madrid, has more than ten years linked to the world of books and historical disclosure. Founding member of the now defunct FASER (Simulation, Strategy and Role Playing Games Federation) and strong supporter of Homo Ludens Huizinga’ s idea, has continued playing and developing new game systems (role playing games, narrative games, online...) in various platforms for over twenty years. In that line he has collaborated with organizations such as the Movement Against Intolerance in developing RPGs for educational purposes and social integration. In his role as writer, after many years of virtual journey into the world of fandom under different pseudonyms, launches the publication of his first three novels, El diario de Lázaro, OCCULT vs. The Secret Reich, and Penumbra.

Daniel Strömbeck Brusén,  realizador, editor y diseñador gráfico, formado en el Rudbeckskolan, en Comunicación Audiovisual (Suecia) y en la escuela de cine documental sueca Nordens Biskop-Arnö (Chile). Lleva más de quince años trabajando en el sector audiovisual en países como Suecia, Chile, Portugal o España. En los últimos años ha trabajado para diferentes productoras españolas, desarrollando producciones para televisiones de ámbito nacional y autonómico. Además ha dirigido documentales, videoclips, spots publicitarios y cortometrajes, el último de ellos, TCHANG, pre-seleccionado para los premios Goya 2011, y ganador de la Biznaga de Plata a la Mejor Dirección en el Festival de Cine de Málaga 2011, entre otros reconocimientos, tanto nacionales como internacionales. El poco tiempo que le queda lo dedica a la música, es vocalista de la banda Bikini Red, y a otra de sus grandes aficiones: observar el mundo.

Daniel Strömbeck Brusen, producer, editor and graphic designer, trained in the Rudbeckskolan in Audiovisual Communication (Sweden) and the Swedish documentary film school Nordens Biskop-Arno (Chile), has over 15 years working in the audiovisual sector in countries such as Sweden, Chile, Portugal or Spain. In the last years he has worked for various Spanish producers developing television productions for national and regional level. He has also directed documentaries, music videos, commercials and short films, the last of them, TCHANG, pre-selected for the 2011 Goya Awards, and winner of the Biznaga de Plata for Best Director at the Festival de Cine de Málaga 2011, among others awards both national and international. The little time he has left is dedicated to music (is the former vocalist of Bikini Red Band), and another of his great passions; observe the world.


Después del Crowdfunding/

After the Crowdfunding

Desde ShotWords hemos desarrollado una biblia en la que se sientan las bases de este universo narrativo transmedia, con la intención de seguir explorando posibilidades narrativas del mismo en próximos cómics y novelas, así como en el desarrollo del guión para una serie de animación.

In ShotWords we have developed a bible to put the basis of this transmedia narrative universe, with the intention to further explore its narrative possibilities in future comics, novels as well as in developing the script for an animated series.
story_txt:
Sumario/Summary 
“Sutura”
es un cómic de terror dibujado por jaeTanaka, co-escrito con Eduardo Martínez,
en el que los géneros del slasher y
el survival horror se combinan en una
historia que bien podría definirse como un oscuro cuento de hadas. 
Nuestro
objetivo es dar vida a una novela gráfica que sirva de puerta de
entrada a un universo narrativo transmedia que, partiendo de las bases de los
cuentos de hadas tradicionales, combina elementos de la fantasía urbana y el
terror.
La
novela gráfica se lanzará de la siguiente manera:
-  Un Volumen
- 
Color
- 
Formato Tapa Blanda 
- 
64 páginas
- Edición en Español e Ingles (Francés y Sueco en su versión digital)

"Sutura" is a horror comic
book drawn by Jae Tanaka, co-written with Eduardo Martinez, in which slasher and
survival horror are combined in a story that could well be described as a dark
fairy tale.
Our goal is bring to life a graphic
novel that is intended as a gateway to a transmedia narrative universe which,
based on the foundations of traditional fairy tales, combines elements of urban
fantasy and terror.
The graphic novel will be released
as follows:
- 
One Volume
- 
Color
- 
Paperback
- 
64
pages
- Published in English and Spanish (French and Swedish digital version)




Sinopsis/Synopsis
 
En
el centro de una gran ciudad se alza el enorme edificio del Gran Hotel Plaza.
Un lugar que en sus más de sesenta años de historia ha protagonizado todo tipo de
leyendas urbanas, y que tras casi diez años de abandono, sigue suscitando el
interés de los aficionados a los fenómenos paranormales. Un grupo de cinco
adolescentes, ayudados por el guardia de seguridad que vigila el edificio, se
disponen a pasar la noche dentro del hotel.
Una
vez dentro descubrirán, mientras transcurre la larga noche de invierno, la
verdad que se esconde detrás de las leyendas urbanas, los oscuros secretos que
ocultan las paredes del Gran Hotel Plaza, y lo delgados que son los muros que
separan nuestra realidad de otra, terrible, que es una sombra deformada de
nuestro propio mundo.

In the downtown of a big city the
huge building of the Grand Hotel Plaza stands. A place that in its 60 year
history has starred in all kinds of urban legends, and that after almost ten
years of neglect, continues to arouse the interest of freaks of paranormal
phenomena. A group of five teenagers, helped by the security guard who watches
the building, are preparing to spend the night in the hotel.
Once inside you will discover, as
goes the long winter night, the truth that lies behind the urban legends, the
dark secrets that hide the walls of the Grand Hotel Plaza, and how thin are the
walls that separate our reality to another, terrible, it is a distorted shadow
of our own world.









    Cómo puedes contribuir/
How you can contribute


Puedes adquirir la novela gráfica, y recibirla en tu propio
domicilio el 30 de octubre de 2015, a un precio especial:
- 
5 € la copia digital
- 
20 € la copia física (incluyendo la copia
digital)
Por otra parte te ofrecemos contenidos especiales como los
wallpaper, los documentos extra en formato digital (entradas de los blogs de
los protagonistas, fotos del hotel, sicofonías, recortes de prensa…) o en
soporte físico (una tarjeta de memoria flash USB con un diseño exclusivo),
serigrafías originales del ilustrador…

You can buy
the graphic novel, and receive in your own home (october 30, 2015) at a special price:
- € 5 digital
copy
- € 20 physical
copy (including a digital copy too)
Moreover we
offer special content such as wallpaper, extra documents in digital format
(blog entries of the protagonists, hotel photos, psychophonies, newspaper
articles...) or on physical media (a exclusive design USB flash memory),
original serigraphs from the illustrator...





    Para qué necesitamos el dinero/
Why we need the money
Necesitamos los 7500 € para cubrir los gastos necesarios
para producir el cómic. De forma detallada:
- 
4000 € para los seis meses de trabajo de
escritura, dibujo y acabado del cómic.
- 
2000 € para la impresión física del cómic.
- 
1000 € para impuestos, Paypal e Indiegogo.
- 
500 € para gastos de envío.

We need € 7,500 to cover the expenses necessary to produce the comic. In detail:
-  € 4,000  for the six months of work (writing, drawing and finish the comic-book).
-  € 2,000 for physical printing.
-  € 1,000 for taxes, Paypal and Indiegogo.
-  € 500 for shipping rates.

Objetivos/Stretch Goals

7500 € Publicación del cómic en papel. 64 páginas, tapa blanda
-  9500 € Edición tapa dura
-  12000 €  72 páginas, tapa dura (cómic + cuento ilustrado de 8 páginas: "La Costurera")

- € 7500 Publication of the comic book. 64 pages, paperback
- € 9500 Hardcover Edition
- € 12000  72 pages, hardcover (comic book + 8 pages illustrated tale: "The Seamstress")


Los Autores/The Authors 
 jaeTanaka, alter
ego artístico del madrileño Javier Almazán, ha desarrollado durante los últimos
dieciséis años una variada carrera profesional que se inició como dibujante de
layout para series de animación (Mona la Vampira, Cedric, Papyrus…)
y largometrajes (Los 3 Reyes Magos, El Cid). En la segunda
mitad de su trayectoria, y ya dentro del mundo de la publicidad, ha diseñado
personajes y entornos para campañas de televisión (Bankinter, Danone, Leroy
Merlin, Camper, El Corte Inglés…), canales mayoristas (La Sexta, Canal +, TNT)
y ha sido creativo de piezas de identidad para canales de audiencia infantil
(Cartoon Network, ClanTV, Nickelodeon, Boing…). Además, es el creador del
webcomic ROLLER17 y se ha hecho un hueco como dibujante de pin ups en la
comunidad artística deviantArt. En un futuro aspira a desarrollar algún tipo de
superpoder o, en su defecto, entrar en la plantilla de Marvel o DC.
jaeTanaka, artistic alter ego of
Madrid born cartoonist Javier Almazan, has developed over the last sixteen
years a varied career that began as a layout artist for animated series (Mona
la Vampira, Cedric, Papyrus…) and films (Los 3
Reyes Magos, El Cid). In the second half of his career, and
already in the world of advertising, has designed characters and environments
for TV campaigns (Bankinter, Danone, Leroy Merlin, Camper, El Corte Ingles...),
channels wholesalers (La Sexta, Canal + , TNT), and it has been creative pieces
of identity for channels younger audience (Cartoon Network, ClanTV,
Nickelodeon, Boing...) it is also the creator of the webcomic ROLLER17 and has
carved a niche as a designer of pin ups in the arts community deviantART. In
the future it aims to develop some kind of superpower or, alternatively, enter
the template Marvel or DC.

Eduardo Martínez, licenciado en Historia por la Universidad Complutense de
Madrid, lleva más de diez años ligado al mundo del libro y la divulgación
histórica. Miembro fundador de la ya desaparecida FASER (Federación de
Asociaciones de Simulación, Estrategia y Rol) y firme defensor de la idea del Homo-Ludens
de Huizinga, ha seguido jugando y desarrollando nuevos sistemas de juego (rol,
narrativos, online…) en diversas plataformas desde hace más de veinticinco
años. En esa línea ha colaborado con organizaciones como Movimiento Contra la
Intolerancia en el desarrollo de juegos de rol con finalidades educativas y de
integración social. En su faceta de escritor, tras muchos años de andadura
virtual en el mundo del fandom bajo distintos seudónimos, se lanza a la
publicación de sus tres primeras novelas, El diario de Lázaro, OCCULT
vs. El Reich Secreto, y Penumbra.
Eduardo Martinez, a graduate in
History from the Complutense University of Madrid, has more than ten years
linked to the world of books and historical disclosure. Founding member of the
now defunct FASER (Simulation, Strategy and Role Playing Games Federation) and
strong supporter of Homo Ludens Huizinga’ s idea, has continued playing and
developing new game systems (role playing games, narrative games, online...) in
various platforms for over twenty years. In that line he has collaborated with
organizations such as the Movement Against Intolerance in developing RPGs for
educational purposes and social integration. In his role as writer, after many
years of virtual journey into the world of fandom under different pseudonyms,
launches the publication of his first three novels, El diario de Lázaro, OCCULT
vs. The Secret Reich, and Penumbra.
Daniel
Strömbeck Brusén,  realizador, editor y
diseñador gráfico, formado en el Rudbeckskolan, en Comunicación Audiovisual
(Suecia) y en la escuela de cine documental sueca Nordens Biskop-Arnö (Chile).
Lleva más de quince años trabajando en el sector audiovisual en países como Suecia,
Chile, Portugal o España. En los últimos años ha trabajado para diferentes
productoras españolas, desarrollando producciones para televisiones de ámbito
nacional y autonómico. Además ha dirigido documentales, videoclips, spots
publicitarios y cortometrajes, el último de ellos, TCHANG,
pre-seleccionado para los premios Goya 2011, y ganador de la Biznaga de Plata a
la Mejor Dirección en el Festival de Cine de Málaga 2011, entre otros
reconocimientos, tanto nacionales como internacionales. El poco tiempo que le
queda lo dedica a la música, es vocalista de la banda Bikini Red, y a otra de
sus grandes aficiones: observar el mundo.
Daniel Strömbeck Brusen, producer,
editor and graphic designer, trained in the Rudbeckskolan in Audiovisual
Communication (Sweden) and the Swedish documentary film school Nordens
Biskop-Arno (Chile), has over 15 years working in the audiovisual sector in
countries such as Sweden, Chile, Portugal or Spain. In the last years he has
worked for various Spanish producers developing television productions for
national and regional level. He has also directed documentaries, music videos,
commercials and short films, the last of them, TCHANG, pre-selected for the 2011 Goya Awards, and winner of the
Biznaga de Plata for Best Director at the Festival de Cine de Málaga 2011,
among others awards both national and international. The little time he has
left is dedicated to music (is the former vocalist of Bikini Red Band), and
another of his great passions; observe the world.

After the Crowdfunding

Desde
ShotWords hemos desarrollado una biblia en la que se sientan las bases de este
universo narrativo transmedia, con la intención de seguir explorando posibilidades
narrativas del mismo en próximos cómics y novelas, así como en el desarrollo

In ShotWords we have developed a
bible to put the basis of this transmedia narrative universe, with the
intention to further explore its narrative possibilities in future comics, novels
as well as in developing the script for an animated series.

story:
Written and created by Jay Pear

Cover art and title logo by John DeLucca

Internal art by Ryan Best, with lettering (below) by HdE

Hey, I’ve seen this somewhere before!

Yep, this is actually a second-chance campaign for a successful comic Kickstarter that ran from August-September of this year, showcasing a new John DeLucca cover variant that was created for this secondary run. The comic is complete, and will be sent out digitally as soon as payment is received once the campaign ends.

What's the story?

Firebreak, a teenage superhero who gets all his pyrokinetic abilities from a strange crystal embedded in his wrist, has protected Starboard City for over a year now, constantly facing off against many, many villains who all want to steal his crystal and use it for their own destructive means. No matter the odds, however, he always just barely wins every fight and escapes every trap by incredible strokes of luck and skill.

Almost... too incredible, if you ask Professor Shard.

Shard, Firebreak's "third-most arch-nemesis" and the one who controls the vast majority of the meteorite shards that act as his Kryptonite, has always thought that something wasn't quite right with the way that certain encounters have gone down. Some of Firebreak's victories are starting to get just a bit too convenient, and this latest one might be the worst. breaking into a realm of physical impossibility that spurs Shard to finally investigate just what the hell's going on.

His investigation will put him at odds with not only Firebreak, but other villains, his own family, and eventually the city itself.

Firebreak #1 is a 28-page comic with 24 pages of story that chronicle the start of said investigation. The full story is planned to be about five issues total, each of equal length to this one.

How did this idea come about, and who's making it?

I've always been fascinated by concepts like luck and probability, and superheroes have consistently been one of my favorite genres. Combine that with an increasing desire to subvert expectations in a way that doesn't involve literally or metaphorically destroying everything that came before, and the idea of "a villain investigating how the hero always wins" was born. 

Initially taking the form of a point-and-click adventure that lost traction almost immediately due to extremely unfortunate timing (starting a project the same month that the largest player in the genre announces their bankruptcy can really put a damper on things), I kept it dormant for a long while until the release of Media Molecule's Dreams inspired me to take a look at it again. As much as I absolutely love everything that Dreams is doing for idea creation, though, I decided to take a different approach this time around and actually turn the concept into a full-on comic miniseries, the first issue of which is being crowdfunded here.

However, as a complete rookie to this whole process (and someone without the use of his right hand, making drawing quite difficult), I (Jay Pear) needed to find someone who could take my script and turn it into art. 

After looking over many, many options, I eventually found Ryan Best, whose style matches what I'm going for extremely well. He's working on the digital inks, pencils and colors for the issue, while his long-time lettering partner HdE, works on the, er... lettering. You can find some more of their amazing work below, with a preview of the first seven story pages:







The cover is a bit of a different story. As I was writing this first issue, I kept looking up at the giant movie-theater-sized posters that I had for The Protomen's The Cover-Up and Act II: The Father of Death (itself a noticeable inspiration to the comic),  and thinking "Man, wouldn't it be cool if the guy who did those made the cover?" Expecting not to get a response at all, I sent an email off to him... and a short conversation later, I'm quite proud to say that John DeLucca drew the first issue's incredible "conspiracy board" cover, which you can also get as a poster through this campaign.

Alright, what are the tiers?

 $1 gets your name on the backer list in the inside back cover.

 $5 gets you a digital copy of the comic. 

 $9 plus shipping gets you a physical copy of the comic.

 $12 gets you a "Case File", a small set of extras(flyer, two trading cards, bookmark, postcard) that hide a puzzle hinting towards the next issue, along with an art print.

 $20 gets you all that and an 11x17 poster of the cover art.

 $45  is the retailer tier, get ten copies of the comic for half-off!

 On top of all that, we have some great add-ons to choose from as well, from signed covers and posters, to personalized digital or physical sketches from the internal artist. A pledge of $110 will get you all non-limited perks and add-ons at an overall discount.

Any stretch goals?

Reaching the full IndieGoGo funding amount of $500 will unlock the third and final cover variant, the other half of the “normal superhero comic” cover.

If the campaign passes that goal, we'll reveal more, however most additional funds from the campaign  will go towards the second issue.

story:
"A bizarre, little comedy. A superhero comic book that works." ~Comic Buyer's Guide

Hey Comic Book fans and Indigogo backers, my name is Jonnie Allan and I am the creator, writer, artist, colorist, letterer, & publisher of The Miscellaneous Adventures of STYKMAN™.  Yep, I do it all. Crazy, I know.

In 2005 I introduced my beloved creation to the comic book world to a rather incredible reception and some pretty amazing fanfare.

"A breath of fresh, silly air that's sorely needed in a time dominated by crises, decimations, and civil wars." ~Broken Frontier

It was picked up and distributed by Diamond Comic Distributors and even stamped with their seal of approval “Certified Cool.”

It went on to be named as one of the top independent comics not once, not twice, but three years in a row by WIZARD Magazine.

The license was even picked up by a toy manufacturer that began making STYKMAN collectibles– a dream come true for any indie creator to be sure.

And yet, in spite of all of the accolades and benchmark successes, certain gatekeepers, obstacles, and ridiculous industry hurdles placed in front of independent creators like myself, forced me to make the incredibly painful decision to bring the series to an untimely end. STYKMAN was no more. (Sigh.)

But now 10 years later, and this is where you come in, it’s time to bring everyone’s favorite bumbling buffoon of a branch back for more madcap adventurers and hilarious hijinks.

_____________________

The Story

The Miscellaneous Adventures of STYKMAN™ is a silly and fun, all-ages comic book series that tells the story of the next arrogant, not-so-bright superhero trying desperately to fill the void left behind by The Legendary Capt. BUCK NEKID (ret.)™.  Cruising into crime-fighting on his high powered “big wheel,” this bumbling, buffoon of a branch, along with his enigmatic extraterrestrial sidekick AL, will somehow prove himself worthy of the global adulation, he believes, he so richly deserves.

Filled with pop-culture references and a color palette reminiscent of a Saturday morning cartoon, STYKMAN somehow manages to stumble his way into saving the day time and time again.  Through bungled crime scenes, botched rescue attempts, and sheer dumb luck, our hero wannabe, equipped with his Uranium Enriched R-34 Spin-jibber, has unwittingly defeated Crazed Confectioners, three-headed poodles, demonic hordes, exploding toilets, and even helped stave off the end of the world by “participating” in a no-holds-barred competition of valor and vindication...

Don't get me started on the pigeons!

The New Comic

In a new and expanded 48-page story, STYKMAN has been captured by the villainous General SOD the Dirt Clod™ in an attempt to exact revenge on any “hero” attempting to claim the mantle of The Legendary Capt. BUCK NEKID (ret.)™. It will take every zany thought and incredibly stupid scheme for our emaciated egotist to escape the evil clutches of this Crumbling Curmudgeon. Will our hero escape?  Will Sod Succeed? Will AL finish his high stakes game of Skiddly Piddly with Uncle Dicky coming to the rescue? Only you can help answer those questions.

This will be the first issue in an ongoing, full color, laugh-out-series series. I have some amazing and incredibly silly stories that I never got to tell. Your pledge will help finally bring those stories to life.

"If humor is the measure, STYKMAN does indeed live up to the earlier tradition and recalls The Tick, Ambush Bug, Groo the Wanderer & more..." ~ Silver Bullet (4 out of 5 Bullets)

The Cast of Characters

"A sharp mix of The Tick and The Pink Panther... These over the top superheroics provide the perfect solution for anybody getting a little too much angst out of the mainstream." ~ Wizard Magazine

Why Bring Back STYKMAN Now?

Timing is everything. And I truly believe that now is the perfect time to bring STYKMAN back.

I remember a time as a kid when you could walk into any store that sold comics and grab any issue off of the rack. Unfortunately, those days are gone. Parents need to be concerned about what their children are reading; heck, even adults need to be concerned with what we are reading these days. Although there are some all-ages books out there, there are certainly not enough.

Let’s face it, the comic book industry has grown a little dark, and seemingly uninspired as of late. It’s time to inject a little levity back into this world of escapism that we all love so very much. It’s time to make comics fun again. And with your help, we can do just that.

What are you waiting for? Let's do this!

** WANT TO SEE FOR YOURSELF WHAT THE BUZZ WAS ALL ABOUT? **

CLICK HERE to Read the very First Issue of The Miscellaneous Adventures fo STYKMAN™ 

What's Needed & What You Get in Return

The funds needed for this project are $15,000. I know it seems like a lot; it takes a lot to produce a quality comic. A good portion of the funds will go to printing, packaging, and shipping costs, as well as fees charged by IndieGoGo and Stripe (Credit Card processor.).

Any remaining funds will be put back into the production of future issues allowing me to bring the same quality at a lower cost.

In exchange for your backing the campaign – depending on which perk level you choose – you will receive:

_____________________

If I raise beyond what I need to relaunch the series, I will begin unlocking "Stretch Goals" bringing more fun-filled entertainment for your same contribution. More BANG for your BUCK (Not NEKID). Some of those stretch goals will include an additional 16 pages to the comic bringing it to a whopping 64 pages, bookmarks, posters, and foil-wrapped trading cards with gum. That's right,  gum!!!

So what are you waiting for? Click on a Perk and let's get this party started.

“…a fun-filled adventure that young and old will enjoy.” ~ Sequential Tart

Risks & Challenges

Although this is my first crowdfunding campaign, this is not my first foray into comics.

A little over 10 years ago I produced a series of comics that I was directly responsible for every step of the journey: from production to printing, publishing to distribution.

My goal at the time was to create a product that was of such high caliber and quality that you could not tell the difference between my independent title and the major publishers when sitting side by side on a shelf. Ironically enough, you could– I used better paper!

All that said, it is possible that there could be delays– such is the nature of producing quality products. Possible delays may be associated with shipping, customs or even the printing process itself. Depending on which stretch goals are unlocked – I will be using several different suppliers all with different timetables – there could be delays with the delivery from those vendors as well.

I have gone to great lengths to research and vet the companies that I will be using for producing my comic book series and collectibles. However, whenever you plan the production you also have to plan that things will not always go according to plan (Try saying that 10 times fast.).

I believe in sticking to deadlines and believe strongly in open communication and transparency. I will make it my number one priority to update everyone with the progress, challenges, and triumphs every step of the way.

The book is fully scripted with quite a few pages of the line art already completed (See below). I will be working on the book as the campaign runs posting updates as I go. 

If you need to get ahold of me at any time you are welcome to post a comment here or email me directly at jonnie@stykmanlives.com.

You can also find me on Twitter: @stykman, Facebook: facebook.com/stykman, LinkedIn: linkedin.com/in/jonnieallan, and Instagram: @stykmanlives

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand, sometimes, no matter how much you want to, you just can't contribute to a campaign. But that doesn't mean you can't help.

How?

Spread the word, in any way you can: Social Media, Email, Phone, Smoke Signals, Carrier Pigeon,.. whatever works for you! Help build the crowd in the crowdfunding.

Grab the link at the top of this campaign page and place it everywhere. Be sure to use the Indiegogo share tools provided as well!

And that's all there is to it.

_____________

The Cover

The Miscellaneous Adventure of STYKMAN™ - STICK IN THE MUD!

Interior Pages

The following are pages 4 - 8 from The Miscellaneous Adventure of STYKMAN™ - STICK IN THE MUD! These will be updated with colorized versions once completed.

This is a two-page spread
story_txt:
"A bizarre, little comedy. A superhero comic book that works." ~Comic Buyer's Guide
Hey Comic Book fans and Indigogo backers, my name is Jonnie Allan and I am the creator, writer, artist, colorist, letterer, & publisher of The Miscellaneous Adventures of STYKMAN™.  Yep, I do it all. Crazy, I know.
In 2005 I introduced my beloved creation to the comic book world to a rather incredible reception and some pretty amazing fanfare.
"A breath of fresh, silly air that's sorely needed in a time dominated by crises, decimations, and civil wars." ~Broken Frontier
It was picked up and distributed by Diamond Comic Distributors and even stamped with their seal of approval “Certified Cool.”
It went on to be named as one of the top independent comics not once, not twice, but three years in a row by WIZARD Magazine.
The license was even picked up by a toy manufacturer that began making STYKMAN collectibles– a dream come true for any indie creator to be sure.
And yet, in spite of all of the accolades and benchmark successes, certain gatekeepers, obstacles, and ridiculous industry hurdles placed in front of independent creators like myself, forced me to make the incredibly painful decision to bring the series to an untimely end. STYKMAN was no more. (Sigh.)
But now 10 years later, and this is where you come in, it’s time to bring everyone’s favorite bumbling buffoon of a branch back for more madcap adventurers and hilarious hijinks.
_____________________
The Story
The Miscellaneous Adventures of STYKMAN™ is a silly and fun, all-ages comic book series that tells the story of the next arrogant, not-so-bright superhero trying desperately to fill the void left behind by The Legendary Capt. BUCK NEKID (ret.)™.  Cruising into crime-fighting on his high powered “big wheel,” this bumbling, buffoon of a branch, along with his enigmatic extraterrestrial sidekick AL, will somehow prove himself worthy of the global adulation, he believes, he so richly deserves.

Filled with pop-culture references and a color palette reminiscent of a Saturday morning cartoon, STYKMAN somehow manages to stumble his way into saving the day time and time again.  Through bungled crime scenes, botched rescue attempts, and sheer dumb luck, our hero wannabe, equipped with his Uranium Enriched R-34 Spin-jibber, has unwittingly defeated Crazed Confectioners, three-headed poodles, demonic hordes, exploding toilets, and even helped stave off the end of the world by “participating” in a no-holds-barred competition of valor and vindication...

Don't get me started on the pigeons!
The New Comic
In a new and expanded 48-page story, STYKMAN has been captured by the villainous General SOD the Dirt Clod™ in an attempt to exact revenge on any “hero” attempting to claim the mantle of The Legendary Capt. BUCK NEKID (ret.)™. It will take every zany thought and incredibly stupid scheme for our emaciated egotist to escape the evil clutches of this Crumbling Curmudgeon. Will our hero escape?  Will Sod Succeed? Will AL finish his high stakes game of Skiddly Piddly with Uncle Dicky coming to the rescue? Only you can help answer those questions.
This will be the first issue in an ongoing, full color, laugh-out-series series. I have some amazing and incredibly silly stories that I never got to tell. Your pledge will help finally bring those stories to life.
"If humor is the measure, STYKMAN does indeed live up to the earlier tradition and recalls The Tick, Ambush Bug, Groo the Wanderer & more..." ~ Silver Bullet (4 out of 5 Bullets)
The Cast of Characters




"A sharp mix of The Tick and The Pink Panther... These over the top superheroics provide the perfect solution for anybody getting a little too much angst out of the mainstream." ~ Wizard Magazine

Why Bring Back STYKMAN Now?
Timing is everything. And I truly believe that now is the perfect time to bring STYKMAN back.
I remember a time as a kid when you could walk into any store that sold comics and grab any issue off of the rack. Unfortunately, those days are gone. Parents need to be concerned about what their children are reading; heck, even adults need to be concerned with what we are reading these days. Although there are some all-ages books out there, there are certainly not enough.
Let’s face it, the comic book industry has grown a little dark, and seemingly uninspired as of late. It’s time to inject a little levity back into this world of escapism that we all love so very much. It’s time to make comics fun again. And with your help, we can do just that.
What are you waiting for? Let's do this!
** WANT TO SEE FOR YOURSELF WHAT THE BUZZ WAS ALL ABOUT? **
CLICK HERE to Read the very First Issue of The Miscellaneous Adventures fo STYKMAN™ 


What's Needed & What You Get in Return
The funds needed for this project are $15,000. I know it seems like a lot; it takes a lot to produce a quality comic. A good portion of the funds will go to printing, packaging, and shipping costs, as well as fees charged by IndieGoGo and Stripe (Credit Card processor.).
Any remaining funds will be put back into the production of future issues allowing me to bring the same quality at a lower cost.
In exchange for your backing the campaign – depending on which perk level you choose – you will receive:

_____________________



If I raise beyond what I need to relaunch the series, I will begin unlocking "Stretch Goals" bringing more fun-filled entertainment for your same contribution. More BANG for your BUCK (Not NEKID). Some of those stretch goals will include an additional 16 pages to the comic bringing it to a whopping 64 pages, bookmarks, posters, and foil-wrapped trading cards with gum. That's right,  gum!!!
So what are you waiting for? Click on a Perk and let's get this party started.
“…a fun-filled adventure that young and old will enjoy.” ~ Sequential Tart

Risks & Challenges
Although this is my first crowdfunding campaign, this is not my first foray into comics.
A little over 10 years ago I produced a series of comics that I was directly responsible for every step of the journey: from production to printing, publishing to distribution.
My goal at the time was to create a product that was of such high caliber and quality that you could not tell the difference between my independent title and the major publishers when sitting side by side on a shelf. Ironically enough, you could– I used better paper!
All that said, it is possible that there could be delays– such is the nature of producing quality products. Possible delays may be associated with shipping, customs or even the printing process itself. Depending on which stretch goals are unlocked – I will be using several different suppliers all with different timetables – there could be delays with the delivery from those vendors as well.
I have gone to great lengths to research and vet the companies that I will be using for producing my comic book series and collectibles. However, whenever you plan the production you also have to plan that things will not always go according to plan (Try saying that 10 times fast.).
I believe in sticking to deadlines and believe strongly in open communication and transparency. I will make it my number one priority to update everyone with the progress, challenges, and triumphs every step of the way.
The book is fully scripted with quite a few pages of the line art already completed (See below). I will be working on the book as the campaign runs posting updates as I go. 
If you need to get ahold of me at any time you are welcome to post a comment here or email me directly at jonnie@stykmanlives.com.
You can also find me on Twitter: @stykman, Facebook: facebook.com/stykman, LinkedIn: linkedin.com/in/jonnieallan, and Instagram: @stykmanlives

Other Ways You Can Help
I understand, sometimes, no matter how much you want to, you just can't contribute to a campaign. But that doesn't mean you can't help.
How?
Spread the word, in any way you can: Social Media, Email, Phone, Smoke Signals, Carrier Pigeon,.. whatever works for you! Help build the crowd in the crowdfunding.
Grab the link at the top of this campaign page and place it everywhere. Be sure to use the Indiegogo share tools provided as well!
And that's all there is to it._____________The CoverThe Miscellaneous Adventure of STYKMAN™ - STICK IN THE MUD!Interior Pages The following are pages 4 - 8 from The Miscellaneous Adventure of STYKMAN™ - STICK IN THE MUD! story:
AMAZON ARROW ADULT COMIC

 

BACKGROUND
DeviantArt 3D artist Chryseis/amazonarrow has for years now shared her original character, Amazon Arrow, to the world.  Releasing one artwork after another with her 3D imagery, Chryseis has garnered a strong following and even ran her own successful IndieGoGo campaign last year to create a short movie starring Amazon Arrow in a production with Steve Noir for FearGirl Meets Amazon Arrow.  It was quite sensual and alluring.  You can find the video at http://www.feargirl.com/feargirl-meet-amazon-ar....

Now, I would like to make things a whole lot more explicit in a comic.

 

THE PROJECT
The Amazon Arrow Adult Comic is planned to be a short 9-page pornographic comic, including the cover page which you see is already created, that delves into a dark, though non-canon, portion of Amazon Arrow's life when she is captured by someone that is her opposite and taken advantage of in explicit detail. With permission from Chryseis, this comic will be created and released digitally to those that donated.  The themes of the comic revolve around the fetishes of bondage, kidnap, damsel in distress, non-consensual sexual intercourse, and filming of said intercourse. 

PLEASE NOTE: If the campaign succeeds, the comic's production can only begin 15 days after when the donation is transferred to me by IndieGoGo.  

 

WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU GET
Due to the level of quality and detail that I aim to publish in and balancing it with speediness with a professional grade artist, colorist, and graphic designer taking part, each page will be expensive. The minimum goal to reach for the comic to begin is $1200 for the 8 comic pages that needs to be created.  Stretch goals will follow afterwards in the increments of $200 of increasing the comic by one additional page.  This increment ends at the stretch goal of $2600 at 15 pages.  Two last stretch goals after that will be $3600 for 20 pages and $4600 for 25 pages.  All exceeds below or past these stretch goals will go towards the creation of other comic projects in my Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/drb7364.

Check out the reward tier to secure your copy of the comic, and a few other goodies for the higher tiers that involves comics my Patreon.  The Patreon comics are all 7-8 pages long, including the cover page.

Also, this comic requires your patience above all else.  The donation of a successful campaign is transferred after 15 days by the rules of IndieGoGo.  With the comic at 8 pages, it would take at least two to four months to complete the comic once the campaign is done and after the money is received.  I will try to get the comic out as quickly as I can but I do not want to degrade the quality of the pages.  As stretch goals are achieved, the longer it would take for the comic to finish with each page needing at least two to three weeks to finish.  

 

STRETCH GOALS
The first seven stretch goals follow each other at $200, the first stretch goal for $1400/9 pages and the seventh at $2600/15 pages.  The eighth and last stretch goals are $3600/20 pages and $4600/25 pages respectively.

 

SYNOPSIS
Amazon Arrow has faced many dangers and many problems.  She has suffered humiliating defeats and sexual assaults but always came out on top.  Now she faces an opponent like no other.  Preyed upon by an unseen foe in the middle of the night, Amazon Arrow brings her quarry to the darkness of a forest only to be attacked and defeated by the Poacher.  Left at his mercy, the Poacher takes advantage of Amazon Arrow.  Will this be the end of Amazon Arrow?  Or just her dignity?

 

THE TEAM
DERB                                               Writer, Project Lead 
https://www.patreon.com/drb7364 and http://drb7364.deviantart.com/.

André Pinheiro                             Artist
http://undergrace777.deviantart.com/

D.R. Silva                                        Colorist 
http://sephiroth0007.deviantart.com/

 

*Graphic Designer chooses to remain anonymous.

 

DISCLAIMER: The character Amazon Arrow is owned by Chryseis/amazonarrow, and she has given her explicit permission for this comic to be created with no strings attached.  Refunds will be given if this campaign does not reach the minimum goal.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
what is Pilli Adventure?

it's a comic you can find in the internet!

www.pilli-adventure.com

.

Synopsis
Once Pilli and Paco were a couple... until Paco cheated on her. Later he died in an accident, and Pilli brought him back as a calavera doll. Together they decided to set off for as many adventures as they could get their hands on.
Soon, many monsters from Mexican folklore set their sights on our heroes. Why did they suddenly appear? And why do they want to kill them?

The first book was a sucess in the festocomic event and sold out
in two days.A lot of folks have been telling me they wanted a second book. Maybe it's time!


This new book collects the second season; mostly stand-alone stories from November 2011 through November 2012, written and drawn by me and edited by Sarah "Chu" Wilson..


 

 


Risks and Rewards
The book is already complete, so the only risks and challenges involve its printing and shipping. The greatest risk would be possible delays.

What We Need
We need approximately $7k for the printing, fees, and shipping. If we make the goal, the books will be printed by fall/winter 2013. Pre-order one now (if you'd like)!

I Want To Help, But I Don't Have Money
Just spread the word!!!
Indiegogo will give you the weapons and tools to do that.

Thanks for all your help and support!

story:
Welcome to SIDEKICK ISLAND!

With your backing we can bring this book to life on IndieGoGo.

Join a ridiculous amount of superhero sidekicks on a deserted island as they go full Hunger Games on each other. In this 48-page battle royale of a comic book, forty-four sidekicks enter but only one will survive the bloody island competition. Please consider backing the campaign to help us bring this book to life--and to find out who survives!

SIDEKICK ISLAND is a perfect-bound 48-page full-color graphic novel. But that’s not all. It’s a love letter to the Silver- and Bronze-Age of comics. It’s also a parody of all the stereotypes and tropes from those eras while being jam-packed from page one with “analog” sidekicks doomed from the moment they wake up on the beach.

 

Co-written and created by the writing team of Scott McCullough and Duncan Walker, SIDEKICK ISLAND will be brought to life by backers like you and the art team of Joel (Death of Superman – The Wake) Ojeda, Milen (GI Joe) Parvanov, and Eric (Cyber Frog) Weathers. Scott has produced two successful IndieGoGo campaigns. The rest of our creative team has worked in and around the comic book and gaming industry for decades and have contributed to several successful crowdfunding projects. Your perks are in good hands!

Watch SIDEKICK ISLAND come to life!

Interior pages 4 - 8 by Joel Ojeda and Milen Parvanov

 

Featured Perk - The Collector's Bundle!

 

Why Fund on IndieGoGo?

Simple. We are independent comic book creators. We want to provide a unique experience for our backers, directly to our backers. No middle men. There is no better place to offer that kind of experience than IndieGoGo. You work hard for your money. You are a hardcore collector. We want you taken care. Please take a look at the perks we are offering. Scroll down to review some of the stretch goals we’ve lined up. We can’t bring this to life without your support. Thank you!

https://bit.ly/3a846zU

Risks & Challenges

Every campaign comes with risks and challenges. Bringing any product to market, especially at scale, has pitfalls. However, DKRS Productions has successfully fulfilled its first campaign and the Sidekick Island team consists of comic-book and game-industry professionals with decades of experience working for top publishers. They've worked on many of the books you've purchased from Marvel, DC, IDW, etc as well as on highly-funded crowdfunding campaigns. Your book is in good hands. 

Other Ways You Can Help

The world is a strange place right now. We understand if you can't commit to a perk at this time. If this is a project that looks like something you would enjoy, there are other ways to help us bring it to life. We do not do paid advertisement. We rely on social media engagements to achieve our goals. If you are not able to claim a perk, consider following us on our various social media accounts. Liking, commenting, subscribing, sharing, and retweeting our posts and videos is a HUGE help. Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

Hi, My name is Nige and I have worked on various indie projects creating music for the soundtracks, I have a passion for Music, Film & Comics and a desire to be creative in anyway.

Zombie Samurai is my own idea I want to bring to life firstly through digital comic book form and then in to an action packed gore soaked manga style animation!

6 episodes that tell the story of 'The Legend Of Shin Takeda'

What We Need & What You Get

I have been on the hunt for various manga style artists sharing the idea that has created a lot of interest and the money raised will go to towards the creation of episode 1.

All the backers will recieve a free copy of episode 1 

The Impact

This is a huge passion for me and something that the team behind it and myself can give back to you. To showcase talent and open up doors for everyone involved and hopefully give some enjoyment of the possibilities that creativity and art can bring.

Risks & Challenges

There are Risks & Challenges in everything but if you don't take the risk you may never overcome the challenge and achieve what can seem like an impossibility!

Any obstacles will be overcome and once the first episode is released then the real fun begins of following the story to the end.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute to the campaign then PLEASE, PLEASE, PLEASE share the campaign on any social media platform and spread the word far and wide
story_txt:
Short Summary
Hi, My name is Nige and I have worked on various indie projects creating music for the soundtracks, I have a passion for Music, Film & Comics and a desire to be creative in anyway.
Zombie Samurai is my own idea I want to bring to life firstly through digital comic book form and then in to an action packed gore soaked manga style animation!
6 episodes that tell the story of 'The Legend Of Shin Takeda'

What We Need & What You Get
I have been on the hunt for various manga style artists sharing the idea that has created a lot of interest and the money raised will go to towards the creation of episode 1.
All the backers will recieve a free copy of episode 1 

The Impact
This is a huge passion for me and something that the team behind it and myself can give back to you. To showcase talent and open up doors for everyone involved and hopefully give some enjoyment of the possibilities that creativity and art can bring.

Risks & Challenges
There are Risks & Challenges in everything but if you don't take the risk you may never overcome the challenge and achieve what can seem like an impossibility!
Any obstacles will be overcome and once the first episode is released then the real fun begins of following the story to the end.

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute to the campaign then PLEASE, PLEASE, PLEASE share the campaign on any social media platform and spread the word far and wide

story:
Story 

Young Rebels is a YA superhero comic that uses superheroics as a metaphor for teen life. Marcos Martinez is a boy genius bored with life. He just sold his social media app Clock to a Chinese company. Now retired he wants to explore different theories. One theory he wants to crack is time travel. Doing so leads him into a life that he was totally unprepared for.

WHAT ARE YOU BACKING?

  • This is a 32 page full color comic, single (first) issue of a series.
  • Superhero genre
  • Young Adults

Meet The Young Rebels

PREVIEW

Young Rebels has a backup story called Huay Chivo

 

Creators 

Marcel Dupree is a writer from San Diego, Ca. He owns and operates Evoluzione Publishing. Either creator or co-creator of comics such as Le Fay, POM, SFC, Babylon Working, Seeing Red.

Alti Firmansyah is a professional artist who has been working in the comic industry since 2012. Her first published work was for Titan comic’s Tomorrowland. She also made an appearance in Heavy Metal Magazine - Maximum Force. Her 1st apperance in Marvel came 2015 with Star-Lord and Kitty Pryde. Her other works include X-Men ‘92, Thor vs. Hulk, Gwenpool, Spider-Gwen, The Unstoppable Wasp, Fearless, and Future Foundation

story:
Description du projet


(pages en cours de réalisation)


Illyne est un projet de BD de Johann "Papayou" BLAIS. Il s'agit d'une BD traitant d'une enquête dans un univers médiéval fantastique, au format franco-belge.

Ce livre comprendra 68 pages, aura une couverture rigide et sera accompagné d'un artbook sur l'univers et les légendes ( de 64 pages ) du monde fantastique dans lequel évolue notre héroïne. Sa sortie est prévue pour début 2015.


Pitch

Notre BD suit les aventures d’Illyne, jeune orpheline, éduquée par Talak, son oncle archéologue. Via cette éducation elle va elle même devenir spécialiste en anciennes civilisations, chercheuse de temples et assistera durant plusieurs années Talak dans son travail et ses expéditions. 

Suite au décès de son oncle, elle va découvrir des lettres écrites par un mystérieux ami du défunt. N’ayant plus de « but » précis dans la vie elle décide de partir à la recherche de cet énigmatique correspondant qui ne signe ses courriers que d'un sceau inconnu. Elle va découvrir l’existence d’une confrérie secrète à laquelle son oncle était rattaché et va se retrouver au milieu d’une affaire qui la dépasse.


Les personnages


Illyne est une orpheline. Elle a perdu ses parents quand elle a avait 11 ans suite à un accident de chasse. Élevée par le frère de son père elle va apprendre à ses côtés l’archéologie, à lire les textes anciens et l’histoire des anciennes civilisations mais également l’art du combat. Son arme de prédilection est la lance. Ayant grandi totalement recluse dans les montagnes, elle est, au delà de sa force et de son agilité, naïve sur certains points.

 Après la mort de son oncle au cours d’une expédition archéologique, elle découvre dans les effets de ce dernier, des lettres d’un mystérieux correspondant signant d'un sceau inconnu. Elle décide de partir à sa recherche en commençant son enquête par la bibliothèque de la capitale !

Elric est un puit de connaissance, étant le fils de feu le gérant de la bibliothèque de la capitale il a vécu toute sa vie au milieu des livres, et rêve d’aventure. Il décidera de suivre Illyne dans sa quête et découvrira que l’aventure est bien plus facile dans les livres.

Kalann est le fils adoptif d’un marchand des mers, reconverti en pilleur de tombe. Ayant grandi au milieu des marins et ayant fréquenté les tavernes depuis son plus jeune âge, il est fougueux, blagueur et séducteur.  


Qui est l'auteur ?

Alors qui je suis ? Hey bien je m'appelle Johann BLAIS (aka Papayou), jeune concept artist et directeur artistique, je travaille pour le jeux vidéo et le cinéma depuis 2010.

J'ai eu la chance de travailler sur des projets tels que Game of Thrones RPG de Cyanide Studio, ou encore des films tels que Thor, The Darkest Hour, ou encore le Marsupilami.  

Vous pouvez me suivre sur Facebook et Twitter pour plus d'informations. 

Mes motivations 

Je rêve depuis longtemps de me lancer dans la grande aventure que peut être la création d'une bande dessinée.

Et là vous vous demandez : pourquoi faire çà via une plateforme de crowdfunding ? Et bien parce qu'au delà d'une simple BD je souhaite pouvoir proposer un contenu vraiment complet sur ce que peut être Illyne et proposer quelque chose de différent de l'édition classique.

C'est pourquoi j'ai choisi cette méthode qui (je l'espère) si le financement atteint son objectif, me permettra de vous proposer le premier Tome d'Illyne ainsi qu'un artbook qui traitera de l'univers, des personnages, et des légendes du vaste monde qui accueille les aventures de notre protagoniste, accompagné de croquis de recherche, et différents concept art.

En plus de çà, je vous proposerai de petits bonus, tels que des lithographie au tirage limité qui je l'espère sauront trouver intéret à vos yeux.

Toutefois, pour pouvoir vous proposer un prix proche des tarifs pratiqués en librairie, je dois réunir une somme assez conséquente qui me permettra de lancer d'importants tirages des œuvres pour que les coûts de productions soient intéressants. 

Voila, vous savez à peu près tout de ce qui me motive dans cette nouvelle aventure qui ne verra le jour que si elle suscite votre intérêt à vous aussi. Intérêt que vous pouvez manifester (en plus de préacheter les livres =) en diffusant un maximum la page de ce projet. 

Ce n'est que grâce à vous que tout ça pourra voir le jour.


- Les packs de contreparties ! -


- Les dédicaces avec dessin commencent à partir de ce pack -
                                (hormis le pack à 100€)


- A quoi va me servir le financement -


Dans un souci de transparence envers vous, voilà un diagramme vous exposant la répartition du budget.


Et si je dépasse l'objectif ? 

Si jamais ce rêve se réalisait, voilà ce qui se débloquerait avec les nouveaux paliers !!



Merci d'avance pour votre intérêt !!!


Vous pouvez me suivre sur Facebook et Twitter 

pour plus d'informations.

story:
Hello and welcome to my first Indiegogo campaign!  If you've never heard of it, Alien Dice begins here and as of March 17th, has been online for 12 years!  I've been successful on other platforms with other projects, but this one's a little different.  This one is to fund my work on Alien Dice for the next six months, dedicating 20 hours a week to ONLY Alien Dice related work.  Right now, I tend to only work on the comic in rotation with several others, meaning that often by the end of the week I run out of time.  Succeeding with this funding run would improve my ability to work in general at the cost of a few of my pet projects for awhile.  I have a difficult time deciding on what to do or not to do, so I'm going to leave it up to my readers.   The comic will continue as usual, except for color, if it fails.  You will get larger updates though and the text will be current again with the sacrifice of color. If it fails, you will still have the opportunity to continue color updates simply by getting the monthly goal's current and keeping them there. 

If it fails, updates drop to one full color page a week.  I don't want to suddenly change formats like that.  When the tally is current, there will be more updates.

So how much am I asking?  I've been getting along on $300 a month on two comic worlds.  That's $20 a day, which goes to groceries, gas, medical bills, and work supplies.  For a family of 3, that's fine… except that for the past several months it's been $300 total.  Because I am frugal/coupon clipper/bargain finder, we get by, barely.  Just enough to keep heads up… that was until insurance turned horrible in an effort to keep current in all bills and now it's going to go up and my insulin is not cheap.  It's also not good when I need a completely DIFFERENT diet from my family.  Believe it or not, healthy food is not always healthy for diabetics and it is a bit more costly to make 'natural' lower carb items for myself over the cheap processed stuff.

NONE of this will go to ANYTHING fun (unless it's tagged that way).  We don't drink, smoke or waste money on anything like that.  Saves a lot of money to not be able to really drink alcohol, even though I do enjoy Honey Mead on rare occasion and Fruity Korean wines… which are all cheap. :D :D  I think once a year we indulge.

So, how much is my time worth?  Less than minimum wage apparently, when it comes to online comics.  $300 at 20 hours a week = 80 hours = $3.75.  Minimum wage is $7.25. I'm asking for $5.00 an hour.  So that'd be a little bit nicer  $400 a month.  This also takes care of the last couple of months of shortage.  Total amount: $2,400 for six months of putting Alien Dice FIRST for 20 hours a week, that is, Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday to noon, BEFORE I even THINK about another comic.  That means, comic work, site redesign, removing banner and box ads, fixing the FULL page archive for all the enjoy up to current, uploading the Radio Play episodes to a new area, SCRIPTING, laying out the 250 page graphic novels *shudder*, figuring out how to properly convert RGB to CMYK and it does NOT mean… trying to think of new things to do monthly and running monthly fund runs.  Taxes come directly out of that amount and don't need to be figured as extra.  (Note… I pay 2X Social Security tax, as do all people who work for themselves.)

I get one week of vacation and I can miss three updates in case of illness/child illness, etc.  If I miss more, the offer is pushed out that many updates beyond the initial six months.

 Now, let's go on to the things I'm offering to get to this goal!  But first, for INTERNATIONAL SUPPORTERS!  Your currency is worth more than ours, but more times than not, shipping is way too high, especially now.  To make up for that, you will be getting a complimentary inked art card of a character of your choice with your chosen items.  You only have to add the extra ONCE per your entire selection and everyone is free to add items together, but if you're adding them to a limited tier, select the limited tier!!  To be fair, you can add an inked (b&w) card to any tier for $6. 

Please note, you CAN do multiple tiers seperately!

Swiftpaw Exclusive Perk!  This story will be available online for supporters and you can choose any amount to be a supporter and EVERYONE will get to see it as it's done.  This is a short 15 page black and white story featuring Swiftpaw's conversion from a chicken stealing fox into the one we all know and love!

Taco Perk!- You don't want anything, but would like to let me enjoy something.  I am allowed to buy tacos.  (Tacos = actual tacos, groceries and maybe something fun like a movie for all of us once the goal is met.. But at LEAST one order of tacos shall be consumed.

CHARMS!  We have a new set of three charms featuring, Fluffy, Fluffy, and SIPHON, the vampire duck! - 100 charms cost me $165 + shipping  They are available for $6 each, which includes shipping in the US.

 

BUTTONS! I have new professional button machines and am putting them to use!  Designs will be up soon, but the three charm designs plus two others are available as 2.25" buttons, keychains and mirrors or 1.25" buttons, keychains, cellstraps, etc. On these, you can also request pre-existing art, but not a commission.

By the Piece add to other orders or pick up a bundle in the tiers.

  • 2.25" Pinback buttons - $2 each
  • 2.25" Keychain button - $3 each.  Image on one side.
  • 2.25" Mirror button - $5 each (come with an organza bag.)  Image is one side, mirror on the other.
  • 1.25" pinback button - $1 each.
  • 1.25" keychain/zipper pull/cellphone charm/necklace pendant - $2
  • 1.25" magnet - $2

CUSTOM Mirror Button Commissions!  Hand drawn or digital images done on 2.24" mirrors.  You can even choose images from the comic to be redrawn as button images.  These designs will be made available to others as well, but you'll get the original art with them.  - $15  You can request button commissions on all of the above mentioned item by adding $10 to the cost of the button for 2.25" ones and $5 for the 1.25" ones.  You can commission one and then have the image duplicated over other buttons and charms for the price of the button.  So you can do one commission and then get half a dozen buttons with the same design made from print.  Please let me know if it's ok to replicate your design myself for sale in other venues!

Sponsor a Character!  I am OFTEN asked to draw group pictures of all the dice, but rarely have reason to just draw dice when there is comic work to be done.  So for $10, you can sponsor a dice, pick the level and he/she will be drawn for the website , for uploading to a new dice section of the site, and printing in a Dice book.   Sides 1-3 will be drawn on my favorite copic paper and for $10 more, will be hand colored.  (Each will be roughly 4.5 x 5.5 in size.)  Sides 4-6 will be done on 5.5 x 8 paper and coloring will be $15 more.  Regardless, you will get the original art AND a print of the finished piece mailed to you for the base $10.  Slots will be limited to TWO only of each level and only the main six dice, Stealth, Zeta, Fly, Skate, Drift and Swiftpaw.  (This time.) (oh oops - Drift AND Swiftpaw have 8 levels!)

Taken so far:

Swiftpaw -

  • S4 (1)

Artist Card and Art Book!  Full color ACEOs (3.5 x 2.5 hand drawn, inked and colored with copics and watercolors featuring the character of your choice.)  There is a limit of 40 of these and I have not decided how they will be compiled into a book, but they will be shown actual size.  I'm thinking either a 12 page comic book or 24 page manga size book... or I may just print them out and bind them myself.  Card and book is $30, which includes shipping in the US.

Custom Dice!  Last, is the custom laser engraved six sided die.  The plan is for a swirly red and black die with gold engraving and the words: NOT FAIR! Replacing the 1 side and Stealth's head facing forward on the six side.  100 of these is $120.  Customized dice are not cheap. :D   But they are also going to be limited to ONLY how many are ordered +20. (the extra 20 will go up for future prizes.)  It's an Indiegogo exclusive.  Yes, I'm aware dice are cheap.  I'm also aware that each die costs $1.20 (It's 60 cents for each engraved side), so putting up a tier for one of them for $3, including shipping, doesn't leave me with much profit.  Of course, this is also what typically gets me in trouble, because I would LIKE my readers who do NOT have lots of extra money to be able to get something they really want.  This was why, for the longest time, I stopped running incentives.  The FIRST 10 dice will be $3.  I figured that'd make me feel good. :) Please don't snag one of these if you can go by the regular price of $5 for one die.

Patron! - You love to see me doing what I love to do and you love what I'm doing and you want to support it!  This level gets you a FULL 9 x 12 inked commission as well as a listing on the Patron page. :)

 

Cost of materials: Charms - $175. 40 ACEO books $2 a book = $80. 100 Dice - $120 = ($375.00)  I have plenty of supplies for all the rest of the projects.

 Total Funding needed:

 Salary: $2,400

Supplies: $375

Shipping costs: $1,500

Fees - 10%: $430

Safety Net to round it.  $295

2400 + 375 + 1500 + 430 = 4705 + 295 = 5000

 Stretch Goals!


$5,150 - Those who request a Stealth dice will get TWO dice instead of 1.  Number cap will be REMOVED!

 $ 5,300 - Zeta Die  - Orange and gold swirly dice like flames with gold or black engraving of Zeta's head on the six side. 

$ 6,000 - Comic Details Upgrade - I will go from cel shading to soft shading with more time spent on the art itself .  More time will be spent on it to begin with, but I will force myself to slow down and let myself enjoy it more.

$ 7,000 - Swiftpaw Exclusive will be in color.

 Patronage BEYOND the initial goal will all go into savings to keep on top of our medical bills, do away with debt related to her heart surgeries and then go into savings for a house down payment so that we can stop renting and get in a better tax bracket. :D 

I don't have any expectations on it, but I do hope this all goes well.

Edit 4/14:  Small note.  After my dental visit yesterday, I was informed I have lost 50-75% of my bone mass and ALL 32 of my barely bigger than baby teeth need to be removed.  Only thing holding them in is tarter below the gumline.  And no, my mouth does not look like the horrific ones they show in textbooks.  Yippee.  So many factors with genetics being #1.  Luckily, I have dental insurance, which is why I was at the dentist. :D  I've been quoted $1,800 - so some of this will be directed into my mouth.

 

  • Tiffany Ross
