I'm asking for $5.00 an hour.  So that'd be a little bit nicer  $400 a month.  This also takes care of the last couple of months of shortage.  Total amount: $2,400 for six months of putting Alien Dice FIRST for 20 hours a week, that is, Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday to noon, BEFORE I even THINK about another comic.  That means, comic work, site redesign, removing banner and box ads, fixing the FULL page archive for all the enjoy up to current, uploading the Radio Play episodes to a new area, SCRIPTING, laying out the 250 page graphic novels *shudder*, figuring out how to properly convert RGB to CMYK and it does NOT mean… trying to think of new things to do monthly and running monthly fund runs.  Taxes come directly out of that amount and don't need to be figured as extra.  (Note… I pay 2X Social Security tax, as do all people who work for themselves.)
I get one week of vacation and I can miss three updates in case of illness/child illness, etc.  If I miss more, the offer is pushed out that many updates beyond the initial six months.
 Now, let's go on to the things I'm offering to get to this goal!  But first, for INTERNATIONAL SUPPORTERS!  Your currency is worth more than ours, but more times than not, shipping is way too high, especially now.  To make up for that, you will be getting a complimentary inked art card of a character of your choice with your chosen items.  You only have to add the extra ONCE per your entire selection and everyone is free to add items together, but if you're adding them to a limited tier, select the limited tier!!  To be fair, you can add an inked (b&w) card to any tier for $6. 
Please note, you CAN do multiple tiers seperately!
Swiftpaw Exclusive Perk!  This story will be available online for supporters and you can choose any amount to be a supporter and EVERYONE will get to see it as it's done.  This is a short 15 page black and white story featuring Swiftpaw's conversion from a chicken stealing fox into the one we all know and love!
Taco Perk!- You don't want anything, but would like to let me enjoy something.  I am allowed to buy tacos.  (Tacos = actual tacos, groceries and maybe something fun like a movie for all of us once the goal is met.. But at LEAST one order of tacos shall be consumed.
CHARMS!  We have a new set of three charms featuring, Fluffy, Fluffy, and SIPHON, the vampire duck! - 100 charms cost me $165 + shipping  They are available for $6 each, which includes shipping in the US.
 
BUTTONS! I have new professional button machines and am putting them to use!  Designs will be up soon, but the three charm designs plus two others are available as 2.25" buttons, keychains and mirrors or 1.25" buttons, keychains, cellstraps, etc. On these, you can also request pre-existing art, but not a commission.
By the Piece add to other orders or pick up a bundle in the tiers.

2.25" Pinback buttons - $2 each
2.25" Keychain button - $3 each.  Image on one side.
2.25" Mirror button - $5 each (come with an organza bag.)  Image is one side, mirror on the other.
1.25" pinback button - $1 each.
1.25" keychain/zipper pull/cellphone charm/necklace pendant - $2
1.25" magnet - $2
CUSTOM Mirror Button Commissions!  Hand drawn or digital images done on 2.24" mirrors.  You can even choose images from the comic to be redrawn as button images.  These designs will be made available to others as well, but you'll get the original art with them.  - $15  You can request button commissions on all of the above mentioned item by adding $10 to the cost of the button for 2.25" ones and $5 for the 1.25" ones.  You can commission one and then have the image duplicated over other buttons and charms for the price of the button.  So you can do one commission and then get half a dozen buttons with the same design made from print.  Please let me know if it's ok to replicate your design myself for sale in other venues!
Sponsor a Character!  I am OFTEN asked to draw group pictures of all the dice, but rarely have reason to just draw dice when there is comic work to be done.  So for $10, you can sponsor a dice, pick the level and he/she will be drawn for the website , for uploading to a new dice section of the site, and printing in a Dice book.   Sides 1-3 will be drawn on my favorite copic paper and for $10 more, will be hand colored.  (Each will be roughly 4.5 x 5.5 in size.)  Sides 4-6 will be done on 5.5 x 8 paper and coloring will be $15 more.  Regardless, you will get the original art AND a print of the finished piece mailed to you for the base $10.  Slots will be limited to TWO only of each level and only the main six dice, Stealth, Zeta, Fly, Skate, Drift and Swiftpaw.  (This time.) (oh oops - Drift AND Swiftpaw have 8 levels!)
Taken so far:
Swiftpaw - 

S4 (1)
Artist Card and Art Book!  Full color ACEOs (3.5 x 2.5 hand drawn, inked and colored with copics and watercolors featuring the character of your choice.)  There is a limit of 40 of these and I have not decided how they will be compiled into a book, but they will be shown actual size.  I'm thinking either a 12 page comic book or 24 page manga size book... or I may just print them out and bind them myself.  Card and book is $30, which includes shipping in the US.
Custom Dice!  Last, is the custom laser engraved six sided die.  The plan is for a swirly red and black die with gold engraving and the words: NOT FAIR! Replacing the 1 side and Stealth's head facing forward on the six side.  100 of these is $120.  Customized dice are not cheap. :D   But they are also going to be limited to ONLY how many are ordered +20. (the extra 20 will go up for future prizes.)  It's an Indiegogo exclusive.  Yes, I'm aware dice are cheap.  I'm also aware that each die costs $1.20 (It's 60 cents for each engraved side), so putting up a tier for one of them for $3, including shipping, doesn't leave me with much profit.  Of course, this is also what typically gets me in trouble, because I would LIKE my readers who do NOT have lots of extra money to be able to get something they really want.  This was why, for the longest time, I stopped running incentives.  The FIRST 10 dice will be $3.  I figured that'd make me feel good. :) Please don't snag one of these if you can go by the regular price of $5 for one die.
Patron! - You love to see me doing what I love to do and you love what I'm doing and you want to support it!  This level gets you a FULL 9 x 12 inked commission as well as a listing on the Patron page. :)
 
Cost of materials: Charms - $175. 40 ACEO books $2 a book = $80. 100 Dice - $120 = ($375.00)  I have plenty of supplies for all the rest of the projects.
 Total Funding needed:
 Salary: $2,400
Supplies: $375
Shipping costs: $1,500
Fees - 10%: $430
Safety Net to round it.  $295
2400 + 375 + 1500 + 430 = 4705 + 295 = 5000
 Stretch Goals!
$5,150 - Those who request a Stealth dice will get TWO dice instead of 1.  Number cap will be REMOVED!
 $ 5,300 - Zeta Die  - Orange and gold swirly dice like flames with gold or black engraving of Zeta's head on the six side. 
$ 6,000 - Comic Details Upgrade - I will go from cel shading to soft shading with more time spent on the art itself .  More time will be spent on it to begin with, but I will force myself to slow down and let myself enjoy it more.
$ 7,000 - Swiftpaw Exclusive will be in color.
 Patronage BEYOND the initial goal will all go into savings to keep on top of our medical bills, do away with debt related to her heart surgeries and then go into savings for a house down payment so that we can stop renting and get in a better tax bracket. :D 
I don't have any expectations on it, but I do hope this all goes well.
Edit 4/14:  Small note.  After my dental visit yesterday, I was informed I have lost 50-75% of my bone mass and ALL 32 of my barely bigger than baby teeth need to be removed.  Only thing holding them in is tarter below the gumline.  And no, my mouth does not look like the horrific ones they show in textbooks.  Yippee.  So many factors with genetics being #1.  Luckily, I have dental insurance, which is why I was at the dentist. :D  I've been quoted $1,800 - so some of this will be directed into my mouth.
 

Tiffany Ross

story:
Robyn is ongoing comic series about a young, intelligent and skilful girl called Robyn, who just happens to be an outlaw, surviving on her own in Sherwood Forest!

That is, until she runs an errand for the dubious Tuck, which leads her into her greatest adventure yet; one that she cannot complete alone.

 

Robyn is quick and confident, but perhaps a little too confident. As she completes the errand for Tuck, she overhears tales of a monster in Blarry Crags, and decides it's something she should investigate.

What she finds, however, is nothing she could be prepared for!

 

Yep, we launched Robyn 1 last year, and now we're back with Robyn 2, where she encounters some new friends, and we learn the secret of the Steampunk Knight!

You'll see some of the lower tiers are for Robyn #2 only, these are primarily aimed at backers of our first Robyn Kickstarter, who already have issue #1.

However, you can catch both issues, either digitally at £2 & £5 perks, or physically starting at the £13 perks.

 

Each issue is 28 pages of full colour, action-adventure for all ages!

In fact, the Robyn 1 crowdfunding went so well we added an extra 4 pages, so issue 1 is 32 pages long!

 

No, you're going to love it!

In fact, anyone who loves good stories, great art, action, adventure, fun, strong female leads, Robin Hood mythos, etc, will love this book!

And this is just the first 2 issues! The first arc (4 issues) is completely written, with issues 5 to 8 in the planning stage!

 

Well, in issue 1 we meet Robyn and Tuck, and a character named Will, though not the one you might be thinking of!

Issue 2 takes us even further into the realm of Robyn Hood, and even brings in characters from other legends in an amazing mash-up!

 

If you love exclusive rewards (and we know you do!) then you'll be excited to hear about the Blue Fox Comics Frequent Backer Reward programme.

Every Blue Fox Comics crowdfunding campaign you back helps you achieve new EXCLUSIVE FREE frequent backers rewards!

You'll receive your eligible postcards in the next physical reward we send you! These postcards are not available anywhere else!

 

We're running this campaign to help raise the funds for the printing of Robyn. As a small indie press, we need help from backers like you to print our comics, allowing us to continue to make more fantastic independent comics!

Using crowdfunding, we're able to reward our backers by offering exclusive rewards, as well as the guarantee you'll be receiving the books first!

Both Robyn 1 & 2 are 100% complete and, bar the backers' names being put into the back of issue 2, ready to go to print.

Indiegogo is a fantastic site, which helps us reach as many people as possible, and we're always delighted to hear the great feedback we receive from our fans.

 

We hope you like the look of Robyn. To help you further make up your mind, you can read the first 8 pages of issue 1 by clicking on the button below.

 

Robyn is written by Blue Fox Comics co-founder and award-winning writer Simon Birks.

His other comics include Gone, Hexes, Sinners, The Girl in the Midnight Gown and The Herebey Dragons, which have all successfully raised funds for printing using crowdfunding platforms.

 

Ege has been drawing since he was just a little lad, especially endless countryside views with lampposts following them.

He decided to convey his ideas trough comic books when he was a high school junior. Then, he found himself as a comic artist.

Nowadays, he is drawing 'The Boy Who Came Closer' and 'Robyn' for Blue Fox Comics. In what is left from his time, he is working on his personal graphic novel.

 

Lyndon is a UK freelance illustrator, writer and comic artist. Working with publishers such as Blue Fox Comics, Hellbound Media, Disconnected Press, ComicHaus, Capstone Press, Lyndon is a rising star in the comics industry.

Working on a range of titles with his own unique flair to horror, surrealism and narrative storytelling.

 

Blue Fox Comics are a UK based independent small press publisher. Since forming in 2015, we have published many titles, within many different genres.

We have over 20 crowdfunding campaigns under our belt, and know how to deliver an exceptional product that our readers will love.

For more of our publications, see the Add-Ons section below.

 

We really appreciate everything our backers do for us and want to make sure that they feel supported.

To help achieve this, Blue Fox Comics offer a money back guarantee - if you are unhappy with your perks, and return them, undamaged, within one month of receiving them we will return your pledge amount to you.

 

Thank you so much for taking the time to look at our campaign. If you've got this far, then we hope you've found it interesting.

I loved creating Robyn, and I hope it both intrigues and surprises you!

story:
Ultimate Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles or UTMNT for short, (found over at http://www.utmnt.com) is a fan-based webcomic written by Nick Arganbright and drawn by Eryck Webb. 

The reality of the situation is that doing UTMNT on the current model (everything is almost entirely out of pocket) is not economically feasible any longer and I need your help to keep UTMNT going.

By supporting this campaign and seeing it funded, you are helping UTMNT continue for the next issue! It will also lock in Eryck in to UTMNT for one full issue as Eryck has gotten extremely busy due to his hard work and talent and is very-much in-demand!

We believe we have some decent perks too for those who can contribute. The challenge is (as you will read below) is that the art is the book and always comes first. Without that, we can't do any other rewards or perks.


By helping this project become funded, you help secure Eryck Webb as the talent and time for this amazing project.

Besides creating an awesome fan-based webcomic of our favorite bipedal ninja-based terrapins, we have what we hope are some pretty neato-cheato perks !


If we surpass the amount for Issue # 2 of UTMNT, below are some Stretch Goals if we exceed our originally requested amount!


We pay Eryck for a second issue of UTMNT! Taking place between UTMNT Issue # 1 and UTMNT Issue # 2, find out what happens to Raphael! With a cover drawn and colored by Courtland Brugger!


Not only do we have Raphael Micro-Series # 1 of 1 art-wise done, we ALSO will print out physical copies for all those with perks receiving a physical comic book copy! Huzzah!

Radical! We are getting Eryck to draw Issue # 3 of UTMNT! This covers additionally his commission for Issue # 3!

This is it, UTMNT # 3, printed off from the printers and included with Issues # 1, Issue # 2, and the Raphael Micro-Series! That's FOUR issues in your grubby UTMNT-comic-loving hands! Booyakasha indeed!




Both the risks and challenges are basic ones but important ones. 

The first risk and challenge is the fact that the art for the book as the art is what MAKES the comic the comic is most important.  Without the art, we have no book. Without the book, we have no other rewards. So sadly a challenge has been trying to work out how to give great rewards like shirts, prints, physical copies of the book, etc.

Another challenge/risk is that I've never done a project like this re: shipping and handling of items. So I am expecting a hiccup or two there but trying to research thoroughly trying to be best prepared for what is to come, but some things may come up I was not aware of.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Times are tough. I get it. And sometimes, people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

    • Get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
    • It helps to use the SHARE tools right here on IndieGoGo!

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
BONJOUR A TOUS ! / HELLO EVERYONE !

Bienvenue à vous, lecteurs assidus, fans de la première heure, ou tout simplement nouveaux venus ! 

Tout d’abord, qu’est-ce que « Wuffle : le grand gentil loup » pour ceux au fond qui ne connaîtraient pas? Au début, c’était un regroupement de petites BD qui, au fur et à mesure, racontaient les aventures de personnages hauts en couleur dont Wuffle, ce loup d’une gentillesse et d’une force incomparables. Avec l’élaboration toujours plus foisonnante de ces petites histoires, l’auteur décida d’en créer un livre, puis un autre, et maintenant nous y voici : la version francophone* en édition spéciale !

*Le livre sera édité en français mais la campagne reste internationale : tout le monde peut participer et recevoir les récompenses à travers le monde.

____

Welcome all of you, diligent readers, fans since the beginning or more simply newcomers !

To begin, what is « Wuffle : The Big Nice Wolf » for those in the back that may not know ? At first, it was a collection of small strips that, bit by bit, told the adventures of colourful characters, including Wuffle, a kind hearted and strong wolf. With those small stories getting more and more plentiful, the author decided to make a book out of them, then a second, and now here we are : the french* version in a special edition !

*The book will be published in french but the campaign is still international : everybody can help and be rewarded all over the world.


A PROPOS DE CETTE EDITION SPECIALE / ABOUT THIS SPECIAL EDITION

Ce livre comprend tous les strips des années 1 et 2 de Wuffle, c'est-à-dire, les strips parus du 14 Février 2012, jusqu'au 28 Février 2014, traduits en français.

Il comprend également deux illustrations exclusives par Piti Yindee, faites spécialement pour cette édition française avec une couverture inédite.

Le livre sera imprimé au format A5 (14,8cmx10cm) et comprendra 280 pages.

____

This book contains all the strips from Wuffle year 1 and 2, it means the strips published between February the 14th 2012 and February the 28th 2014, translated in French.

It also includes two exclusive pictures by Piti Yindee lui-même, especially made for this french edition with a brand new cover.

The book will be printed in A5 format (5.8inx3.9in) and will have 280 pages.


QUI SOMMES-NOUS ? / WHO ARE WE ?

Nous sommes les éditions Clover, boîte d’édition française. Lorsque nous avons découvert Wuffle, nous avons été très enthousiastes et avons proposé un contrat à Piti Yindee afin d’éditer ses livres en France.

La traduction en français est donc assurée par nos soins, avec l’aide de relecteurs indépendants. Le but étant de rester le plus fidèle possible à l’œuvre originale, certains noms resteront donc en anglais et certaines blagues seront adaptées à la langue française pour ne pas perdre une miette du spectacle.

____

We are the Editions Clover, a french publishing house. When we discovered Wuffle, we were really enthusiastic and offered Piti Yindee a contract in order to publish his books in France.

The french translation is made by us, with help from independent proofreaders. Our goal is to remain as close as possible to the original book, and so, some names will stay in English and some jokes will be adapted to french language to not miss any bit of the show.


OBJECTIF PREMIER / MAIN GOAL

                

*Couverture provisoire/temporary cover*

Afin de pouvoir éditer Wuffle en français, le but à atteindre est de 6 000€. Par le biais des différents paliers de financement, vous pourrez nous aider à atteindre cet objectif tout en récupérant la récompense qui y est associée. Selon la mise, vous pourrez avoir votre nom dans les remerciements, un livre dédicacé ou même un tableau unique !

Notez également que si la campagne est un succès, nous reverserons 10% des gains à Piti Yindee en tant que droits d’auteur !

Cette campagne sera en financement fixe, ce qui veut également dire que si nous n'atteignons pas cet objectif, vous récupérerez ce que vous avez donné.

____

In order to publish Wuffle in French, our goal is to reach 6 000€. With the use of different financing tiers, you can help us reach it while earning the associated reward. Depending on what you pay, you could have your name in the thank you list, a signed book or even a unique canvas !

Please note that if the campaign is a success, we will give 10% of the gains to Piti Yindee as author rights !

This campaign will be in fixed financing, which also means that, if we do not reach our goal, you will get back everything you’ve given.

RECOMPENSES/REWARDS

OBJECTIFS SUPPLEMENTAIRES / STRETCH GOALS

Si la campagne est un succès et dépasse nos espérances, nous avons prévus des paliers supplémentaires. Nous pourrons alors éditer la traduction de la nouvelle « There's something about Foxxo », un artbook inédit contenant les bonus des deux premières années qui ne figurent pas dans le livre principal (croquis, histoires non publiées...) et proposer beaucoup d’autres surprises !

____

If the campaign is a success and we get more than we hoped for, we have planned some additionnal tiers. We will then be able to publish the short story's translation « There’s something about Foxxo », an original artbook containing all the bonuses from year 1 and 2 (sketches, unpublished stories...) which are not in the main book and much more !


PASSEZ LE MOT ! / SPREAD THE WORD !

Même si vous ne pouvez pas investir dans cette campagne, vous pouvez toujours nous aider ! Parlez de Wuffle autour de vous, auprès de votre famille, vos amis, vos collègues de travail, de parfaits étrangers dans la rue, ou des extraterrestres en visite ! Piti Yindee souhaite que ses personnages soient connus de tous, alors n'hésitez pas !

____

Even if you can’t invest in this campaign, you can help ! Talk about Wuffle around you, to your family, your friends, coworkers, strangers in the street or passing by extraterrestrials ! Piti Yindee wish for his characters to be known all over the world, so do not hesitate !
story_txt: BONJOUR A TOUS ! / HELLO EVERYONE !Bienvenue à vous, lecteurs assidus, fans de la première heure, ou tout simplement nouveaux venus ! Tout d’abord, qu’est-ce que « Wuffle : le grand gentil loup » pour ceux au fond qui ne connaîtraient pas? Au début, c’était un regroupement de petites BD qui, au fur et à mesure, racontaient les aventures de personnages hauts en couleur dont Wuffle, ce loup d’une gentillesse et d’une force incomparables. Avec l’élaboration toujours plus foisonnante de ces petites histoires, l’auteur décida d’en créer un livre, puis un autre, et maintenant nous y voici : la version francophone* en édition spéciale !*Le livre sera édité en français mais la campagne reste internationale : tout le monde peut participer et recevoir les récompenses à travers le monde.____Welcome all of you, diligent readers, fans since the beginning or more simply newcomers !To begin, what is « Wuffle : The Big Nice Wolf » for those in the back that may not know ? At first, it was a collection of small strips that, bit by bit, told the adventures of colourful characters, including Wuffle, a kind hearted and strong wolf. With those small stories getting more and more plentiful, the author decided to make a book out of them, then a second, and now here we are : the french* version in a special edition !*The book will be published in french but the campaign is still international : everybody can help and be rewarded all over the world.A PROPOS DE CETTE EDITION SPECIALE / ABOUT THIS SPECIAL EDITIONCe livre comprend tous les strips des années 1 et 2 de Wuffle, c'est-à-dire, les strips parus du 14 Février 2012, jusqu'au 28 Février 2014, traduits en français.Il comprend également deux illustrations exclusives par Piti Yindee, faites spécialement pour cette édition française avec une couverture inédite.Le livre sera imprimé au format A5 (14,8cmx10cm) et comprendra 280 pages.____This book contains all the strips from Wuffle year 1 and 2, it means the strips published between February the 14th 2012 and February the 28th 2014, translated in French.It also includes two exclusive pictures by Piti Yindee lui-même, especially made for this french edition with a brand new cover.The book will be printed in A5 format (5.8inx3.9in) and will have 280 pages.QUI SOMMES-NOUS ? / WHO ARE WE ?Nous sommes les éditions Clover, boîte d’édition française. Lorsque nous avons découvert Wuffle, nous avons été très enthousiastes et avons proposé un contrat à Piti Yindee afin d’éditer ses livres en France.La traduction en français est donc assurée par nos soins, avec l’aide de relecteurs indépendants. Le but étant de rester le plus fidèle possible à l’œuvre originale, certains noms resteront donc en anglais et certaines blagues seront adaptées à la langue française pour ne pas perdre une miette du spectacle.____We are the Editions Clover, a french publishing house. When we discovered Wuffle, we were really enthusiastic and offered Piti Yindee a contract in order to publish his books in France.The french translation is made by us, with help from independent proofreaders. Our goal is to remain as close as possible to the original book, and so, some names will stay in English and some jokes will be adapted to french language to not miss any bit of the show.OBJECTIF PREMIER / MAIN GOAL                *Couverture provisoire/temporary cover*Afin de pouvoir éditer Wuffle en français, le but à atteindre est de 6 000€. Par le biais des différents paliers de financement, vous pourrez nous aider à atteindre cet objectif tout en récupérant la récompense qui y est associée. Selon la mise, vous pourrez avoir votre nom dans les remerciements, un livre dédicacé ou même un tableau unique !Notez également que si la campagne est un succès, nous reverserons 10% des gains à Piti Yindee en tant que droits d’auteur !Cette campagne sera en financement fixe, ce qui veut également dire que si nous n'atteignons pas cet objectif, vous récupérerez ce que vous avez donné.____In order to publish Wuffle in French, our goal is to reach 6 000€. With the use of different financing tiers, you can help us reach it while earning the associated reward. Depending on what you pay, you could have your name in the thank you list, a signed book or even a unique canvas !Please note that if the campaign is a success, we will give 10% of the gains to Piti Yindee as author rights !This campaign will be in fixed financing, which also means that, if we do not reach our goal, you will get back everything you’ve given.RECOMPENSES/REWARDSOBJECTIFS SUPPLEMENTAIRES / STRETCH GOALSSi la campagne est un succès et dépasse nos espérances, nous avons prévus des paliers supplémentaires. Nous pourrons alors éditer la traduction de la nouvelle « There's something about Foxxo », un artbook inédit contenant les bonus des deux premières années qui ne figurent pas dans le livre principal (croquis, histoires non publiées...) et proposer beaucoup d’autres surprises !____If the campaign is a success and we get more than we hoped for, we have planned some additionnal tiers. We will then be able to publish the short story's translation « There’s something about Foxxo », an original artbook containing all the bonuses from year 1 and 2 (sketches, unpublished stories...) which are not in the main book and much more !PASSEZ LE MOT ! / SPREAD THE WORD !Même si vous ne pouvez pas investir dans cette campagne, vous pouvez toujours nous aider ! Parlez de Wuffle autour de vous, auprès de votre famille, vos amis, vos collègues de travail, de parfaits étrangers dans la rue, ou des extraterrestres en visite ! Piti Yindee souhaite que ses personnages soient connus de tous, alors n'hésitez pas !____Even if you can’t invest in this campaign, you can help ! Talk about Wuffle around you, to your family, your friends, coworkers, strangers in the street or passing by extraterrestrials ! Piti Yindee wish for his characters to be known all over the world, so do not hesitate !

story:
WHAT IS THIS?

This is a 28 page full colour comic book with stunning artwork and a great, original story inspired by Star Wars and superhero mythology; the second of 5 issues making up graphic novel “Return of the French Guy”.

Unlikely Jedi answers the question every Star Wars fan asks: "what would you do if the Force was real?"

WHAT’S IT ABOUT?

The first chapter in the story of the Unlikely Jedi comic is called "Return of the French Guy", which tells the story of three friends in the real world who just happen to be Jedi! The narrative jumps back and forth between the life-changing events surrounding their Force-powered ‘awakening’ and the present day, where they are forced to confront the mistakes of the past and struggle through conflict and hilarity to find their place in a world that will never understand them.

WHERE CAN I READ ISSUE 1?

Issue 1 is available over on our website UNLIKELYJEDI.COM. Once we finished issue 1 we started releasing it page by page twice a week while we waited for the printers to get it into the hands of our backers. Head on over there to catch up on the story!

HISTORY

"Return of the French Guy" started out as a feature-length sequel to "The Unwritten Rule Trilogy", a series of Star Wars fan films we made back in 2003 and 2004. It started out as just a single film - "Shotgun" - but we enjoyed making it so much and it was so well received by our friends and the fan film community that we were compelled to make more. By the time we completed "Ex", the third part in the trilogy, we already had ideas for a two-hour epic that would explore the questions we'd always avoided - who were these guys? How can they use the Force? Where did they get lightsabers? What the hell is going on?! "Return of the French Guy" was meant to answer those questions.

Unfortunately, we were in our final years of university and our coursework had to take priority. Once we graduated, life just sort of swept us away from one another, and despite a deep desire to tell this story, we missed our window. So for the past few years we've been trying to figure out an alternative way of telling this story that doesn't require taking a few months off work to shoot a film. A couple of years ago we realised that it would make an amazing episodic story, and a graphic novel/comic was the perfect fit.

We began rewriting the script to fit a 4-6 panel format designed to be released in biweekly instalments, but we still had one fundamental problem: we can’t draw! So we started searching for artists who would design the characters and create a library of assets that we could use to piece each page together ourselves. Some very kind and talented artists donated their time and efforts to this endeavour, but it was impossible to get them as invested in the project as we wanted them to be. So despite the best of intentions, that idea ultimately failed.

And then crowd funding happened.

BOOM! It was everywhere! And suddenly this story that we'd been trying to tell for years and had all but given up on, suddenly and unexpectedly had one last hope.

Recruiting an amazing artist in Abel Garcia, we took to Indiegogo to fund the first issue, offering some amazing rewards to our backers. The campaign was a massive success, giving us the funds we needed to fully complete issue 1 and start releasing it for free on our website!

SO WHAT NOW?

Now we want to make issue 2, and we need your help to do it!

HOW CAN I HELP?

THANK YOU for asking that question! Without people like you, Unlikely Jedi simply wouldn't exist. There are two ways you can support Unlikely Jedi:

Make a pledge, choosing from one of the options on the right, for which you'll receive an awesome reward.

Tell people about us! Like us on Facebook, Follow Us on Twitter, +1 us on Google+ and share and retweet our status updates. We need pledges to make this project happen, and for that we need to spread the word, so any way you can help do that, please do!

The bottom line is that we can't continue to make this comic without financial support. So if you get a kick out of Unlikely Jedi and want to see more, please make a pledge!

REWARDS

Here's a closer look at some of the rewards we're offering:

Every pledge gets you these beautiful desktop wallpapers!

 
 
 
 

Several of our reward tiers offer fantastic, limited edition Unlikely Jedi t-shirts!

They come in a range of colours, so please let us know what design and colour you'd like! Here's a closer look at the designs:

DESIGN 1

DESIGN 2

DESIGN 3

DESIGN 4

DESIGN 5

DESIGN 6 LIGHT

DESIGN 6 DARK

DESIGN 7 LIGHT

DESIGN 7 DARK

Don't forget, for £80 or more you can get your own colour portrait on a t-shirt, as well as a bunch of other goodies!

Bonus reward for all backers - help decide how the pitch video ends!

Every backer has the right to submit an idea for the ending of the pitch video! If we hit our target we'll ask the community to vote on the best ideas, and if we finish it using your idea, you'll get written into the story as a background or supporting character, a prize normally reserved for backers of £80!

STRETCH GOALS

No Indiegogo project is complete without Stretch Goals! So here they are:

£2000: We get to make issues 2 and 3!

£3000: We get to make issues 2, 3 and 4!

£4000: We get to make the entire graphic novel! Plus, we'll give it away to every single backer!

£5000: Not only will we get to make the entire graphic novel, but we'll also adapt The Unwritten Rule Trilogy into comic form, and give it away to every single backer as a second graphic novel, including the never before seen (or even talked about) 4th part of the 'trilogy', "ROUND", which was subtley referenced in issue 1!

£5001+: Any more than that and we'll be able to start working on the continuing adventures of the Unlikely Jedi, following on from the events of Return of the French Guy!

WHO IS MAKING IT?

Ryan Brain - Co-Creator, Manager, Writer & Colourist

Abel Garcia – Artist

Jonathan Carey - Co-Creator, Web Manager & Creative Consultant

LEGAL DISCLAIMER

“Unlikely Jedi” does not take place in the Star Wars universe, nor does it contain any characters created by LucasFilm Ltd. Beyond the use of the word Jedi and similar references to Star Wars, “Return of the French Guy” is an original story, a homage to a cultural phenomenon. At worst, it could be considered fan fiction, which LucasFilm Ltd. has historically been supportive of.

Any and all funding we receive through Indiegogo will be used to produce the Unlikely Jedi comic/graphic novel and related promotional material.

Unlikely Jedi is not made, distributed, or supported by LucasFilm Ltd. and/or its licensors.

Jedi is a Trademark of LucasFilm Ltd. Star Wars, the Star Wars logo, all names and pictures of Star Wars characters, vehicles and any other Star Wars related items are registered trademarks and/or copyrights of Lucasfilm Ltd., or their respective trademark and copyright holders.

story:
Who are you? What is this?!

My name is Stephen Gillan, and I make a comic called Antics! Antics is a twice-weekly comedy strip about two guys called Fletcher (green tie) and Copernicus (red tie), and their hilarious adventures and general life experiences. You can read Antics online for free, at www.anticscomic.com

I live in New Zealand, but most of my readership is half a planet away! The aim of this campaign is to raise enough money to order a bulk shipment of both Antics print collections ("Cause for Concern", and the ALL-NEW "Hot Lava Mud Bath"), so that I am able to offer Artist Edition (signed and sketched in) books for sale worldwide at an affordable price!

I love making this strip, and it is my dream to one day make comics my full-time profession. By supporting this project, you will be helping me take the next step toward making this a career.  It will also help me branch out into providing a better variety of products for my readers. Plus you'll get some great perks for donating (let's not forget that part)!

What exactly am I contributing to?

I've been selling the first volume of Antics strips for a little over a year now, and lots of people have asked about buying Artist Edition copies. This is a little difficult however, as I live in New Zealand, and most of my audience lives in the US (or other distant lands)! I would need to purchase thousands of copies up front in order to make shipping worldwide affordable for regular copies of these books, and I just don't have that much money. As it stands right now, every copy bought is printed and shipped from within the US, so I never even get the CHANCE to sign/sketch in them.

But now I'm looking to change that! I am still a while away from being able to afford thousands of books to sell regular copies of. But with your help I'm hoping to raise enough money to buy several hundred, and have them delivered right to my doorstep. From there, I'll be able to sell Artist Edition copies of both books direct from the Antics website (including worldwide shipping) at a reasonable price!

 

Tell me about these "perk" things, already!

Alright, fine! No need to yell. There are a whole bunch of physical/intangible items available in this campaign. Here are some slightly more detailed descriptions of the rewards currently up for grabs:

  • Antics wallpapers - These three wallpapers will be available exclusively as part of this campaign! Each one is a stirring pictorial tribute to Fletcher, Copernicus and (*shudder*) Jeff.

 

  • Antics digital sampler - A campaign-exclusive, 20 page PDF featuring my personal top ten Antics strips! Each one is accompanied by my handwritten thoughts on the strip, and assorted strip-related doodles!

 

  • "Cause for Concern" PDF - The PDF versions of Antics volume 1 is web resolution only, but contains the same bonus content as the physical book. That means you get a fancy collection of comics, plus a bunch of extra illustrations and sketches! SCORE!

 

  • "Cause for Concern" (Antics volume 1): Artist Edition - A full color, 104 page collection of Antics comic strips! Featuring sky whales, submarine crashes, zombies and much more. Contains book-exclusive illustrations and sketches! Signed and sketched inside the front cover, by yours truly!

 

  • "Hot Lava Mud Bath" (Antics volume 2): Artist Edition- A full color, 124 page collection of Antics comics strips! Featuring magical hippos, insane people in biplanes, and hideous snake beasts from another dimension. Contains book-exclusive illustrations, sketches and minicomics! Signed and sketched inside the front cover, by yours truly!

 

  • Page o' sketches - An A4 page, chock-full of random sketches and doodlings! Sketches will be done in pen, so there's no risk of them smudging away to nothing during transit! Your sketch page will be shipped along with your books.

 

  • Original minicomic art - The original artwork from a previously published collection of 4 Antics minicomics! WARNING: these things aren't perfect; they may contain "original" mistakes as well! Slightly under A4 size. You will receive a random set of 4 three-panel minicomics, which will be shipped along with your books!

 

  • Custom minicomics - A page of 4 three-panel minicomics, each based on a word of your choosing! Just include 4 random words in the "comment" section when you claim this perk. Or if you can't be bothered, simply leave it blank, and I'll pick the words for you! I will send you the original art (slightly under A4 size) along with your books, and email you high and low-resolution versions of the comics. You can see some previous minicomic examples here, here and here.

 

  • Custom comic strip - A page-long, full color comic strip, based on a phrase of your choosing! Examples include "hippo on a skateboard" or "robot space patrol". Just include your desired phrase in the "comment" section when you claim this perk. Or if you can't be bothered, leave it blank and I'll choose a phrase for you! You will recieve a small printed copy along with your books, as well as both high and low-resolution digital copies sent to your email address. You can see some previous custom comic examples on this page.

 

  • Hand-drawn Antics REMIXXX - Just pick your favorite published Antics strip, and I'll send you your own redrawn, personalised A4-sized copy! I will pencil, ink and color it by hand, then it will be signed and shipped to you along with your books! Simply include the name + number of the strip you would like in the "comment" section when you claim this perk.

 

  • The Big Kahuna - Includes all items from the Digital Deluxe perk, Artist Edition copy of both Antics volumes, a page of sketches, a page of custom minicomics, a page of original minicomic art, a custom comic strip, AND a hand-drawn Antics strip of your choosing! All digital files will be emailed to you, AND sent along with your items on a fancy USB drive, along with a video message of thanks from me! Please refer to other perk listings for the details of individual perks. Don't worry about including request details in the "comment" section when claiming this perk; I'll contact you to get the necessary information for your enormous pile of customized items!

 

  • ALSO - If things go REALLY well, I have some stretch goals in mind for this campaign. But let's not count our chickens before they hatch!

 

Can I buy REGULAR copies of the books?

You sure can! I haven't included plain copies of either book in the reward tiers, because I won't be shipping them myself! The price to ship to me, and THEN overseas is a little too restrictive. Regular copies are (and will continue to be) shipped directly from IndyPlanet. "Cause for Concern" (volume 1) can be bought here, and "Hot Lava Mud Bath" (volume 2) will be available at a later date. However, it will be AFTER all of the Artist Edition copies from this campaign have shipped, to be nice to everyone who has preordered.

 

What about me? I have no money!

I'm sorry to hear that, but you can definitely still help! Indiegogo has a bunch of built-in tools (located at the top of this wall of text) for sharing this campaign with your friends and family! Or if you don't like using buttons, you can just spread this link around: www.indiegogo.com/antics

Whether you are an avid reader of Antics, or you just want to see an independent cartoonist succeed, it will mean the world to me if you can help me promote this campaign!

 

What difference will my support make?

I hope that with the continued support of fans, I can turn this comic into something that brings thousands of people around the world the moments of excitement and happiness that make comics great!

I've been making Antics for almost 4 years now, and I feel like I'm only improving over time. If I can eventually make enough money to produce comics full-time, I can dedicate myself to getting better and better, and producing even more comics (and other content) for my readers to enjoy.

With your help, I can take another step along the road toward making Antics a career, and toward making every Antics strip the best little cartoon it can be!

Tell me about these "perk" things, already!
Alright, fine! No need to yell. There are a whole bunch of physical/intangible items available in this campaign. Here are some slightly more detailed descriptions of the rewards currently up for grabs:


Antics wallpapers - These three wallpapers will be available exclusively as part of this campaign! Each one is a stirring pictorial tribute to Fletcher, Copernicus and (*shudder*) Jeff.

 


Antics digital sampler - A campaign-exclusive, 20 page PDF featuring my personal top ten Antics strips! Each one is accompanied by my handwritten thoughts on the strip, and assorted strip-related doodles!

 


"Cause for Concern" PDF - The PDF versions of Antics volume 1 is web resolution only, but contains the same bonus content as the physical book. That means you get a fancy collection of comics, plus a bunch of extra illustrations and sketches! SCORE!

 


"Cause for Concern" (Antics volume 1): Artist Edition - A full color, 104 page collection of Antics comic strips! Featuring sky whales, submarine crashes, zombies and much more. Contains book-exclusive illustrations and sketches! Signed and sketched inside the front cover, by yours truly!

 


"Hot Lava Mud Bath" (Antics volume 2): Artist Edition- A full color, 124 page collection of Antics comics strips! Featuring magical hippos, insane people in biplanes, and hideous snake beasts from another dimension. Contains book-exclusive illustrations, sketches and minicomics! Signed and sketched inside the front cover, by yours truly!

 


Page o' sketches - An A4 page, chock-full of random sketches and doodlings! Sketches will be done in pen, so there's no risk of them smudging away to nothing during transit! Your sketch page will be shipped along with your books.

 


Original minicomic art - The original artwork from a previously published collection of 4 Antics minicomics! WARNING: these things aren't perfect; they may contain "original" mistakes as well! Slightly under A4 size. You will receive a random set of 4 three-panel minicomics, which will be shipped along with your books!

 


Custom minicomics - A page of 4 three-panel minicomics, each based on a word of your choosing! Just include 4 random words in the "comment" section when you claim this perk. Or if you can't be bothered, simply leave it blank, and I'll pick the words for you! I will send you the original art (slightly under A4 size) along with your books, and email you high and low-resolution versions of the comics. You can see some previous minicomic examples here, here and here.

 


Custom comic strip - A page-long, full color comic strip, based on a phrase of your choosing! Examples include "hippo on a skateboard" or "robot space patrol". Just include your desired phrase in the "comment" section when you claim this perk. Or if you can't be bothered, leave it blank and I'll choose a phrase for you! You will recieve a small printed copy along with your books, as well as both high and low-resolution digital copies sent to your email address. You can see some previous custom comic examples on this page.

 


Hand-drawn Antics REMIXXX - Just pick your favorite published Antics strip, and I'll send you your own redrawn, personalised A4-sized copy! I will pencil, ink and color it by hand, then it will be signed and shipped to you along with your books! Simply include the name + number of the strip you would like in the "comment" section when you claim this perk.

 


The Big Kahuna - Includes all items from the Digital Deluxe perk, Artist Edition copy of both Antics volumes, a page of sketches, a page of custom minicomics, a page of original minicomic art, a custom comic strip, AND a hand-drawn Antics strip of your choosing! All digital files will be emailed to you, AND sent along with your items on a fancy USB drive, along with a video message of thanks from me! Please refer to other perk listings for the details of individual perks. Don't worry about including request details in the "comment" section when claiming this perk; I'll contact you to get the necessary information for your enormous pile of customized items!

 


ALSO - If things go REALLY well, I have some stretch goals in mind for this campaign. But let's not count our chickens before they hatch!

 
Can I buy REGULAR copies of the books?
You sure can! I haven't included plain copies of either book in the reward tiers, because I won't be shipping them myself! The price to ship to me, and THEN overseas is a little too restrictive. Regular copies are (and will continue to be) shipped directly from IndyPlanet. "Cause for Concern" (volume 1) can be bought here, and "Hot Lava Mud Bath" (volume 2) will be available at a later date. However, it will be AFTER all of the Artist Edition copies from this campaign have shipped, to be nice to everyone who has preordered.
 
What about me? I have no money!
I'm sorry to hear that, but you can definitely still help! Indiegogo has a bunch of built-in tools (located at the top of this wall of text) for sharing this campaign with your friends and family! Or if you don't like using buttons, you can just spread this link around: www.indiegogo.com/antics
Whether you are an avid reader of Antics, or you just want to see an independent cartoonist succeed, it will mean the world to me if you can help me promote this campaign!
 
What difference will my support make?
I hope that with the continued support of fans, I can turn this comic into something that brings thousands of people around the world the moments of excitement and happiness that make comics great!
I've been making Antics for almost 4 years now, and I feel like I'm only improving over time. If I can eventually make enough money to produce comics full-time, I can dedicate myself to getting better and better, and producing even more comics (and other content) for my readers to enjoy.
With your help, I can take another step along the road toward making Antics a career, and toward making every Antics strip the best little cartoon it can be!

story:
ABOUT THE BOOK

The Dissident is an international political thriller set in the near future. A young American dissident escapes to Amsterdam only to discover there is nowhere you can run from injustice!

Follow the adventures of Hans Nobel, an American exile who escapes to Amsterdam after America's democracy collapses. Hans soon discovers that you can't run from tyranny when he uncovers a corrupt Dutch leader's conspiracy involving eco-assassins, kidnapping, human experiments, and a plot to kill anyone who resists the despot's plan to take over Europe. With the help of an underground resistance network Hans resurrects a legendary outlawed newspaper to expose the truth and spark a revolution.

"This is the kind of literary reportage that belongs in the maturing of the comics medium." - Will Eisner (Creator The Spirit, Comics and Sequential Art)

"The Pander Brothers paint us an emotional map that leads us through surly underworld regions of the personal and political, good and evil, without losing the way. X marks the spot!" - Gus Van Sant (Director Good Will Hunting, Drugstore Cowboy)

"THE DISSIDENT cuts to the chase in examining the existential question inherent in resistance - do the ends justify the means? The Panders have poured themselves into this work, and I toast their skill." - Joe Sacco (Creator Palestine)

"THE DISSIDENT is proof that 'comic books' have become a powerful, dimensional new literary art form." - Katherine Dunn (Author Geek Love)



THE PLAN

Remastering THE DISSIDENT in Full Color!

Originally printed under the title “XXX” by Dark Horse Comics in the mid-90s, we intended the series to be colored, but due to budget cutbacks it was released only in black and white. The 336-page narrative was written and visually researched over two years while living in Amsterdam and takes place in many historical Dutch locations. We recently obtained the original scans of the pages and now plan to fully remaster and color every page the way they were originally meant to be published, and make the comic available for everyone to read online for free throughout 2016!

Before and After!

We have been creating color tests and are thrilled to see how much life is being brought to the pages, and a sense of being transported into the streets of Amsterdam. Here are a few examples in progress.


Digital Online Premiere!

For the first time ever, The Dissident will be made available digitally through Comixology and on a dedicated website, TheDissidentDaily.com, where we will be releasing one new page every day for free.

INTERACTIVE - Explore the Actual Locations!

Many of The Dissident scenes unfold in actual locations throughout Amsterdam and Rotterdam. We will be creating hot links to Google Street-view from the web version so that you can instantly transport yourself into the various scenes and follow the footsteps of Hans in his adventure.

Click here to check it out!

It's an exciting way to explore the city of Amsterdam and the story-world of The Dissident!


REWARDS

We have a number of exciting rewards that include one-of-a-kind original paintings, as well as the original printed "XXX" series, selected graphic novels, and advanced digital copies of the remastered color edition of The Dissident.






TIMELINE / DISTRIBUTION

We plan to color The Dissident over a three month period beginning at the end of February.

World Premiere on Independence Day!

The first color page will go live July 4th on thedissidentdaily.com, with daily page releases throughout 2016.  

ComiXology

As each chapter is compiled we will also make them available through ComiXology and other digital distribution platforms.


FUNDING

We're asking for $15,000 dollars, most of which will go to the labor of coloring 336 pages of artwork. The rest will pay for designing the digital graphic novel, and building the dedicated website, THEDISSIDENTDAILY.COM. Additional costs are factored in for creating and delivering rewards.

•Coloring 

•Digital production / book design

•The Dissident website

Risks and Challenges

This is our second crowd-funding campaign. The first, our short film “Subtext”, was successfully funded and created, backers were sent regular updates and all rewards packages were delivered when the film had its festival premiere in Palm Springs.

Risks and challenges are very limited regarding the coloring and fulfillment of The Dissident. All the artwork is scanned and ready to go, so it’s just a matter if sitting down and taking the time to craft beautiful and consistent colors throughout the book. As this is a digital release shipping will be limited to physical rewards, and receipt of the completed book will be as easy as downloading a PDF.


Other Ways You Can Help :)

Social - spreading the word…


Video soundtrack by Auditory Sculpture.

story:
THE FLOCK 1 - 2 (Colorized)

Created by Scott Wilson

The 1950s "OH City" Canada, has recently been plagued with an uproar of crime. a young boomer Huck Bennett has decided to bring justice to his city. He takes on the superhero persona as The Gooseman! He is aided on his endeavours by his thirteen-year-old nephew Edward known as The Gosling and his best friend Jackie Oaks.

This series in very inspired by the following IPs; TMNT, Batman: The Animated Series, LetterKenny, and Seinfeld.  Great combo right? 

When I created this series I had the Golden Age and early Silver Age in mind.  The aesthetic of the look and feel is our primary goal.  Our color palette is going to be primary flats to give the book an old feel yet printed modern in 2021.

Yes 2021 not 2022 or 2023.  Plan to ship out to backers January 2021!

The Flock Issue#1 Cover

Artwork by Mathew Critchfield

Colors by Paul Farris.

 

The Flock Issue #2 Cover

Art by Gino Kasmyanto

Colors by Paul Farris

 

This is our very first funding campaign for The Flock series.  All funds received will be used for the growth of the series through future development.  Shown below are a list of titles that are currently in production post Issue 1&2 on this campaign.

Currently our set up for a single issue is the following.

Single Printed Issues = Colored Cover + Inside B&W.

This has been the routine currently as I work two jobs at the moment.

This is my second job!

What stage are we currently at the beginning of this campaign?

Sketched ✅

Inked ✅

Lettered✅

Colored ?

A large portion of the funds will be used to pay our hired colorist.

 

The Flock #2.6

Art by Gino Kasmyanto

Colors by Paul Farris

Each book sent to our backers will be a fully colored comic book!

What do you YOU receive if you back us?

The Gosling Package: Issues 1-2 Digital PDF $10.00

The Gooseman Package: Digital & Printed(Signed single issues 1-2) $25.00

Jackie Oaks Package: This Perk is designated for fans that would like a (3) different 11x17 posters designed by Gino and then colored by Paul. $15.00

What The Flock is this?: First time getting into The Flock series? Want to start off with #1 and see if you'd enjoy it?  We have you covered! $15.00

LCS Package: This perk is designated for Local Comicbook Shops that would like to carry The Flock on their shelves.  This package will include (5) of each issue plus (3) 11 x 17 posters for marketing in your store.  We'd like to give a huge thank you to all LCS because without you this industry wouldn't survive! $65.00

The Flock Comic Classic: Issue 1&2 Printed in Black & White (Shipped December 2020). $12.00

Each printed perk requires Shipping and Handling Fee

Stretch Goals 

$1500 - (1) 11x17 Poster signed by the creator (below)

Art by Gino/Colors by Paul

(Stretch Goals are still in production with our artists)

$2000 - Mini-Print (Good Guys); Get our artist Gino a bonus!

$4000 - (1) 11x17 Poster (Preview Issue 3) signed by the creator

$6000 - MIni-Print (Bad Guys); Get our colorist Paul a bonus!

$8000 - The Flock Issue 3: Stampede through Downtown printed and digital B&W

$12000 - The Flock Issue 3: Stampede through Downtown upgraded to colored.

 

Unlettered Issue#2 Page#2

 

Unlettered Issue#1 Page#3

The Flock Impact

This project grew with the help of the collaboration of many different people. These people include Gino Kasmyanto, Paul Farris and myself.  Again, this is my first time creating my very own comic book series, and every day has been a learning experience for me.

My first job profession is under the category of “essential jobs” and during the pandemic of Covid-19 I have been working during the day and most nights working on my second job to create a comic book I am damn proud of! 

My life goal is to become a Indie comic book writer & creator like the ones that inspire me almost every single day.  The names include Ed Brubaker, Alan Moore, Todd McFarlane, of course Stan Lee and many more! 

So far I have reached that goal at the local level in my hometown of Cleveland, Ohio.

  Issue#1 launched at the beginning of July, 2020 - Printed(B&W) and sold in 4 stores in the Cleveland area.

Issue#2 launched September 9th, 2020 - Printed(B&W) and sold in 5 stores in the Cleveland area. With positive expansion into Columbus & Toledo, Ohio.

It's a small accomplishment to my soul but I am more than proud of the growth I’ve achieved!

The Flock is an ongoing series of books.

Titles Written

#1 Rise of the Purple Hood Gang (1 of 2)

#2 Air Strike Over Oh City! (RotPHG 2 of 2)

#3 Stampede Through Downtown! - Currently being sketched & Inked

#4 Hive Minded Souls - Final draft stage

Titles Outlined

#5 The Return of the Yeti

#6 War Brothers

#7 Unification of Heroes(Name not final)

The books above are season 1 of a 3 season comic series.  

Challenges?

I am not going to say we have no risks or challenges but we are closer to completion than if we are starting from scratch.  Both books are already Inked, Lettered and Covers are colored.  Our main challenge is hitting our goal for the January 2021 release.  We have strong deadlines set in place and will be scheduled updates bi-weekly to our backers on our progression for this campaign.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share our campaign with your friends, family and co-workers if you want to help create buzz for the ongoing series.

You can join our Facebook Page - www.Facebook.com/TheFlockComic

Instagram Page - @Theflockcomix

Twitter Page - https://twitter.com/TheFlockComic

Youtube Page - https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCeFDI-KTTBJQt4...

Publisher Website - sp-comix.com

 

We will accept all comments or questions submitted through the Indiegogo page but also the social media messages.  I will read all comments and I will get back to you asap.  Please feel free to reach out to me!

Thank you for taking the time to read this page and also if you backed this campaign THANK YOU! 

List of personal Thank Yous

My brother Sean Wilson

My friend Paul Farris

My Artist and new friend Gino Kasmyanto

Both my Parents

My friends in the Indie Comic Book Scene

Caffeine

story:
***UPDATE - BACK NOW TO GET AN EXTRA COMIC WITH EVERY PHYSICAL ORDER ABOVE THE BASIC TIER***

Do you love 80's horror movies and comic books? Then you've come to the right place!

Body Trade is a 48+ page horror-themed comic with the visual styling of an old Tales from the Crypt comic and a story that will take you back to the campy fun days of 80's horror (Slumber Party Massacre / Re-Animator/ Return of the Living Dead / Big Trouble in Little China / etc).

Body Trade is Horror as Horror should be with uncompromising attention to detail and quality! The artwork speaks for itself, go on and look, it's okay. *Note: If we do not fully fund, we will reimburse all backers!*

The black market Body Trade is a dirty business - but a VERY lucrative one! Like a car, the human body is worth more when it is "parted out" - and this is exactly what our girls find out when they accidentally kill a man and need to dispose of the body.

TONE:

The over the top nature of the premise lends itself to going for gore, gore, gore so that's the direction we have gone with the comic version of BT. Movie comparison wise, I'd say it's Texas Chainsaw Massacre 2 meets a Tales from the Crypt episode -- TCM2 for the "over the top" horror and Tales from the Crypt for the cheeky humor.

The premise is played straight and isn't made light of, however as you will read below, the girls do seriously underestimate the seriousness of the situation they have gotten themselves into.

RATING:

While the premise of Body Trade is very Mature, the actual comic itself would be rated an R by movie standards. There isn't any nudity or sex in the comic -- just gore, lingerie and strong language. I'd say it's no worse than the walking dead comic for violence and language.

STORY:

The story picks up fairly quickly with the girls (Dancers/Hookers) accidentally killing a man and while trying to find a way to cover up the death learn of the lucrative black market for body parts.

Given the nature of their business, it is almost too good to pass up -- Tons of male tourists who won't be missed and sleazy men who "deserve" what they get.

Through a tissue donation business front, the girls find quick success and bite off way more than they can chew. However, the demand is never ending so they quickly expand and begin to make money hand over fist.

What our ladies don't count on are the risks of the trade, especially as they begin to draw too much attention to themselves. With success comes trouble, and the trouble the girls face is two fold -- A detective and a rival black market "gang". Who will get to the girls first? Will the girls make it out unscathed? Will their business be short lived? find out in volume one of Body Trade - Risky Business!

The story climaxes (pun intended) with a potentially disastrous turn of events that will drastically change how the girls survive their new business venture.

These are WIP pages - Dialogue and extra finishes still to be added (more blood?!)

These are WIP pages - Dialogue and extra finishes still to be added (more blood?!)

These are WIP pages - Dialogue and extra finishes still to be added (more blood?!)

These are WIP pages - Dialogue and extra finishes still to be added (more blood?!)

We need your support to produce this innovative comic book. This project is a labor of love ten years in the making. What started as a web series, then a feature script has evolved into a dream comic that we want to share with you!

All funds raised are going towards printing costs, adding pages, high quality paper stock, and paying the talented artist. Should we pass the funding and stretch goals, we will get into the trading cards and posters.

Before Stretch Goals, here's what you get:

  • 48-pages, saddle stitched, crimson colored comic

Once we get to Stretch Goals, each PHYSICAL backer will receive the following EXTRAS as we pass our goal:

  • 24K DOUBLE FEATURE BOOST
    • A brand new comic added (See below)
    • The Abaddon (48 pages)
       
  • POSTER BOOST?
  • TRADING CARD BOOST?
  • MORE WILL BE ANNOUNCED ONCE WE GET THERE

At 24K we will unlock this brand new comic and INCLUDE it with your shipment. 

The Abaddon Anthology is a 48 page comic about a motel run by the devil. Guests check in and are faced with their worst fears. Some are there to learn a lesson, others are there to take a ticket to hell. You can only "see" the hotel if you're in need of a visit!

There are 2 stories in this volume with a wrap around story featuring the "Devil Lady" you see below.
 

This cannot be done without YOU. We either make the amount needed to produce this or we reimburse every backer and try again another time.

I've been at this project for 10 years, minus a little break for the family. Now is the time to bring not one but 2 amazing horror comics to life!

The biggest risk will be the raise itself. Once we are funded it will take roughly 4 months to complete the art, then another month to print and fulfill the orders.

We will run the campaign for up to 60 days, which is the maximum allowed to try to fully fund this. Once again, if we don't raise the required amount to produce this, we will refund all orders.

Once funded, should anything arise during printing or shipping, we will be quick to alert you and update you frequently on the progress every step of the way. Nothing to hide here at all.

The more people that back this, the more rewards you get. Simple as that!

Once you've backed please share a link via social media to anyone you feel will also like this project. Lets get more pages and better stock. Lets get a brand new comic added!
story_txt:
***UPDATE - BACK NOW TO GET AN EXTRA COMIC WITH EVERY PHYSICAL ORDER ABOVE THE BASIC TIER***
Do you love 80's horror movies and comic books? Then you've come to the right place!
Body Trade is a 48+ page horror-themed comic with the visual styling of an old Tales from the Crypt comic and a story that will take you back to the campy fun days of 80's horror (Slumber Party Massacre / Re-Animator/ Return of the Living Dead / Big Trouble in Little China / etc).
Body Trade is Horror as Horror should be with uncompromising attention to detail and quality! The artwork speaks for itself, go on and look, it's okay. *Note: If we do not fully fund, we will reimburse all backers!*

The black market Body Trade is a dirty business - but a VERY lucrative one! Like a car, the human body is worth more when it is "parted out" - and this is exactly what our girls find out when they accidentally kill a man and need to dispose of the body.

TONE:
The over the top nature of the premise lends itself to going for gore, gore, gore so that's the direction we have gone with the comic version of BT. Movie comparison wise, I'd say it's Texas Chainsaw Massacre 2 meets a Tales from the Crypt episode -- TCM2 for the "over the top" horror and Tales from the Crypt for the cheeky humor.
The premise is played straight and isn't made light of, however as you will read below, the girls do seriously underestimate the seriousness of the situation they have gotten themselves into.
RATING:
While the premise of Body Trade is very Mature, the actual comic itself would be rated an R by movie standards. There isn't any nudity or sex in the comic -- just gore, lingerie and strong language. I'd say it's no worse than the walking dead comic for violence and language.
STORY:
The story picks up fairly quickly with the girls (Dancers/Hookers) accidentally killing a man and while trying to find a way to cover up the death learn of the lucrative black market for body parts.
Given the nature of their business, it is almost too good to pass up -- Tons of male tourists who won't be missed and sleazy men who "deserve" what they get.
Through a tissue donation business front, the girls find quick success and bite off way more than they can chew. However, the demand is never ending so they quickly expand and begin to make money hand over fist.
What our ladies don't count on are the risks of the trade, especially as they begin to draw too much attention to themselves. With success comes trouble, and the trouble the girls face is two fold -- A detective and a rival black market "gang". Who will get to the girls first? Will the girls make it out unscathed? Will their business be short lived? find out in volume one of Body Trade - Risky Business!
The story climaxes (pun intended) with a potentially disastrous turn of events that will drastically change how the girls survive their new business venture.

These are WIP pages - Dialogue and extra finishes still to be added (more blood?!)
These are WIP pages - Dialogue and extra finishes still to be added (more blood?!)

These are WIP pages - Dialogue and extra finishes still to be added (more blood?!)

These are WIP pages - Dialogue and extra finishes still to be added (more blood?!)

We need your support to produce this innovative comic book. This project is a labor of love ten years in the making. What started as a web series, then a feature script has evolved into a dream comic that we want to share with you!

All funds raised are going towards printing costs, adding pages, high quality paper stock, and paying the talented artist. Should we pass the funding and stretch goals, we will get into the trading cards and posters.
Before Stretch Goals, here's what you get: 
48-pages, saddle stitched, crimson colored comic
Once we get to Stretch Goals, each PHYSICAL backer will receive the following EXTRAS as we pass our goal:


24K DOUBLE FEATURE BOOST 
A brand new comic added (See below)
The Abaddon (48 pages) 


POSTER BOOST?
TRADING CARD BOOST?
MORE WILL BE ANNOUNCED ONCE WE GET THERE

At 24K we will unlock this brand new comic and INCLUDE it with your shipment. 
The Abaddon Anthology is a 48 page comic about a motel run by the devil. Guests check in and are faced with their worst fears. Some are there to learn a lesson, others are there to take a ticket to hell. You can only "see" the hotel if you're in need of a visit!
There are 2 stories in this volume with a wrap around story featuring the "Devil Lady" you see below. 

This cannot be done without YOU. We either make the amount needed to produce this or we reimburse every backer and try again another time.

story:
Your Face Here Comics is the service you need to get a Custom-made Comic crafted with The Love & Care that only the HUMAN TOUCH can provide! Determined to produce a professional quality comic in any style of your choosing: cartoonish style, manga style, superhero style, you name it! My focus is to provide a Gratifying experience for each and every one of our supporters. We will put some serious thought into your Comic & create a Sequential Art Masterpiece. Either if it is Hand drawn or Digitally Painted, with Your Face Here Comics you’ll get something unique and crafted especially for you!

What you need to provide: 

Necessary reference photos

Comic Script &/or words for Each Panel

Optional: When providing the Script/Dialogue you may or may not (it's your choice) provide a sketch drawing to be used as a storyboard/draft comic.

Example of sketch drawing with script:

Script:

Panel 1: Bob riding skateboard down the street saying "Hey Sherry, I just wanted to tell you that--"

Panel 2: Bob runs into the back of a car with skateboard saying "I'm Head over Heels for you!"

Panel 3: Bob falls on the floor head first saying "Literally" while holding a heart that reads "Sherry & Bob 4ever"

LIKE OUR FACEBOOK PAGE:  https://www.facebook.com/YourFaceHereComics/

Recent Examples of Your Face Here Comics:

 

Please contact me for additional shipping fees for original art &/or color prints for anything bigger than a postcard. 

Need more than one page? No problem! Inbox me & we'll get that taken care of

 

Sorry no NSFW comics at this time. Your Face Here Comics also has the right to refuse the following, which includes but is not limited to, pornography, obscenity, hate speech, harassment and/or anything else that might be considered harmful or that promotes or condones violence against individuals or groups based on race, religion, gender, age, nationality, etc., etc. Other than that, I'm a pretty easy going and an open minded kind of guy.

story:
A cat in a spacesuit, his partner with the mouth of a sailor, their space octopus, and a baby all walk into a spaceship...

Space Pussycat is a 4-issue, 80-page comic series written by Erica J. Heflin (Zenescope's Wonderland & Dark Shaman) and illustrated by Sean Hill (Dark Shaman) with colors by Omi Remalante, Jr.  The book is available in digital (PDF) format and in multiple cover formats, including standard (glossy cardstock covers) and foil/spot UV embossed editions!

An anthropomorphic cat-for-hire, his foul-mouthed partner, and their space-octopus-powered starship, the Pussyball, on a run-of-the-mill recovery job that unexpectedly dumps a precious - and utterly disgusting - cargo into their laps...

Pussy, 'Rina & Squidge simply want to cash in on a routine salvage cargo, but find themselves diverted by old kitty companions, sketchy business associates with sinister intentions, and the dilemma of what to do with that smelliest, most annoying of cargos...a human baby!

Our intrepid crew faces off with a starship full of vengeful kitties, fork-and-knife-wielding vagabonds and...the galaxy's biggest litter box!

The crew of the Pussyball enters final battle to save their baby human cargo from becoming dinner at a bizarre alien ritual! Can they save the stinky little angel? Do they even want to? What are we even talking about?

Store Space Pussycat in a Unique Collector's Box:

Each Box Includes:

Available in Assorted Packages:

Interior Art Preview:

(Art by Sean Hill - Colors by Omi Remalante, Jr.)

story:
STAR MISSIONS - Science Fiction Adventure/Drama 200 years in the future.

Classic Comic Book Style.  Classic science fiction for all ages. 

Space exploration was the only option mankind had left after decades of wars over Terra's remaining natural resources.  Extracting water and other minerals from asteroids and ice planets was dangerous and, many predicted, was still insufficient.  Human life on Terra seemed destined to die off, that is, until the year 2176 when two astronauts discovered a portal that led to the Strolla star system. 

"Angel's Gate" would provide renewed hope, a new beginning.   Travel to the Strolla System led to more discoveries, including the first contact with alien life.   

Soon, events take place that brings Mankind (Terrans) into an intergalactic conflict that threatens all those that live in the galaxy.  As the story unfolds, Terrans are brought deeper into their own history and make new allies and enemies.  As the story widens, the characters change and develop.  

Finding "Angel's Gate", for many, was a miracle.  They believe that mankind is destined to endure, to survive.  Could they be wrong?  Going through  "Angel's Gate" is just the beginning.  Now Terrans must be prepared for what comes next.  

This is where our story begins...
