story:
The Story So Far

For centuries, a battle has raged -- a battle that no one sees, that no one knows about. The Animal Factions War.

A semblance of peace has grown in the years since my great-grandfather, Molson the Old, defeated the villainous ectotherms, and captured their commander, the dreaded alligator, C. Yewlator. However, the time comes once again for the warm-blooded animals of the world to unite, as the great-grandnephew of C. Yewlator, Afta R. Whyle, has rekindled the flames of war.  His attempt to increase the speed of global warming, thereby making the world a more habitable place for the cold-blooded, is accelerating...

The Rundown

We've gotten 3 standard issues as well as a prologue book done, and freely available to read on the website. But life (and money) got in the way and the story wasn't able to be completed.  The scripts are done and so are the thumbnails, but the actual creating of the pages take time...But we have to eat.

One Step At A Time

So this is our plea. We'd really like to finish this story off (there are two issues and a prologue left), but we need to make it feasible for us to do that.

Right now we're just asking for some help with the fourth issue. The more donations we get, the quicker this will all be done and any leftover money will go directly onto the production of the other two books. As you can see from the website, we've been doing this for a very long time, constantly improving, and we'd love the opportunity to finish a story that has been in our heads for a very long time so that we can move onto other projects with a clean mind. 

But What Do I Get Out Of It?

The $1000 goal is the bare minimum we'd need to get back on this. It would let us take some time away from our day jobs to get this done.

But, on to the perks!

With a donation of $5 or more you'll receive digital copies of the existing comics (Prologue and Issues 1-3) as well as a digital copy of the new one in CBZ, PDF, and Kindle formats. If you haven't jumped into the world of reading comics on tablets yet, it's fantastic! Don't even need to worry about creasing pages! No bags! No boards! Just comicy goodness.

With a donation of $15 or more, you'll receive the digital copies of the existing comics, as well as a paper copy of the 4th issue!

With a donation of $25 or more, you'll receive the digital copies of the existing comics, as well as all of the comics on paper! That's right -- all of them! Bags and boards FTW!

For $50 or more, you'll get your digital copies and your paper copies, of course. But how does a signed print of your favorite panel/page sound? 8x10" Not too shabby.

For $100 or more, you'll get all of the above as well as an 11x17" signed, limited edition print. Because, really, how could you not want that?

And, of course, for $500 or more you'll get all of the above and an 11x17" signed, limited edition print, matted and framed. You'll have your choice between a few options, just in case you're picky about that sort of thing.

If, recognizing our brilliance, you decide to donate $1000, well, our hats are off to you, sir or madam. You'll get the above, but instead of the limited edition print, you'll have a one of a kind print. You want it on canvas? Sure.  We can do that.  You''ll also receive the script of the first episode of Gerard's next project, which is worth getting excited about.

Other Ways You Can Help

We've already gotten 4 books done. Help us finish the story. If you can't contribute, make some noise! We've already gotten 4 books done and you can read them online for free! Tell your friends! Shout it from the Twitters and the Facebooks!. Help us finish the story. Are you warm-blooded or not?

story:
Summary

Detective Burbon. Another. Issue 1

Hello everyone. What is our comic about? It's about Twin City police detective. The detective's without any code of conduct, manners and with his own view of good and evil. He has an unloved wife an a son who he loves a lot.  Probably he's the only person he loves. Our cop can kill easily, break the law if it's needed. He's rude, impetuous, smokes a lot and always hits the first. However, he has good crime detection and is put up with at work, but he should have been fired long time ago.

This comic is the first pilot issue. Everyone who's interested in detectives with a lot  of violence, shootings, cruelty and cynicism, who's interested in complicated detective's investigations with black humour, marked 18+ are advised to read it.

Where the Money Goes

Why do we need money?

The only thing we need money for is printing out 300 copies in a printing office. As it's going to be all in color, the printing is quite expensive. You give us money, we print out the comic, and you get a unique novel.

Why don't we say anything except the printing?

The fact is, we have already created a part of the comic for our own money and we're going to make it further. We're artists and have a lot of paints and paper. We don't need employees, we only need the money for the printing office. That's all!

What will it be in the end?

21х30 cm. - book size.

100-120 fully colored pages.


Help us create our hero's story and, who knows, maybe he'll be able to become a worthy contemporary character. We were inspired by the film  Bad Lieutenant with Harvey Keitel starring to create the comic. We thought why there are so many good characters but so few negative ones. So with your help we'll be able to redress this injustice.

story:
The world of MERAKI is a futuristic realm fused with Greek Mythology. This first story takes place in the Underworld. The stunning artwork of Minh Hằng brings legendary creatures to life in this kingdom of the dead.

MERAKI is a fantasy-adventure with Greek Gods, Genetic-Hybrids and Gay Heroes!

 

 

 

 

Our story follows Psi, as she journeys into the Underworld on a quest of the Gods, to retrieve the blood of Cronus. But the further she descends through the realms of the dead, the more she discovers the Gods are not as benevolent as she once believed. Now Psi must risk her life to save Gods she no longer trusts or face the wrath of Zeus!

story:
***BE SURE TO CHECK OUT THE AWESOME CINEMATIC TRAILER TO PISSING IN THE PUNCH BOWL IN THE GALLERY SECTION!***

WHAT THE HELL IS PISSING IN THE PUNCH BOWL?

It's 380 pages of hard boiled film festival journalism with a healthy serving of illustrated comic book action & psychedelic erotica.

Pissing in the Punch Bowl is also my first novel. It has elements of science fiction and horror. Somehow, it's even an autobiography about my life on the road and in the film world. But don't worry, it's definitely not a memoir.

Some of you may already be familiar with the book in its previous incarnation as a series of satirical narrative driven articles that were published online at www.Twitchfilm.com over the last year and a half, back when they were titled Fear and Loathing.

If you're not familiar with the series and are here afresh, this began as something of a lark when I wrote a fake spoilerific review of the Dark Knight Rises weeks before its release. The review was accompanied by journalistic coverage of the 2012 San Diego Comic Con. The material was scathing and incendiary, it was also completely fabricated.

I'll admit now that I was trolling, the purpose of the article was to irk my editor and start a flame war with the site's readers. Instead, the article was an instant success and readers were clamoring for more as was my editor.

So I began to develop further stories set at different film festivals and major media events that were based on previous personal experiences working with in the film world.

Somehow, things took a twisted turn towards the surreal and psychedelic with my first prolonged series of articles/ short stories at the 2012 Philadelphia Film Festival. Within these articles posing as film journalism, I wrote a serialized narrative that was about eighty pages long that featured a one night stand with a Craigslist hook up whose vagina served as a portal to another dimension. And while I lampooned the local film community and wrote about all of the social politics that govern the film festival scene, I also had a plot line featuring a demonic Anti-Christ concluding with a miniature apocalypse. 

I think I was the person who was the most shocked to find that people genuinely loved those articles. Not only did fans find them to be shocking and crazy, but also funny, sincere, and somehow poignant.

My editor at Twitch urged me to continue the series and I wrote an even longer and crazier narrative for Sundance in 2013. It featured celebrity orgies and terrorist conspiracies. And since I’m also an illustrative artist, I finished that series with a 12 page comic book.

My later articles for other film festivals continued to grow and evolve. What started as a joke became something much more ambitious and elaborate. Characters from previous stories started to reappear with over-reaching character arcs and plot elements that would begin at one festival only to end at another an entire year later. And as the stories became more outlandish, the themes within them became more personal, more grounded, and more emotional.

When I created a series of articles set at the Yubari Film Festival in Japan, I ended up with a sort of Madame Butterfly type love story. Only, this wasn't based on previous works of fiction, it was based on my own personal experiences living in Japan. The articles had major plot lines surrounding the Tokyo fetish porn scene and had sexual encounters with the cursed ghosts of jealous ex- girlfriends, but it was still a serious and heart tugging story of losing your first love. It became one of the darkest things I've ever written as it became a tale about a selfish man refusing to let go, who's unrealistic fantasies of cinematic notions of romance leads him on a violent and self destructive war path that hurts a lot of innocent people and comes with some big consequences.

During my series set at the Cannes Film Festival, I wrote about my run ins with a deranged serial killer named Mike Dugal.  Mike was an over the top character, a bad horror film director using a psychotropic mind control drug from Colombia to score film deals and victims. But the series was also an honest and sincere deconstruction of  horror explored the many themes of misogyny inherent with in the genre. 

My series at the Toronto International Film Festival had corrupt drug dealing cops, bike gang outlaws, and a werewolf. But it was also a tragic tale about the sins of our fathers and the complicated relationships between them and their adult sons. 

And the less said about the book's conclusion at Fantastic Fest in Austin, the better.  Things get really wild towards the end and I don't want to spoil the surprises.

Nearly two years since I began all of this, the articles have amassed to a single 380 paged narrative with over 60 pages of illustrations. And while there's a wealth of information about all of the ins and outs of the film world, the scope of the novel is much larger. This isn't just some big inside joke about the film world. It has garnered a sizable fan base outside of the usual Twitchfilm readership whom have little knowledge or interest in the film festival circuit.

WHY DO I NEED YOUR HELP TO FUND THIS?

The book is mostly finished ,and I initially had two major publishers interested in printing it. But as conventional print media crawls closer to its grave, they ultimately decided that this was too risky and difficult to market to a broader audience. I spent a lot of wasteful time pitching the book to other publishers and there always seemed to be some inkling of interest. But I realized that finding the right publisher to take this on would be a full time job and could easily take a year or two. I already have three other serialized novels outlined and ready to be written. I'm proud of Pissing in the Punch Bowl but am anxious to move on to the next project.

And that’s beauty of Indiegogo, I can reach out directly to my fans and potential fans like you, my fellow film, comic, and lit nerd brethren. Pissing in the Punch Bowl makes fun of everything you hate and It makes fun of everything you love.  You’re going to laugh out loud when you read it. You’re going to cringe, and you may just blush and have to look over your shoulder to check if anyone is watching you.

WHY SHOULD YOU SUPPORT THIS INDIEGOGO IF YOU'RE  A FAN AND ALREADY READ THE SERIES ONLINE FOR FREE?

Well, first off. I never received a single ******* penny for any of it, so come on and help a brother out. It’s hard out there for a film writer.

Second, because you’re a nerd and I understand you because I’m a nerd too. You like to own things, you like to collect rare and weird things to put in your library to show off. This is going to be a beautiful ultra cool looking book and it’s going to look great on your book shelf. And it's going to be signed by yours truly.

Third, because there’s a lot more story than what you’ve read. To this day, I still have fans asking me when and if they’ll be able to read the rest of the Yubari series.

There’s another 70 pages of material, and I think it might be my favorite of the whole book. It’s certainly the most personal and possibly the darkest. You’re finally going to get to read that.

And fourth, my online articles were a mess, they’re full of typos, grammatical errors, and strange inconsistencies. I was writing these things in line with the film festivals as they took place. That means that I was often writing one hundred pages of material in a two week time span. It’s impossible to professionally edit and proof that much content in that amount of time. It’s all being cleaned up now and it’s going to read a lot better.

And with your help, I can afford to hire a professional editor who’s going to tune this baby up so that it hums like a Hemmy.

Fifth, because you enjoy my writing and art and you want to see more of it. The truth about us awful, self centered, narcissistic artists is that we crave, nay, need validation. I have tons of new projects in development but it's hard to really get the ball rolling on those until I've finished this.

And sixth, the rewards are really really sweet.

You can win original comic page illustrations that were used in the final book.

And for my larger sponsors, there is a wide array of small to large scale original black light paintings.


And if you dig this artwork, be sure to check out my Etsy page, I have a ton of other super cheap artwork circulating out there in the internet and there's still time to order a print for Christmas (well, at least until December 21st)!

ADDED HOLIDAY INCENTIVE!

So long as we're able to raise at least $10,000 by December 25th, all of my backers up  to that point will receive a special Christmas/New Year's present. I'll be illustrating an original piece of pin up erotica just for the holidays. 

So if there's any chance that you have a friend or family member who might be a fan of my work and you're donating to my Indiegogo as a gift to them, you'll be getting an email with a high res JPEG to print out and frame yourself to let him or her know that they're getting the book soon!

WHY IS THIS SO EXPENSIVE AS COMPARED TO OTHER PUBLISHING INDIE-GOGO PROJECTS FROM FIRST TIME WRITERS?

I know that there sure are a lot of other writers on here trying to self publish their first novel, and I realize that most of them are only asking for $5000 - $10000.

It's kind of scary to be the guy asking for $20,000. But here's the thing, self publishing is really expensive.

I'm still in the process of negotiating with my printer but I expect the costs to be anywhere from $6000 - $8000 just for the printing. Shipping and handling for 1000 books plus all of the heavier rewards for the bigger sponsors will be an additional $5000.

I'll also be hiring a copyright editor and professional graphic designer for the layout and plan on painting an additional 6 pages while also hiring a professional colorist to rescan and polish up the original artwork. All of that should cost an additional $2000 - $3000.

Add in a small buffer for misc. unexpected expenditures, and the cost for printing 1000 books should end up being around $16,000. Then you have to figure in the 5% cut that Indiegogo takes and suddenly $20,000 doesn't sound like so much. Actually, it's still on the low end.

So I really do hope I can even exceed my minimum goal so that I might actually make a few dollars for my time and work and the more money that I can raise, the better the final product will be. If I can reach $30,000, I'll write an additional short story from the perspective of one of the novel's most popular characters, Uzi Silverstein. If I can reach $40,000, the book will be full of even more outlandish comic book artwork.

If I reach $50,000, I'll make hardcover editions available for any sponsors above $75.

Backers need not worry about meeting my requirements. Hey, that's why I'm asking for $20,000 right? Everything has been budgeted with a comfortable but reasonable buffer so that no one is left standing with their bits dangling in the wind. Also, as already stated, the book is finished! It just needs a good cover, a strong page layout, and a little spit and polish before it hits the printer. I expect to have all of that work finished by the end of March so that the books can be printed in April and mailed out in May and June.   There's always a possibility for delay but under no circumstances do I expect that to go beyond the end of July.

The only other major hold up would be the legal stuff. I am a first time self publisher. I'll be paying a copyright attorney to clear everything in the book and to make sure that I won't run into any weird future lawsuits when this eventually goes up for sale on Amazon and it's impossible to gauge what strange issues could arise.

And with that, I really want to thank you for giving me your time to pitch this crazy project of mine. Hopefully, you're a fan of the work. If not, then maybe you will be. Most importantly, I hope that you can support my first novel and help a struggling/starving artist get his work out there without going any further into debt.

Cheers!
Greg Christie

journalism with a healthy serving of illustrated comic book action &
 psychedelic erotica.Pissing in 
the Punch Bowl is also my first novel. It has elements of science 
fiction and horror. Somehow, it's even an autobiography about my life on the 
road and in the film world. But don't worry, it's definitely not a memoir.Some of you may already be familiar with the book in its 
previous incarnation as a series of satirical narrative driven articles 
that were published online at www.Twitchfilm.com over the last year and a half, back when they were titled Fear and Loathing. If
 you're not familiar with the series and are here afresh, this began as 
something of a lark when I wrote a fake spoilerific review of the Dark 
Knight Rises weeks before its release. The review was accompanied by journalistic coverage of the 2012 San Diego Comic 
Con. The material was scathing and incendiary, it was also completely fabricated.I'll admit now that I was trolling, the purpose of the 
article was to irk my editor and start a flame war with the site's 
readers. Instead, the article was an instant success and readers were 
clamoring for more as was my editor.So I began to develop further
 stories set at different film festivals and major media events that 
were based on previous personal experiences working with in the film 
world. Somehow, things took a twisted turn towards the surreal 
and psychedelic with my first prolonged series of articles/ short 
stories at the 2012 Philadelphia Film Festival. 
Within these articles posing as film journalism, I wrote a serialized 
narrative that was about eighty pages long that featured a one night 
stand with a Craigslist hook up whose vagina served as a portal to 
another dimension. And while I lampooned the local film community and 
wrote about all of the social politics that govern the film festival 
scene, I also had a plot line featuring a demonic Anti-Christ concluding
 with a miniature apocalypse.  I think I was the person who was 
the most shocked to find that people genuinely loved those articles. Not
 only did fans find them to be shocking and crazy, but also funny, 
sincere, and somehow poignant. My editor at Twitch urged me to 
continue the series and I wrote an even longer and crazier narrative for
 Sundance in 2013. It featured celebrity orgies and terrorist 
conspiracies. And since I’m also an illustrative artist, I finished that
 series with a 12 page comic book. My later articles for other 
film festivals continued to grow and evolve. What started as a joke 
became something much more ambitious and elaborate. Characters from 
previous stories started to reappear with over-reaching character arcs 
and plot elements that would begin at one festival only to end at 
another an entire year later.

story:
The Graphic Novel

THE LAZARUS DEVICE will be 128 pages of full colour graphic novel - every panel composed of 3D-rendered awesome (like the images on this page).

In an alternate post-Victorian world on the brink of war, a mysterious woman struggles to break the chains of duty, before they smother her.

It's a steampunk adventure that takes place in 1911, in Manchester UK, and is a tale of fantastic science, thrilling action, cynical politics, deep secrets, naive love, nightmarish truth, and terrible betrayal.

I need your help to make it become a reality.

Who am I?

My name is Steve Turnbull and I'm a USA Today Bestselling author of over 30 novels in the Science Fiction, Fantasy and Steampunk genres. I've been writing professionally (in different fields including technical magazines and screenwriting) for nearly 40 years.

While still writing novels, I recently got interested in 3D rendering using the Daz3D software, and realised I could turn my old web series script The Lazarus Device into a graphic novel. The images you see on this page, and the sample page 2 at the bottom, shows what can be achieved.

If you already know my books you can check out the FAQs to find out where this story fits, but if you don't, an important question is whether I'm any good as a writer because you need to know whether what you're going to get is going to be worth reading.

I'm only as good as my reviews, and across all my books I average 4.3 stars out of 5. Here are some sample reviews, all for different books:

"What a book. A pure original plot and unique characters."

"Great books, but I want more! Thanks for a well thought out world, the books were fast paced without wasted words."

"I'm addicted. Steve is officially my favourite author!"

"Seamlessly incorporates history with fiction and fantasy. The only thing I would have liked better is to have the books longer!"

All those exclamation marks are genuine, in fact I cut a few out.

How long is it going to take?

The final projected size of the graphic novel is 128 pages, divided into five episodes.

I'm not a full-time writer, and I'll still be producing novels, so I have to be realistic about time scales. This is not going to be a short project and at one page per week minimum, that's over two years of work. It might be quicker since some pages will take less time but let's stick with that estimate.

However, since it is in five episodes, I will release the individual episodes as we go along. As well as having updates and bonus material throughout that time.

There will be times when I do more than a page per week, but I do hope to have the occasional holiday as well.

But Steve (you may ask), you've never done a campaign for any of your books before, why are you doing this now?

Because I hit a major problem...

The process of rendering 3D images requires a powerful computer but all I have is an old laptop which is great for writing books but can't manage The Lazarus Device.

I have tried using online render farms, which can do the job, but I live in an out-of-the-way part of the UK and, to be brutally honest, my Internet connectivity stinks. It's always slow but even worse, it vanishes completely for minutes several times a day.

The amount of data I need to upload to create a scene is typically 7GB. At my internet speed that's about 7 hours uploading, and in that time my Internet will die and I have to start all over again. I honestly tried to make this work. I have spent days (and nights) just trying to upload a single scene.

Occasionally it works, but mostly it doesn't.

I can't rely on it.

So here's the deal...

I would like you to help me buy a state-of-the-art render machine so that I can make The Lazarus Device a reality. And, in return, you get to see it first (plus any extras I might come up with as we go along).

 At the very least, a PDF you can print out, or a print copy in soft/hard cover, and even ones signed by me.

The story is fully planned out. The only thing stopping it from progressing is the lack of 3D rendering. If I can't get a machine I can use, it can't happen.

The Render Machine

Let's look at the technical specs of the machine I need.

When it comes to using the Daz3D software, or any 3D rendering package, you need to max out on storage and power. Storage because the files tend to be very big, and power to make the rendering happen fast enough. I have to balance those features against overall cost (I could have chosen a machine that's over three times the cost of this one, but it wouldn't be three times faster).

Processor: Intel® i9, 10 Core

The number of cores indicates how much work the machine can do simultaneously. This is a beast of a processor and will handle the task well.

Memory (RAM): 32GB

This is the minimum to do what I want sensibly. As a rule the more RAM you have the better.

Storage: 4TB

As I mentioned, we need lots of storage because the files can be very big. This is good amount to start with.

Graphics card: 11GB Nvidia GeForce RTX 2080 Ti

This is the most important element because it's the unit that performs the 3D rendering and there are reasons why it needs to be this specific card. The Daz3D software uses "Iray" rendering, and that only works on an Nvidia card.

When it's doing the rendering the whole file is loaded onto the card, so the onboard memory needs to be as much as possible. Only the 2080 Ti has 11GB, earlier cards have less and are slower.

So those are the important parts of the package. There are other things like cooling, motherboard and the power supply but I won't list them here.

What will it look like when finished?

Every page is based on a 3x3 panel grid and will be full colour. This is what page 2 looks like.

If this is a story you'd like to hold in your hands and read. Choose your perk to help make it a reality.

Tell your friends!

Even if you can't contribute directly, it would be really great if you could help get the word out by using the Indiegogo share tools (yay).

Where are those share tools? They're up there at the top on the right, under the Funding section.

story:
The Creators

We are BJorn (BJ, Bear), Lauren and Harrison - proud graduates of Reve Academy! We are the creators of Chrystalis of Hope!

BJorn,19.  I love Anime and drawing comics. I enjoy clay sculpting and listening to music. I also love to explore and go on bike rides.

Lauren, 19. I love drawing, listening to music, animals (pugs) and bugs. I also love lightning and thunderstorms!

Harrison, 16. I love video games.

The Backstory

Our comic book follows Aiyanna Winoma (a teenage girl with Autism) who accidentally gets transported to an alien bug planet. She helps a young  alien-like butterfly to become protectors of Chrystala. They go on an adventure to recover a stolen light of the blossoming orb. While combating evil, they must navigate to overcome the obstacles of emotion.

Why Our Campaign is Important

We do not often see autistic characters in the media and when we do, they are often misrepresented. We are hoping to bridge the gap with a comic book character that shows an accurate description of autism and create better knowledge in how to help friends and family who have it.

What this Campaign will help us Achieve 

Representation across different types of disability

Knowledge that will help others that are unaware globally about what autism 'means'

We will also be able to share the word of Neurodiversity Novels at the local Minneapolis Metacon comic event.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share the word about Neurodiversity Novels with friends and family.

Ask your local comic book store to start carrying Neurodiversity Novels and/or "Chrysalis of Hope" graphic novel.

story:
Originally known as “Goulds”, this comic has been a passion project of mine for well over 3 years. Through that time the format of Analog Farm constantly changed, from originally being a comic, to the pilot of an animated tv show, to back to a comic. But one thing that never changed was making it a story about a boy named Mikey and his journey to develop in a world that no longer cannot.

My name is Bryan Noko, I'm the co creator and writer/designer for Analog Farm. Me along with co creator and art director Kenron Toqueen (Nocta, Tomatita) have spent the last 3 years creating a world inspired by Anime, hip hop, Cuba, and overall development. 

This comic takes place in a fictional country known as Goulds, which is heavily inspired by Cuba due to my influence of the culture from growing up in Miami.

 

The comic is centered around the theme of development and focuses on a young anime protagonist known as Mikey Manzueta

His main goal is to develop into something more, and while his peer and mentor Gori (a young shaman plant enthusiast) 

 

suspects he's talking about developing his body, he really means he wants to develop into something more original.

Analog Farm plays with tropes established from Shonen Jump protagonist (Goku from DBZ, Luffy from One Piece, Naruto from Naruto) and experiments with them to create something new. We love these tropes and were inspired by them when we were young so we want to play with the formula and start from something established and through that create something new by adding more original ideas such as Cuban and Miami Culture. This is why so many hip hop visuals are scattered throughout the comic 

Since Hip Hop originated from taking old media such as old records and creating something new with them like Mixtapes and remixes. This whole comic works as a somewhat meta commentary on what development is and what truly is original. 

The entire first issue was created through a labor of love and took three years to produce due having to pay out  of pocket and months of preproduction work. However now that the script is finished and we finished all our preproduction, all that's left is to make the pages. You can currently read the first issue of the comic for free at Analogfarm.com or on instagram on @Analogfarm. 

What We Need & What You Get

Our current goal is $5,500, with this money we could afford to pay our main artist Kenron as well as cover all our expenses such as backer rewards, taxes, platform fees, etc.)

and if our first goal is met we also have plans to do much more if we can meet our stretch goals

with all this money being invested we also want to give back to our backers by giving them rewards that show our appreciation. this would include backer exclusive shirts, signed artwork, backer exclusive posters, and much more.

 

Risks & Challenges

Since we're going with the flexible funding route we would still be able to eventually put out issue two with whatever funds we end up with. However due to the platform fees being higher if we don't reach our goals and having to pay the rest of the funds out of pocket it would take much much longer to distribute the final product. That's why the main risk is time, if we can't reach our first goal we would still aim to tell the best story we can tell with our available resources, but it would just take a lot longer to produce.

Other ways you can help

We understand not everyone can donate, so don't worry if you can't pledge this year. We're still very grateful for all the support you've all given us these past three years. Even sharing this campaign to your friends and family would be just as good as a donation. thank you so much for the support and remember to break through your shells.

story:
For most warriors on the world of Awa, fighting the Nekros is about survival and honor, for Mathias it’s about revenge. Six years ago, the demon was responsible for the death of his father. Now the demon has returned wreaking more havoc than ever. As Mathias embarks on this journey, he discovers the hidden link between the gods they worship and these Nekros that have killed so many. Wading through webs of lies and misguided motivations, Mathias must figure out who he can trust in his journey to defeat the beast.

Fans of the classic man vs. monster story: Those who enjoy the mixture of thrill and fear of “Alien”, “Predator”, or “Attack on Titan”

Fans of mythological fiction: Awa is stoked in it’s own deep mythology filled with legendary beasts and demons similar to “Clash of the Titans” or the “Percy Jackson” series

Fans of well written stories with a diverse cast of characters and amazing art

The first issue of The Nekros is nearing completion as we speak, this Kickstart is to fund the print run of Issue #1.

What if we go over? While a portion of additional money will go into covering the cost of printing and shipping the books, the Kickstarter will also help the continued production of the first 8 issues that make up the first book. Our goal is to release these 8 issues over the next 2 years.

We released a free preview on GlobalComix and recieved stellar reviews. It is currently a featured project on GlobalComix with over 2k views. Please check it out for yourself.

 

Risks and Challenges

This issue of the Nekros is already complete. This is just our way of getting this issue to you. 

With that said, there may be some unforeseen delays with shipping due to the pandemic. To limit risk, we are only shipping to the US during this campaign, but will look to expand this in the future.

story:
Everything is done for this comic book! I just need to send it to the printer.

Hazel, a pre-teen girl living in suburbia, is having a typical, boring evening when she’s startled by the premonition of a dragon awakening from a centuries long nap

As surprised as she is by the vision, she’s absolutely shocked when her cat, Mooney, opens his mouth and tells her that he too had the same premonition.


Mooney knows of only one man brave and mighty enough to go toe to toe with
 a dragon, the mighty warrior, Beowulf. Unfortunately, he's been reincarnated as this guy...

Victor's an unemployed millennial slacker who can't even get his life together much less slay a dragon.

Can Mooney and Hazel prepare Victor for the battle of a lifetime?

Beowulf is an epic tale that spans centuries, with heroes and villains fighting across time itself. Characters who are heroes in one lifetime may end up villains over the centuries. Lovers in one lifetime may become sworn enemies in the next.

If this all sounds overwhelming. Don’t worry — there’s also a lot of humor.

Sample pages below. All art by Antonio Brandao, Grant Lankard, and Roy Moon:


Not only is issue #1 completely done, issue #2 is over half done. The first 6 issue arc is already written so this is not a one and done situation. As long as this issue is funded, you don't have to worry about the story being left unfinished!

Positive reviews:

Geek Awakens

Dempsey Blackmore

X-Men Speculation

Big Glasgow Comic Page


 

Risks and challenges

Uh, this comic book is all done. Seriously, I just need to send it to the printers. Even if I die, I'm pretty sure somebody could get on my computer and figure out how to send it to the printer. There's like no risk with this comic.

story:
Summary

"Star: Lost in the Shadows is the story of Star, a master of Dark Elemental Energy.  She is a skilled assassin who works for the corrupt mayor of Opal, an underground mining city district of the mega city of Porteeva.  Star longs to find new purpose in life, but finds herself trapped, bound by an old promise to a childhood friend that she made many years ago."

Opening Pitch

Help support Star: Lost in the Shadows, the first story from the Brawler Kings universe!  This is a Light Novel (Short Story), Audiobook, and OST (Original Soundtrack).

 

Strawberry Hill Music

Our music production for all Voice Acting, Vocals, Music, and Sound Effects is being handled by Strawberry Hill Music in Novato, California.  They are a top tier production studio handling all aspects of audio for various anime and game productions.  They work with some of the best names in the business and deliver top quality results!

https://www.strawberryhillmusic.com/

What is Brawler Kings?

Brawler Kings is a cyberpunk fantasy universe where fighters compete in a city wide tournament in teams to be named the city’s champion Brawler Kings and Queens.  In a harsh world full of monsters, mechs, and the ability to use elemental powers, the Brawler Kings Tournament serves to cultivate great talent for the city of Porteeva’s defenses against monster invasion all the while giving competitors the opportunity to gain immense wealth and prestige.  Competing in the tournament is the chance to fight for one’s own destiny in a harsh world that revolves around survival.

Brawler Kings Light Novel Project: 01

Star: Lost in the Shadows is the beginning of the Brawler Kings universe. It is a short story about Star Greyson and her journey before participating in the Brawler Kings Tournament as a Brawler Queen.

Recommended for Mature Readers

Director & Writer

Artists


Voice Actors

Composers

Art Team Bios

zero-two:  Lead Character Concept Designer

Designing the heroine, Star and designing orthos (character turnarounds) of her and her costumes.

Shycocoa:  Cover Illustrator

Illustrating the cover for the Light Novel.

Letta:  Character Illustrator

Illustrating the heroine for key illustration art and promotion.

Yosk6000:  Portrait Artist

Illustrating additional poses of Star in order to explore her personality and character.

Oliver Medak:  Exterior/Interior Concept Designer

Designing the buildings and interior spaces involved in the story.

Mimoza:  Intimate Illustrator

Illustrating an intimate moment of Star from the story.

Max Berthelot:  Character Ultimate Illustrator

Illustrating Star using her Dark elemental powers.

Le Yamamura:  Monster Concept Designer

Designing the monsters of the Brawler Kings universe.

Zak Foreman:  Mech Concept Designer

Designing the mechs of the Brawler Kings universe.

Yuan Z S:  Vehicle Concept Designer

Designing the vehicles of the Brawler Kings universe

story:
The names of the Holiday Hooligans strike fear into the hearts of Holiday party goers everywhere during the Christmas season.  Most of the Hooligans are bent on avenging their fellow fallen foodstuffs from the horrible humans that have consumed them.  Only Karate Kane with his amazing skills and heart filled with a love of the holidays can save us all.

Thank you for checking out my campaign.  My name is John Graham and I am a writer of unique chidren's comics and books.  

One November years ago I participated in an event called The 30 Character Challenge and it was during that time that the Holiday Hooligans were born.  I don't consider myself a great artist, so I asked the amazing Mitch Heslop to help bring my comic stories featuring these characters to life.  I published a special origin issue featuring Ninja Bread Man, Brute Cake, and Karate Kane in 2011 and received lots of great feedback about the characters.

This campaign will help the most recent story, "Twas The Hooligan Before Christmas", become published.  As a way to welcome new fans of the characters, this story will be published in a flip book format with the main story read one way and then origin stories of the characters read when you flip the book over.  

Two separate covers help folks feel like they have two comics for the price of one and kids will never tire of reading or just looking at the pictures of these unique characters.

Help me bring these characters to life

I'm partnering with IndieGoGo to help raise money for the printing of the comic and the prints in time for this holiday season.  My hope is to raise enough money to allow me a larger print run so I can share this story with more people into next year.

The Hooligans comic is ready to go, just waiting for the funds to print copies.  I have already done some test printings to ensure the book looks good as you flip it around to enjoy multiple stories.  Along with the comic book, the special prints of these fun characters will be great as your holiday decorations.

Here are the different prints available.

My goal is to have these products available to you in time for Christmas gift giving, so don't miss your chance to enjoy these family friendly items this year.

As a special bonus for your support, many perk levels include my Christmas children's book, No Sweets For Santa and my waterproof bath book, Bath Time Safari.  

No Sweets For Santa follows Santa as he promises not to eat sweets on Christmas Eve.  He travels the world, getting hungrier and hungrier until he finds a special house that leaves him pizza instead of cookies.  This full color story book includes a pizza recipe, song lyrics, and many other "presents" in the pages.  It's a great way to start a new tradition today.

Bath Time Safari is an interactive waterproof book that kids can take in the tub with them.  The special paper qualities allow bath crayons to be used to check off the steps of bathing to make bath time structured and fun.  This book is great for toddlers, new parents, and children with special needs.

Why I need your help

I love to write and bring these unique characters and stories into the world.  Your support gives me the motivation and ability to keep going and continue to share them with kids around the world.  When I originally joined the 30 Character Challenge, I didn't think I would have to draw and when I found out it was needed, I almost backed out.  I have devoted two pages in this comic to explaining my journey to other young creators, helping them understand that their apprehension should never keep them from trying something new.  These characters sprung to life because I didn't give up and I want others to know that the same can happen to them.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have the ability to contribute, I completely understand and hope that you will help the campaign by spreading the word.  Take a moment to paste this page's link into your Facebook or Twitter feed.  Tell your friends about the characters and book, sending them to my website at www.FIGIDPress.com to learn more.

Look through the options that Indiegogo provides for sharing also and utilize those.  I'd even be happy with a quick note saying you like what I'm doing and should keep it up.

story:
WHO ARE WE?

Adam and Makana Wallenta are the creators of PUNK TACO. Along with our friends Gabriel Mayorga and Lea Jean Badelles, we are artists who love to tell fun stories that inspire the imaginations of young and old alike.  Adam has been working as an illustrator and professional comic book creator for more than 20 years and this is Makana’s 2nd book. 

WHO IS PUNK TACO?

Punk Taco is a lovable sentient taco who rocks out across the universe with his band of misfits, fighting evil and helping those in need. Punk Taco believes in peace and love but has no tolerance for bullies and tyrants, so when he sees an injustice, he can't resist helping and joining in the fight. 

He loves his friends and considers them family, and will do anything for them. His empathy and compassion for others and his willingness to sacrifice himself to help the downtrodden is legendary.

Check out the official PUNK TACO Theme song. Written and Produced by Adam Wallenta and ICBM. Performed by ILLUS and RoXXXteady. Wouldn't PUNK TACO make a great animated series? 

 

VOLUME 2: THE STORY

Punk Taco and the band were on their way to a gig when we last saw them in the Volume 1 Epilogue, when a giant hand reached through a mysterious portal and whisked them away. Volume 2 picks up immediately after that and thrusts our hero and his friends into a dangerous new adventure to save a planet endangered by a greedy syndicate that is mining not just the resources, but also the very life essence of the planet itself. Punk Taco must join forces with a coalition of tribes to prevent an environmental disaster, but the problem is, they are the size of ants compared to the giant that threatens their planet. What’s a taco to do? 

THE MISSION

Punk Taco Volume 2 is a continuation of Volume 1, and picks up where we left off in the epilogue. The book is penciled and we are inking and coloring each page now. 

All of the money raised will go to cover the cost of production and printing an "8.5x12" hardcover with spot varnish and full-color interior pages, as well as shipping costs. 

This campaign was originally successfully funded on Kickstarter but we really only raised the minimum and really want to go further and invest more into the production of the book as well as the rewards and stretch goals. 

STRETCH GOALS!

If we can raise $7,500.00, we will be able to produce an original set of PUNK TACO Trading Cards and every backer who pledges $25 or more will get a FREE set.

If we can raise $10,000.00, we will be able to produce an original PUNK TACO coloring book with an all-new story and every backer who pledges $25 or more will get a FREE copy.

Check out these sample pages of PUNK TACO Volume 2! 

Risks and challenges

There are no risks. If we do not meet our goal- you will not be charged a penny. If we meet our goal- the book will be completed and you will get your rewards no matter what. 

There are delays at times and unexpected events that occur. So the delivery date can change but I always deliver. I have a solid 100% track record and I always openly communicate with everyone and keep everyone up to date on progress and delays.

I respect your hard earned dollars and I appreciate everyone that supports what I do. I will never betray that trust or support.
story_txt: WHO ARE WE?Adam and Makana Wallenta are the creators of PUNK TACO. Along with our friends Gabriel Mayorga and Lea Jean Badelles, we are artists who love to tell fun stories that inspire the imaginations of young and old alike.  Adam has been working as an illustrator and professional comic book creator for more than 20 years and this is Makana’s 2nd book. WHO IS PUNK TACO?Punk Taco is a lovable sentient taco who rocks out across the universe with his band of misfits, fighting evil and helping those in need. Punk Taco believes in peace and love but has no tolerance for bullies and tyrants, so when he sees an injustice, he can't resist helping and joining in the fight. He loves his friends and considers them family, and will do anything for them. His empathy and compassion for others and his willingness to sacrifice himself to help the downtrodden is legendary.Check out the official PUNK TACO Theme song. Written and Produced by Adam Wallenta and ICBM. Performed by ILLUS and RoXXXteady. story:
Are you ready for some Doug on Doug action? Our good friend Douglas has agreed to get a tattoo of Doug Funnie on his ass if we paid for it. We are not stupid enough to ever spend that much money on such a thing,  (nor get a tattoo of Doug Funnie on our ass), but we'll willingly chip in 5 dollars, and we figured we could easily get 100 other people to chip in $5. Please contribute to the Douglas of all Douglases by giving him the stupidest, but possibly greatest, tattoo of all time. 


This tattoo will honor the longstanding legacy of Doug Funnie and his achievements in life, Doug would be 33 years old today. RIP Doug Funnie.


Your money will always only be used if Douglas actually gets the tattoo. Making this risk free and completely worth your time.
